Welcome to the new board! Arkonviox.com moved to a new server, so we now have this new board. Sorry that the old discussion was lost. I've done quite a bit of updating to the Ecco 2 Beta site, and fixed every broken image and link (I think.) There is new information on the "Mystery Levels", including information about how they display VRAM data (causing differing results each time the level is loaded), added a new image to that page, corrected various cosmetic aspects of the site, fixed every broken image in the Levels pages, uploaded Histronic's version of the Levels 11-18 guide, and more.I hope you like the new content! NOTE)-- Deven GalloEcco 2 Beta Web Site Administrator

Looks like I'm the first to put a character bio in right here. The Orca Caller, whose true name is Cariu, is a regular trasient Orca with an extraordinary talent; to be able to control and morph into the elements, like fire, wind, ice, and others. Her history is quite grim...she's been cast out of her pod for refusing to attack and eat any cetacean. Her life was saved by a dolphin, but her pod attacked it anyway. She now lives as a loner Orca, telling stories of the sea and disappearing as if she were a ghost. She's involved in her own story, which I'll put up when I'm finished with the first book (it's a trilogy).Like I said before, you can do with my character what you will. :)

If this sounds familiar, its because I copied it from another post.Artreus, MaleDesciption: Bottlenose dolphin. Slighty blue tinted. Four-pronged star on his mellon. He is friendly, though is hesitant to become close with anyone do to events in his past. He has had dealings with several species, so is welcome to new ideas. He is considered somewhat faster than most dolphins, and has the ability to shift to the form of an orca, again bearing the star. This shifting ability is rarely used due to the discomfort it causes. He appreciates being alone and has a few close friends. I'll let you play with him however you see fit.

Thank God I saved my story!!! o.oKitnee grew up as being one of Ecco's best friends, always accompanying him on his little treasure hunts and childish games. Once Ecco became older, he started his grand adventures. But Kitnee always kept in touch with him. After the first battle with the Vortex, Ecco returned to his good friend and introduced her to the Asterite. Kitnee was awed by the supreme being and wanted to help protect it. So Kitnee became the Asterite's protector. However...One dark day, the Vortex came again. Fighting for her own safety, Kitnee hid in a small alcove in the Asterite's cave. She watched in horror as the Asterite was destroyed, its last two globes hidden away, cursing herself, for she was not strong enough to fulfill her promised duty as Asterite's Protector. After the Queen and her cronies left, Kitnee swam as fast as she could KitneeSpecies Hrm...a few years younger than EccoGender Ah...I'm sure you know of my picture of Kitnee.Reaction to the Atolm Kitnee is friendly generally, but is wary when approaching or meeting someone she hasn't seen or met before.Abilities: Speed is not Kitnee's forte, although she can swim pretty fast for an orca. She's also very smart. Given the same ability as Ecco to breathe underwater by the Asterite, Kitnee also has a powerful sonar that can blast through rock.

Three CrystalsIt is a collaborated piece that took over a month to plan, sketch, finalize, ink, and colour between Draconafin and myself. She accidently foddied up Whitefin's colours on her past form *first ever form, which is just black and white* but tis cool. We had alot of fun making past and present forms for Trellia, and Future forms for Whitefin and Draconafin. ive asked this question b4 on gametalk.com (and thats how i found out about this site).ive been playing ecco 1 on my old sega megadrive and im stuck on a level called city of forever. on the pc, this is level 21, im not sure about the number of it on the MD. anyway, ive tried using a walkthru i found on the net for this level. it sez to go all the way to the right and sonar a statue, then head left and find a hidden tunnel that shoots you upward into wat appears to be a kinda pond. the walkthru sez that here there should be a ring that teleports me to the time machine. just my luck, there isn't one. ive tried getting body of water thats highter up but i don't seem able to get enough altitude. to gain speed wat i do is swim fast up out of the water and then swim along the bottom and jump out of the water on the other side, then, using the speed i get i swim fast allong the bottom and come shooting out of the water at high speed, but all i seem to do is bonk the legde on the way down. is there sumthing im doing wrong? should the ring be where i am? does the nearby glyph do anything to help? am i just out of luck?thanx in advance for any help (even if it is just to say 'dude, your out of luck!')

umm this is VERY off the topic, but there IS a reason why sonic is blue (other than the 'blue paint' theory). Dr. kintobor was messing around with these chaos emeralds one day and he blew himself s***less. the explosion made him into dr. robotnik (the baddy that sonic is fightin). the explosion also souped up a pair of sneekers that just happened to be near by. Sonic (who to start with was brown and very spikey) finds these and tries them on and zooooom off he goes. when he reaches t supa sonic speeds the boom and the heat given off makes sonic blue hot. now the question is, why didn't sonic return to his original colour once he cooled down? i don't think he ever cools down enough coz hes always zipping up and down all day long.well maybe that ended years of staying up at night pondering the quetion. or maybe it shows to you people wat kind of a life i leed.oh by the way, i would like to aknowlegde my girlfriend's lil bro, Morgan who enlightened me on the subject of Sonic's 'Blueness'.

Yeah, I remember that bit. What you're doing is the way to go. It just takes awhile to get the angles and such right. And then you find-guess what-another pool. Or two. I myself did the level on an emulator, so I had the advantage of saving and going back at my liesure. It takes practice and patience, but it can be done.

The intructions on there are quite correct except for the part where you got shooted to a pond, I have not encountered that. A good way to find the opening is that before you sonar the statue glyph that there is some sort of green block that does not allow you to go through. When you go and sonar the staute glyph, go back to where this green block once was and go through the wall, it should take you a room with a teloport ring and a place of air. I hope this makes sense to you. Good luck!

well, there are plus sides and negative sides when it comes to doing art together. Pros being that you can share your art with someone, and that alllows unique styles to merge. ^_^cons include people screwing over your artwork, something that has happened to me a few times. But i believe it is the level of trust you give to a person to allow them to do a drawing with you.Personally, i think that this is a small reason to make to make a big fuss over with. My best friend and I are like sisters too and it does not bother us one bit, who cares what others say right? That does not matter at all.I kinda wish i can do the collbrated art again.BTW Cally, congrats on making it into Elfwood! I told you you can do it!

ok. I'll guide you from the beginning of the level. At the very beginning of city of forever, go all the way to the right, (ignoring the current that takes you upward to another pool), there will be a path that allows you to go up. do that and you will encounter a green block that has yellow stripes. now continue upward to encounter a type of fork path, take the path on the right and go to the very upper right corner and you will encounter a statue glyph, sonar it and it should say something like "access granted" doing that, go all the way back to where the green block once was, it should be gone, revealing a secret path that takes you to the teloportation ring and a air pool. The ring will take you to the time machine. I hope this will work out. ^_^

it is simple. even a retard can figure it out.

Hurling unprovoked obscene insults at someone, insinuating or continuing a flamewar, etc. Anyone who violates these rules may have their posts deleted and ultimatly have their posting rights suspended to give them a chance to calm down.Policy 3 1. No signature graphics over 100px high, and no more than 450 to 466px wide. 2. In text signatures, please use no more than 4-5 lines. Signatures that violate the specifications will likely be removed without warning.

Good start. First thing I would say is straighten those dolphins out. Bending limits on that spinal collumn is something to the effect of -5 to +10 degrees off horizontal datum. Observe that, and smoothly flex the peduncle, and you'll end up with much more interesting dolphins that preserve the overal fluidity of the artwork. Try not to flex more than one direction per plane, etc.

I dont get that many requests either, but if you need a pic, I'll try my best to do one. ^_^

I remember doing that project, I did two orcas. ^_^So far you are off to a good start, but do a color render please, that would be much more helpful than a pencil one.

Ah thank you! I would also like to say that another reason why I like to show my art is that if there is anything wrong with the pic, please let me know. Sometimes the bad stuff actually allows me to be a better artist. ^_^Do not hesitate to say anything!

ECCO SCRAMBLED WORDS IS BACK !!!The most famous Ecco related game of the forum is now available again ! For the persons who have never played, or forgotten the rules, this is a brief help?In this game, you have to form anagrams with words coming from the Ecco world, so medusa bay --> ayeusmadb (2 words)When someone finds the word, she/he can form an anagram.If no one finds it, you have to give a clue, pass your tour, or change your word.Is it okay ?Then, let's play !falpiuereutpytild (2 words)

The comic is in the drawing state. I am creating characters, and backgrounds. I have the story done. Arkonviox, Phosis, Crestoe, Yogoat, and Silverfin are all too poor to afford a house. So They seek comfort in the Darkseas Hotel, run by the Evil landlord, Dolphin. They beg dolphin for help, and he accepts, on several conditions. So the five Admins all survive in the apartment, and carry out there hilarious lives. Phosis is the innocent scapegoat of the group, who is constantly smiling, and takes all the shit. Crestoe is a slacker, who is constantly high, and does nothing for anyone. Arkonviox lives out his dream of making his ultimate webpage, and smacks everyone around, until Dolphin comes. (He is deathly afraid of dolphin) Yogoat is barely at home, and is usually dealing with illegal business. Silverfin just sort of sits around, watches anime, and the group has many cultural complications with him. (He speaks excellent english in real life, but in the comic, this is not so.) And Dolphin is a massively huge dolphin, and you only see his head, or fin, at any given time. He comes in occasionally, pestering the group, and why they are doing nothing with their lives, then proceeds to beat him. Alastor is there as well, occasionally, showing up as a yellow dolphin who doesnt do or say much. He just comes in and eats all the food, to the objection of no one but arkon. Thats about it. Excpect some of you to make guest appearences, so you can be made fun of as well. It is going to be a good time. You should see the first issue pretty soon, before november 18th

Well, since no one posted anything here yet, I decided to tell all the administration about whats going on with my project. I am doing a comic, as most of you people know, about our "adventures" in #Darkseas chat. It is going to be a weekly strip eventually, the first few months dedicated to pilot strips. Just to see how everything goes. The main plot, is that there is 5 admins. Phosis, Arkon, Crestoe, Yogoat, and Silverfin. They have all run low on money, because they wasted their lives working on Arkonviox.com, which fell to the evil powers of Psysonic. Without money, or homes, they all moved intogether, in an apartment called Dark seas, run by the evil overlord Dolphin.Without money, they gave the only thing left to dolphin; their souls. Dolphin is kind of like Satan in the comic, and harrases them constantly. Arkonviox continues to work on the site, and try to regain his place on the web. Phosis does absolutely nothing, just plays video games, and complains. Crestoe sits around and smokes pot all day, while yogoat is always out doing illegal things. Silverfin can barely speak english, and makes stupid ass jokes, which he thinks are hilarious. (Your not like that in real life, Silver, but in this comic, you are)Alastor does what he does on Darkseas. He just comes in, loiters, annoys everyone, consumes our resources, then leaves again without a word.There will be guest appearences from different members of this site, but the main story is about all of us admins. Im hoping to throw the Moduvator in there occasionally as well. Crestoe knows all about the first strip, and the only things exclusive to my sight are the drawings.Im hoping to make a section seperate from Arkonviox.comics for this one, for a couple reasons.1) It is going to be made from scratch, and comes out weekly.2) NO ONE takes advantage of the comics section anymore.Anyways, I just thought you should know. So once arkon has everything straightened out, and we can make sections again, it will be around. Arkon: For now, I am requesting that I have some place to put the comics for now. I will send you all the finished comics, if you can just slap them on a page when they are done. Or better yet, you can show me how...If its possible.-Phosis out.

Ok...I'll try not to flood their PM boxes XD. Sending request.... Kori always takes longer than..I think his name is John XD...how pitiful of me not to remember his name XD.Check this one out for somemore that he made...http//korihanasaku.tripod.com/gijutsu.html

I officially despise IGN.com. Let me tell you why.It started out, a fabulous site. It was mostly dedicated to N64 when I found out about it, in the lunchroom at school. So, I went into the library at lunch one day, and found a bunch of obese, happy kids, sitting around there computers, ALL looking at this site. I was amazed! Could a website really be so good? So I tried it. And this, my friends, ended my need to buy video game magazines.Free reviews, free pictures, free movies...and DOZENS of them, for every single game that was reviewed. I could get the scoop about what was going down in Japanese gaming, and what was happening over here. It was, in a couple words, the shit. I have followed IGN ever since, and watched their review, and user friendly qualities, heavily decrease.Why has it gotten so bad? I never kept up with the IGN crew, but back in the day, they had some damn fine reviews. Games were reviewed the same way, but seemed so much more FAIR...If the game was fun, it got a good score, with only slight downfalls if the graphics or sound weren't too good. Now, we have a bunch of dumb, lazy fucks, that will completely flame a game, giving it a score of 5, because the presentation wasn't very good, and it might not last a long time to play.Then we have this IGNsider bullshit. I was fine with it at first. The company has to make some money, okay. But I am not going to pay subscription fees to look at a few game reviews. Insider was leniant at first. Pay some money, get some exclusive videos. okay, cool. Now look at the downfalls.1) no more free reviews, until a week after they are out...at least not for GOOD games.2) Pictures are also locked away, and you can only see 5 of them until your limit for the day is up.3) Movies work the same as picturesSo why the hell waste your money to read a couple of stupid reviews? From people that don't know what the fuck they are talking about, and rate games on presentation? Look at the most recent gamecube review, of the sonic mega collection. 4 for graphics. Well, no shit. What the hell, did you think it was going to look like metroid prime now? Thats unfair, for a collection of old games. They should have rated it on how well gamecube EMULATES it, not how bad the games look now. Same goes for sound. And lasting appeal? a 7? With all those games, and extras? These people have gone out of their fucking minds. Read some reviews, if they are not LOCKED, and see what I mean. IGN has turned into a heartless mega corporation of disgruntled gamers, and no one needs to support them. If you want to read a review, ask someone who owns the game. At least you will be getting it straight from someone who actually knows a thing or two about what a good game is.-Pho out.

Since my thread was closed due to no reason that I'm able to see, I no longer have any real reason to live anymore. That is, live as in visiting this forum. Which is kind of sad, since there were some cool people here: Shadow, who knew more trivial lore and had a stronger tendency towards the unimaginably strange than any example I can think of now, Artreus, who was generally positive, helpful and made a lot of sense, Eoraptor, who made it to my signature at Apolyton for a while with her ramble about how cows should be eaten and dolphins not and finally vantid, who is the only artist I know who is great at both visual art and stories.Not to mentiont he CoC crew who were almost as good as making a forum full of discussions the length of a metric library of congress with about five words per post as the Istvanistani.Besides, after digging up a few perversions that my unconscious mind has weirdened to the level of being quite unpublishable, I think it's good for me to just stay away from this whole dolphin thing for a while... So... next time somebody posts a pun with the word "goatse" in it, remember Slashdot!* picks up a virtual .357, loads it with virtual bullets, raises the virtual gun against his virtual forehead and embeds one of the virtual bullets in his virtual brain *

Stop your whining. That topic was completely useless. First you put it in the Arkonviox.com section, shaming everyone there, and making us all more retarted. If your going to post, make it useful. Not some shit about yogoat, and that wierd site with the guy spreading his ass. Your leaving because your useless topic was taken down? Give me a break. I dont have much to say to this, because your freaking out over some retarted shit. If there is a useless topic, with no reason for existing, and no knowledgable, remotely interesting replies, it is taken down. Do what you want, but you have no reason.

Thats right. As said to Ari earlier, if a topic has no point in existence except to inform the other readers that the member "Likes pie" then there is no need for it. If you have something remotely interesting to discuss, go ahead. Sure, you can joke around, and make puns all you want in your post. But if your post is a line, and has nothing to do with anything, then what is the point? So a few people can reply with even less asking what the fuck you're talking about? Talk about something interesting. If you feel the need to risk your topic being locked by making it stupid and pointless, then at LEAST put it in off topic, where it belongs. Ecco The Dolphin has nothing to do with pie, or the fact that you think Communism is god.As for a reply to Arkons post, yes, the forum needs action. It should be bustling with cool things to talk about, but for some reaosn, isn't It's all about Gamecube and Metroid. You people had interesting stuff to say at one point, so bust your brains, and think of some new stuff. Otherwise, we will have everyone talking about their morbid pie fetishes...and none of you want that.

* ari's corpse has a hole in the head but seems to, for some reason, smile in an insane way ** ari's spirit enters Phosis's mind and speaks *So it seems Ari wasn't clear enough in his life. See, lately the only reason why he kept visiting the site was one pun to post, nothing more. No discussions, no spamming, no weirdness - only one pun! And he kept checking the site so often that when he posted the pun there was only one forum up for posting anyway. And you know what, he was pleased when he found out his post had been moved - if the off-topic forum had been up by that time, he would have posted the pun there to begin with!In the end, he always had his reasons to live his virtual life and when he ran out of them, he obviously didn't want to continue it. At first it was the fanfics, then the cool people (who I've already named) around here, then, after the crash, the pun. If he had been like you, that is, if he had had any other reasons to stay, he might have freaked out about the closing of the thread but still continued his life. If he hadn't thinked the pun up, he would have not been seen here anymore at all.Yes, the pun was pathetic and probably nobody found it funny. Sturgeon's law. As for the uselessness of the topic... well, it's your opinion. My opinion is that it'd have evolved differently if it had been let to go on. But since it's the job of admins to close threads that don't go as they should, and all I have is a privilege to whine about it as long as I'm tolerated on the forums, it doesn't make sense for me to do anything else than to politely point out that my opinion differs from the admin's one.As for my attitude... I might sound like a jerk, in fact, I've often been a jerk to people on this forum (I still regret the things I did at the story threads Arkon posted), but fundamentally whether I stay here or not depends simply on whether I have a reason to be here or not. You gave me a reason to write this post, since I needed to defend myself. It doesn't really matter to me if the reason I have to be here is minor; it doesn't take long to check the site and the forums. But no reason to be here equals not being here for me. Compare this to the CoC; I registered there, posted for a short while, and disappeared. Never posted a goodbye thread. The only reason I ever had to be on that forum was intellectual curiosity, which ran out quite quickly. I lost my reason to be on that forum simply because of myself. On this forum I didn't lose it because of only myself (although having only one reason, and a pretty bad one at that, to be here, is definitely "my fault") so I just decided it would be nice to point my reason of leaving out for interested people.But don't worry, Ari's children will be checking the site for new/rewritten fanfics and heightened activity in part of three or more of the cool people I mentioned periodically, so perhaps one day one of them will be found a member of this community. But before that happens, please excuse me. I have a heaven to ascend to and I have had enough of this purgatory.* ari's spirit starts floating towards Istvanistan *

* ari's spirit is dragged forcibly back to this world by a mysterious force *I already absolutely loathe this thread, so if at all possible, any future correspondence about this stupid issue should be e-mailed straight to me ( lighten@lyseo.edu.ouka.fi , if it's not in my profile). Do whatever you want with this thread, I would personally like it to be locked (and in most forums where I've been to, a thread starter's request to have his thread closed is usually honoured by the admins)* me finally can walk in to the light *

Done. *locks, quickly.*

no, its a bunch of old sonic games on one gamecube optical disk. (I am the only one who still knows thats what its called? G.O.D.)I want it O_oI'm a Sonic fan (Arf...I'm sure you didn't notice it ! lol) !

I got it. It has a couple drawbacks, like the fact that you cant hook Sonic and knuckles up to the other games until you kill the logs (Meaning, everytime you play a game it makes a log. Play a certain game 20 or so times, and it will unlock something for you.) But thats about all. Plus the fact that there is no Sonic CD will be frustrating to some. (I dont care. I have sonic cd.) But you get to watch the anime from sonic Cd anyways, which was the best part. It is a pretty complete collection, with 12 games in all if you include the different S&K options, 10 if you dont. There are three extra games, like Blue Sphere, Ristar the shooting star, and flicky. I strongly reccomend it. Plus, the emulator is state of the art, and whoops the Sega smash pack for DC's Ass. Games included are Sonic 1, 2, 3, kunckles, spinball, 3d blast, Dr robotniks mean bean machine, ristar, flicky, blue sphere. Buy this game today!

I would always post stupidly drawn pictures of "phosis" in their Oekaki art board, to piss off silverfin. This comic is sort of a tribute to silverfins months of pain. Hey Doomy.. Ye ol' Friecco's still here (me)

The gallery module has always worked that way. You can turn off image scaling in your gallery preferences if you don't like it.

First of all, I was wondering if there was any way I can change my gallery's "cover" pic. It doesn't seem to matter what order they're in. I can't rememberfor sure but I think the one it shows is the one I uploaded first. But I don't like that one as much as any of the others and I'd rather have one that's more representative of my newer work. So I ws wondering if there was any way to change it, cuz I couldn't find anything.Also, whenever I put an apostrophe in the title it puts a slash before it, it doesn't matter how many times I retype the title. The other galleries that have apostrophes in the titles don't have a slash. So I don't understand why it does that for mine.

Lovely, Sten! :)

If I remember right, underneath all pictures there is a option that if you select "Highlight Photo" and update it, the selected photo should be the gallery title.Hope this helps.

So I ask this of all forum members:What is the hardest Ecco level you have ever played?This will be quite interesting since different levels are harder for others right? What level left you screaming cuss words and wanting to break you control pad in half?Allow me to start, in my case at a very young age, The Machine level was the hardest. I died so many times, poor Ecco, getting crushed. -_-It has been a long time since I last played that game, I betcha if I was to play now it would still be hard for me.How I hated the Machine........

'cause, there was this "Trilobite" thing, that was constantly bugging (hurting) me. I despise the lagoon...

That is a false rumour. Sonic team has stopped the Adventure series. While it cannot be certain that they are not working on another sonic, it will not be an Adventure. They stated that they wanted to bring Sonic back to it's roots, more like the original gameplay. This does not mean it will be 2d, it just means we wont have so many story elements (which I will be thankful for.) involved. Sonic team also wants to take a break, and port old games from genesis to Gamecube, which is very exciting since I bought the mega collection. any pictures you saw of a sonic adventure 3 are, indeed, fake.On another note, I bought Metroid Prime yesterday. Let me just say that my eyes are hella sore from playing it so much. It is a beyond fantastic game. this is NOT an FPS. It is a metroid game, in a first person perspective. Sounds odd to say, but play it, and you will fine out yourself. It has all the classic platforming elements. When i saw the map for the first area, and how massive it was, I nearly shit. It is astounding that a game this big can be POSSIBLE on Gamecube, and it gives us a taste of what we will see in the future from the big 'N'. I will not praise this game, as every single game site already has, but it is a fine piece of work, and I dont care if you like RPG's, action, racing, or sports game, this one DESERVES to be in your gamecube collection.

Let's see...Ecco 1- Tube of medusa- The levels where you have to fly (as a bird)- Moray abyss- Secret cave- ...Most of the levels, in factEcco The Dolphin - Defender of the Future:- Perils of the coral reef- Four ways to the mystery- Process that never ends- Perpetual Fluidity (ARRRGGGH !!!)- Entrapment- Caverns of hope- Hanging Waters (ARRRGGGH !!!!)- All the Foe levelsIn fact, the most difficult Ecco games are TOT and DotF.DotF has been recognized to be one of the hardest video games ever.

If only I had known about the Undercaves earlier, I would've become a part of it's very interesting and dramatic history. :D Truth be told, I came around the community when I was on my school comp on Gamefaqs in my free time, looking for a cheat for my Ecco ToT. And some info on how to get out of that level with the baby orcas.I saw the cheats on Ecco ToT by a guy on Gamefaqs who posted it called CPredator. He wanted to know if the constellation pattern on Ecco's head was the constellation Crux. I decided to try e-mailing him the answer, so I clicked on his name. Then, up came a page of his with various links to cool game sites, including both Arkonviox and Caverns of Hope. I checked out Arkon first, and found the cheat on the site. Then I checked out the Caverns. The rest is history. 8)

Hardest levels for me...Ecco 1roll Tubes of Medusa. For beginners, it's nearly impossible to outrun that thing!Ecco DotF Isle of Tranquility-Up and Down. Man's Nightmare-Perpetual Fluidity Dolphin's Nightmare-Hanging Waters part 2 Foe's Domain-Transfiguration, Heart of the Foe.There's mine...now I've mastered all the games except for Ecco 1, which I have to try without the cheat code sometime. :)

Actually, It might be easy...Is that a level?

I like that chat, it's all-out cool.But only if it's full and no-one's a ghost.Last time I told a nice tale to the people in the chat. Silverfin was there, too...I think I'll remember these Ecco communities for as long as I live, that's the point to my babble.

I think I've been with y'all for nearly a year or better. That's a scary thought. I don't actually remember how I came to this site...well, I vaguely remember I was searching for ROMs, and I came across the Ecco 2 BETA one. Somehow I got myself here. The first post I ever made in the forum, back when it was a YaBB one, was a question on how to properly work the BETA. XD And Arkon told me that in order to actually play the damn thing, I needed to get into the debug menu, which can be accessed by pressing the C button 8 times.Ah, the good ol' days. >;p

heh *pats vantid on the head* dont giva away what im gonna do.when i first showed up into the ecco community it was three years ago and it consisted of a few people like miana eao psysonic silverfin "Ecco the Barbarian" and i. the website was the undercaves and our pod leader was blackfin. back in those days i was a little more quieter the most popular person of that community was ecco the barbarian. he was out going a drinker, a football player everythig everyone else wasn't. for a little while he made a crummy little website forhimself he had alot of fans including myself. he was basicaly the life of the undercaves. but a little after wards he stopped coming and it became boring so i ceased the opportunity to take his place. become out going doing crazy assed posts making fun of people shit like that. i was shocked that he could make a website and thought to myself maybe i could do one. he had a crummy msn site which you can build much like how you post on a forum.so i did arkonviox.com cause blackfin owned his own site name "ecco-the-dolphin.org" so why couldnt i make my own?from there i slowly began dominence over the ecco community. the price we all paid was when blackfin called it quits. he was tired of keeping up with me and tired of people who downed him. i predicted i would one day own the undercaves. the first website i ever joined. the first forum i ever joined. the first chat i ever joined and made friends in.back then the world wreastling federation had merged with wcw. aol merged with time waner. mergers were great things. the undercaves was a split community though. half the community hated me the other half worshiped me. psysonic tried to stay around and be cool with me but he had his fill and promised he would one day come back with "hope". I didnt make nothing of it. i closed the udnercaves and merged it with arkonviox.com. silverfin left many months prior tired of me as well. we got into a dramtic fight- he was actualy one of the first people to leave the undercaves because of me. the undercaves lasted for a while but started to die as i used "nukes" to kick people out of the chatroom on that site. i also made threats to alot of people who visted that site. alot of people stopped going there and were all -mine- thats part of why blackfin was tired of compition. he wsnt up to playing games. i was angry at him for eprsonal reasons something id rather not go into since its a whole new big story.the next couple of months were "my time" i owned the ecco community. it was like a new toy but the problem was since i didnt have any compition i was left with much to keep the site interesting. then when i least expected it. PsySonic had made a return and opened caverns of hope....and after a year of being gone...a person who we thought was dead...silverfin was back and joined him.they wanted to trie to stomp me...well kinda...they were more keeping there promise of bringing that hope of a new community to open. by then i had a new competitor.for months we fought between sites. psysonic hated what i did to the undercaves, what i did to blackfin. i hated how psysonic had told lies to everyone about me. i made attacks on the site and they used every weapon they ahd to ban me. and id go around and "unban" myself. this fight happened for a long time. nights go by -id attack coh then silverfin would defend it. then...silverfin contacted me and was like "go ahead and attack but i wont fight you no more." by then i was tired too and told him i give up.silverfin i and a few others from coh wanted to end this war. so we got together it took time and now its over and were buddies...i admit im still a jerk but what else is new.blackfin finally made a come back to the web after he found out the ecco community he created was no longer split. can you imagine. you created a community that once never existed..from there one of your members opens a website and takes you on taking all your members because he was banned. then from there you decide screw it all and give in. blackfin gave up the undercaves...you took ownership of it...the first site you ever visited...the first commmunity of friends...now yours...you own them all....but instead of keeping it you crush it....and make the site you used to crush it better....but as you crushed the site the hopes and dreams of another slip through and someone else emerges causing the community to split into two....just like in ecco. two communities....tied into each other but at war....when the war was over we came into peace again. its been a long 3 years....

Godammit. I just saw a commercial for a movie. "Extreme Ops." and let me rant for a bit. Okay, so they have made movies about lots of disasters. Volcanos, storms, meteors, whatever. But taking a disaster like the one that happened on September 11th, and using it as a tool to shamelessly cash in on recent events in Iraq, and America, is really vomitous. It is about some kids who go up to some mountain or something, and witness a group of terrorists that are going to destroy some city in America. Holy shit, now THATS an innovative idea! Who honestly thinks this shit up??<lame movie producer> So yeah...We need an idea for a movie. Its got to have Women, teenagers, guns, and explosions.<Lame movie director> How about snow? Yeah. Snow's good.<Lame movie producer> Okay, cool! Oh yeah..it has to have...what is that? that other thing...you know...<lame movie director> A........Story?<Lame movie producer> Yeah, thats the one. Well...theres something going on in america with some Iraqi's or something...Oh yeah. And those towers...you know, the ones that were blown up? what were those called again?<Lame movie director> Statue of liberty?<Lame movie producer> *Smacks the director.* The TRADE towers.<lame movie director> Oh. Okay.<Lame movie producer> Lets just...like....throw some terrorists in there, to. Oh, and there can be Skiing! Everyone LOVES Skiing! It looks so cool!That must be how things are done now a days. The only good movies recently are in these three subjects.1) Based on old books2) Based on new books3) From China*sigh* I really hate heartless corporate bastards.

hey, thanx to every1 who helped me out before on my other question but now i have another. im on dark water level (the level where u fight that big DNA creature. im finding it pretty impossible. i know i gotta hit 4 balls of the same colour don't i? i just wanna know if theres any way of doing this. i don't get it. to get into the room you lose half of your health. then you stop a moment to line yourself up with a ball to hit and zap your DEAD. i've found it pretty annoying and i have to admit, the walkthru i found on the net doesn't help very much to do this. it sez hit a ball and then 3 more of the same colour. it doesn't tell you that you get fried just like that *snapping my fingers*, that you get dead very quickly and it doesn't tell you what to do about your fast declining air.pleeez help me guys - i really need it!oxyMoron aka Moonflash

Hmm. I haven't played Ecco I for a quite long period of time, but I think, I still remember what you must do. First of all, that "DNA creature" as you call it. His name is Asterite. Secondly, as far as I remember, you must hit all the violet globes (B button) to pass the level (they all should be blinking). But if you accidentally hit the globe of the other color, all the violet ones will stop blinking and you'll have to start all over again...That's all I remember. I guess I should take out my Genesis and re-fresh my memory :)

Yeah, there is a beam as soon as you get the labor harness, but you won't have to use it until Process That Never Ends. Just quicky double-hit the sonar button, and your sonar should be splayed in front of you for a minute. Use that to move and pick up crystals, both in Process That Never Ends and Sleeping Forces of Doom.Did that help? :D

I just watched the film "Instinct", starring the famous actor Anthony Hopkins.In this story, he's a scientist who studied the wild gorillas, and have killed someone.A psychologist wants to understand what brought him to kill.During the film, we understand that he killed hunters, who went in the montains to kill the gorillas, and take their furs.At a point, he goes to a zoo with the psychologist, and sees gorillas in a cage.He says that these gorillas are just shadows, and the only one who is different is a male, who has known the freedom.He opens the door, but the gorilla doesn't leave the cage.He explains that, for this creature, now, the freedom, the infinity of the forest, the rain on his fur, the sound of the wind in his ears are just far dreams.This part really touched me...Maybe, it's the truth, it's truly what the captive animals feel...I think about it, but about orcas and dolphins...Some tanks are near the ocean, so near that there is just a door between the cetacean and the wild sea.But if you open this door, the orca/dolphin will remain inside of his jail.Some persons say it's because the animal feels good in its tank, some others because it loves humans.But I don't think so.Look at this orca//www.orcahome.de/images/kandu702.jpgIt's Kandu. He lives in a dolphinarium in Canada.He has lived in the ocean. But if you open his aquarium, he won't move. He'll continue to float slowly in his cell.Just a wall, between him and the freedom...A simple wall...But he'll never pass it...Maybe he's afraid. Maybe he's lazy. But it could be something different.Have you ever tried to remember when you was 2 or 3 ? I'm sure you did.Have you ever noticed that this old memory is like a dream you made a night ? All is vague, as it has never existed.I think freedom's the same thing for him; for Kandu, for Keiko, for all these captive creatures.For them, it's a beautiful memory...The wild wind who whistles in their ears, the rain who caressed their back when they went to breath the fresh, iodized air of the open ocean, the cold waters of the North, the taste of their mother's warm milk on their tongue, and maybe the taste of the fishes...The great time, when they sang to the moon, snuggled up between their mommy's fins, free, wild, in their family.But for them, now, it's just a dream.It's like all these wonderful things have never existed.A dream they'll never be able to concretize.An indescriptible dream, bathed in the light of the sun and the lapping of waves...

Yeah, there is a beam as soon as you get the labor harness, but you won't have to use it until Process That Never Ends. Just quicky double-hit the sonar button, and your sonar should be splayed in front of you for a minute. Use that to move and pick up crystals, both in Process That Never Ends and Sleeping Forces of Doom.Did that help? D

As I remember, the most important is to hit 4 globes of the same color.I don't really know how to avoid the "laser" of the Asterite.If you want, you can use a cheat to have an infinity health.But if you want to do it without cheating, I dunno how to help you...Sorry...Just remember that you have to hit 4 globes of the same color.

Yet another masterwork Cally! I remeber that movie, I loved it and have it in my collection somewhere.

I just watched the film "Instinct", starring the famous actor Anthony Hopkins. In this story, he's a scientist who studied the wild gorillas, and have killed someone. A psychologist wants to understand what brought him to kill. During the film, we understand that he killed hunters, who went in the montains to kill the gorillas, and take their furs. At a point, he goes to a zoo with the psychologist, and sees gorillas in a cage. He says that these gorillas are just shadows, and the only one who is different is a male, who has known the freedom. He opens the door, but the gorilla doesn't leave the cage. He explains that, for this creature, now, the freedom, the infinity of the forest, the rain on his fur, the sound of the wind in his ears are just far dreams. This part really touched me...Maybe, it's the truth, it's truly what the captive animals feel... I think about it, but about orcas and dolphins... Some tanks are near the ocean, so near that there is just a door between the cetacean and the wild sea. But if you open this door, the orca/dolphin will remain inside of his jail. Some persons say it's because the animal feels good in its tank, some others because it loves humans. Sad to say this is the case, if an animal knows nothing else than captivity, it will not understand the concept of freedom, or what it holds or means. :?

Yep, you pretty much hit the same color of balls (4) to beat the level, of course the Asterite will try to zap you in the process. What I did was that I stuck to the upper right corner, struck a globe and then kept moving so the Asterite could not make a target of me and the I struck the other globes of the same color. Of course you are limited to your air. With pratice this should work!

Hehe, thanks for all the comments, and remember I used to STYLE from Atlantis ) For my style of cel-shading, I mentally pick out what parts will stay light and what parts I will shade. (I will make a tutorial of this one day..) I magic-wand select different areas, flood fill them with the base colour, and then I get the line tool and get the shading colour and draw in all my shading areas across the picture, then using solid brushes I fill the parts in.

Theres two main forum systems really//www.ikonboard.com/Upsides Closed source, resource intensive. CGI version is forbidden on quite a few hosts. Requires some form of compatible SQL database.PhpBB - http Open source. Activly developed. Speedy. Has nice integration with Post-Nuke CMS. GPL license. Has lots of 3rd party support.Downsides: Requires php4. Requires MySQL or Postgresql. Some administration features feel limited. Fine-grained control of forum permissions requires unintuitive and difficult group setup.

The artifacting of white on bluegrey with the text is really ugly and aparent when viewed on a LCD screen.If thats too hard just make the whole thing a PNG24.

Also, sometimes captivity can be good, it would save the species if they were dying out in the wild. Or becuase they're sick.One reason I think they wouldn't leave is becuase they have been there for so long, they have no knowledge of surviving in the wild, no clue how to defend themselves or anything else. Or maybe they're confused by the ocean itself, and refuses to leave the tank, like a child who wouldn't leave its mother because it doesn't understand it's surroundings...Maybe I'm just rattling nonsense...

Also, sometimes captivity can be good, it would save the species if they were dying out in the wildNo, Miana.For some species, yes, it's right, the captivity can help to breed and put in the wild the animals born in the hands of the men.But for most of intelligent animals (felidea, bears, cetaceans, primates...), it's impossible.If they didn't grow up in their natural environment, they will never be able to live in the wild.

No, what I meant was for species that were endangered, or if a creature had gotten sick or injured than to take care of them. I wasn't saying that every single animal that isn't human should be in cages. Humans are not only war-like, they're also curious. They need to know how everything works, how it is able to survive in its enviroment and such. We're inquisitive we seek the knowledge to know everything. I'm not against captivity if the creature is treated with the care and respect it deserves. But I do agree they should be free if there is no reason to hold them captive, or they're treated badly. They don't deserve that, no one deserves that. It's the same with everything, with some good, there tends to be some bad to follow along with it.

As usual, it's great, Cally :)

No, what I meant was for species that were endangered, or if a creature had gotten sick or injured than to take care of them. I wasn't saying that every single animal that isn't human should be in cages. Humans are not only war-like, they're also curious. They need to know how everything works, how it is able to survive in its enviroment and such. We're inquisitive we seek the knowledge to know everything. I'm not against captivity if the creature is treated with the care and respect it deserves. But I do agree they should be free if there is no reason to hold them captive, or they're treated badly. They don't deserve that, no one deserves that. It's the same with everything, with some good, there tends to be some bad to follow along with it.First, I repeat it, the breeding in captivity CAN'T help to save an endangered species, if this species is intelligent and complex.Second, yes, you're right, it's good to cure the sick animals in a zoo; but we have to make them free again after their cure. Some zoos don't do it, and it's cruel.Third, it isn't useful at all to keep wild animals in a jail.When we don't know about a species, yes, it can help; but for most of the animals like dolphins, elephants, felidea, etc., we don't need to keep them in a cage any more, because now we can learn about them with K7, books, or trips in their environment.The comportment of a captive animal is totally different than the comportment of a wild individual.It's stupid to say that we can learn about an animal by keeping it in a cell.Zoos' directors say it can help to study them to defend their industry.

I don't know where else to put this.I have many characters for many stories and online role plays. I work hard to make them all different. I'm very proud of them, they each have a little part of me within their souls. And I wouldn't have it any other way.But I never knew a friend would go so low. She copied three of my characters. Doesn't seem like much now does it? Well it does to me, when I've racked my brain out for each and every one of them. So of course I got mad, she starts whining that I'm making a huge fuss over nothing. Over nothing my ass! She was hanging on a short thread of my patience. She's one of the most crappiest rpers I've ever read about to. Try to move the story along, she starts something that has nothing to do with it. *sigh* Another thing, she whines when her character doesn't have a guy... and she makes me or one of my closest friends to make up a character... Sorry for taking up your time. I just needed to get that out.

Alright folks this is a topic that was once a tradition on this website. How it works is i begin the story then the next poster adds on to it. the story must be serious can have some humor but don't make it stupid i'm hoping this can become something that perhalps post in the fan ficts section. The story is sea related and will probably have ecco in it. o.oI want everyone to join....to make i worse i require people join in and contribute a good amount :P So i'll begin this story...~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~My story begins in a ruined city of the continent atlantis, the city of tantalus.Deep withen the ruines lives a creature who lurks about like a cloaked beast who keeps any light away to protect the darkness that shrouds it. The creature is dolphin in origin but has evolved into something else probably because of how it keeps to the dark.The Dolphin creature has a tan brown skin with metal coming out of its fins. the tail is shrouded with feathers perhalps for flight. metal keeps open the gills on this dolphin creatures neck and a gold mask as if to hide deformality or the fact this creature is embarrised to be dolphin. Perhalps this creature was something else before? it would be hard to tell since this creature has observed death and life and death again. This creature has red eyes beneath a the gold mask which appears to be a land mammal type known as an atelope.The creature dwells the tomb like city which one was beatiful florishing with life....perhalps at one time one day this creature lived here to protect this sanctuary. Now that theres nothing to protect everything is better off dead. 14,000 years ago this city was above land and thousands of miles far off. Could this creature be that old? Th answer is yes.The creature was born of the old world race of dolphin who dwelled atlantis with humans. The dweller of these ruines was Arkonviox.Far off was another city belonging to Atlantis known as Thira. The Dolphins there were decendants of the old world atlanteans now apart of the new world and given a name...The Thirians. They worshipped a god who they belive will one day save the future from seven shadows who will rise from the unknown and bring forth the apacalypes. The seven shadows have already shown themselves...there has been a war with the thirians and these creatures who call themsleves the seven dark whales of apacalpyes. seven orcas who lost there white stripes to shroud themselves better. completly black....so whoever they hit wont see it coming.The leader of thira was king Trident, he knew how to handle these dark whales. A dolphin warrior known as crestoe who looked much like a thirian did. Thirians have long snake like bodies a long half oval fin that comes out of there back with small bones that hold it up. the fins have mutated into long fingers making what was suppose to be fins look like tree branches. dark rbown skin with tiger stripes sometimes. Crestoe was just like the rest of his thirian counter parts just as ugly but with eyes that show a type of remorse as if this creature isn't ment to harm it is ment for peace. he wore a helmet above his head which had long red spikes which covered his intire head and attached below the neck.The thirians worshipped Arkonviox...a dolphin with a mask...what they belived was tantlus was were his tomb lay dorment and no one should ever enter the holy city for they will never be seen again.Crestoe had happened to accidently stumble upon it during a battle and came face to face with "god". Crestoe didnt fear it cause he didn't belive in "god" the city layed out clues that Arkonviox was no ordinary dolphin. he was a weapon of mass destruction ment to protect atlantis. evidence indicated he wasn't prepared for the catastroph which hit and one day it would return...Arkonviox looked up and knew that time had returned. A red star grew bigger everyday but today it was no longer a star...it was a giant planet. every 500 years this planet appears out of nowhere. atlantis was a library of information with crystals called glyphs that recall this info. the red planet was vortex which resides in a neighboring star system called casandra. every 500 years our solar system collides with vortexe's orbit. Arkonviox looked up again....he seen vortex appear many times each time it appears it absorbs life from earth to keep its life alive.Except this time things were different...500 years ago a dolphin named ecco destroyed a creature which was the heart of vortex. this was a time to watch the sky to see if vortex had survived. Arkonviox knew it survived...the vortex queen was gone but the threat was still very real. The queen left behind a creature like herself but unable to reproduce....a creature who destroyed atlantis and could destroy earth. Arkonviox called this creature the vortex king...because even though the vortex were like bees with a hive and a queen in the human world the king is always the most powerful....the vortex king....Arkonviox looked at crestoe. Crestoe heard the stories of how arkonviox destroys anything which enters his ocean. this time things were different...if Arkonviox didnt act he wouldnt have a home...the dolphin with the mask told Crestoe to find the Dolphin who destroyed the queen...to find ecco and bring him back to the holy city to him. Arkonviox knew if he was to get his second chance at saving earth he would need to destroy ecco to prove he's the strongest.

LOL! Just stay away from AOL CDs...I hear they give you indigestion, not to mention bouts of anger and headaches. ;)

Wow, an interactive story. I'll go next, if I may Ecco. After his great plight with the Vortex, the young dolphin had grown since. Once he wanted to stay with the pod he once longed to save, but he was was soon to act as if he'd grown more apart with his family.Day after day, he hunted with them, lived with them, talked with them. But each night he'd stare at the constellation which his star markings copied. He'd listen to the mournful songs of the great whales at sea, and wonder what it was like to actually live alone.Then came a greater tradgedy...after 500 years of life he'd seen each of his pod members live their lives and die. He now doubted his immortality, for he'd outlived everyone he knew and loved. All of his friends, gone from him. And he, left alone with newer members of the pod, newer generations who stopped telling the story of the dolphin that saved the world. These new members were strangers to him.Then one night he stole away under the cover of the moon to find the one being that could help ride himself of immortality forever, the very creature that bestowed the power upon himwink:

Ok, well I've never done this before, but I figured I should at least try it once so "I come baring a message from one older and wiser than I" Ecco lifts his muzzle almost excided. "The Asterite? Where is he?" Crestoe shakes his head slightly "No, he has never let me down, he will be back, I just need to wait a little...." "He is not coming back Ecco!" Crestoe breaks in." "He called you to him so long ago and has now abandoned you, stop looking for good sense here, settle for ANY! "What then?" Said Ecco, focussing on the strange messanger again. "Time is precious." Crestoe continues. "Let us not squander it here. Follow me, it is your only chance....and my last..."Well there's my two cents, hope it was at least mildly entertaining...

good work orcacaller good work trelluis.now for me to jump back in the pond.Crestoe felt he was doing soemthing wrong but if he didn't go through with this his kind would surley be vanquished by the seven dark orcas. Arkonviox was the savior and Crestoe had no right to question it, for atlanteans predicted long time ago a dolphin of old world would rise up from the ashes and save the future.Crestoe looke dat ecco as he lead him into the holy city tantulus were Arkon lay dorment. Ecco was not scared, he was courious and silient. A spark from his eyes made crestoe tremble a bit. Crestoe felt whatever was gonna happen it would be legendary. "Ecco, i brought you here because of fate. I have no chocie of what will happen next."Crestoe opened a door way and shoved ecco in. He closed the doors and took a deep breath...then crestoe followed inside.Arkonviox layed there quitly, his fins were folded and crossed and his head lie in between them. he was asleep but not for long because he woke up. The golden mask glimmered and past it you could see arkons dark red eyes stained with black. what was behind that mask? Ecco looked up at Arkon still not afraid. Then Arkon slightly moved his head up and charged into Ecco. Arkon opened his mouth hoping to get ecco's neck but ecco turned and swam trying to get out of arkons grasp. Ecco charged up his energy and let a sonar blast pierce Arkon breaking a wound in his side. The wound quickly healed then arkon grabed ecco with his mouth and sank his teeth in. Problem was Arkons teeth didnt pierce Ecco at all. It was like they didnt do any damage. Arkon backed up and looked at ecco then Ecco charged a statue in back of Arkon where an arm held a long blade causing the blade to fall forth and chop arkons head off.Crestoe "holy shit! this isnt suppose to happen. you killed the legendary Arkonviox."Ecco looked at crestoe in disgust. Arkonvioxs head slithered and jumped up rying to take a bite out of Ecco.Crestoe "you still havent won...dont you know a head severed can still bite!"Ecco charged up another beam destroying arkons head...but the peices reformed and gathered to the main body and arkon was restored.Arkon "what the fuck did you do to me? your the first to ever have done that. you proved yourself well. i summoned you here because a threat from the sky is coming back....although you defeated the vortex queen there is one more stronger and more powerful then she. i have come to call it the vortex king....the creature responcible for destroying atlantis. well the vortex queen is quite aware 500 years ago you defeated its queen and is comnig to take revenge on you. so in otherwords i need your help..."Arkon looked at disappointed he didnt win the battle. that was his second loss...his second humiliation..now he must live with it just like he lives withen the city he was ment to protect. Ecco as his chance and jelius that he was he felt he would later down the road betray ecco and defeat him.

Well I have been alive for 17 years now, and it is a feeling of tiredness, hunger, and thirst. Mostly because I just woke up. Last year I turned 16, and got the ability to drive. This year, im 17 and gained the ability to....o_o;The point is, Im sure turning 18 will be fun. I will go out, get drunk, and get hit by a car. Hooray! The upside to today is that I get presents, food, and praise. And a ban or two from Yogoat, and a few insults from Dolphin. But that shit wont be happening. I am smart enough not to go to Darkseas tonight, and not to ruin a perfectly good evening with that shit. So for all you youngins who think that growing old is a cool thing to do, dont. Not until your 18 (or 21 in the US) Until your 18, you are weak, useless, and dont own a damn thing. And I dont mean possesions, I mean people. I am still the scapegoat in the chatroom, and the unwanted administrator at this site. But you know what?It feels damn good.-Phosis

Ecco scoffed and a small trail of bubbles is sent floating to the surface of the cave."Is that the best you can do? Hurl second-rate proclamations? I care not! I came here under the guise of a peaceful encounter and this is how you greet me? Are you addled in mind as well as body? Why, now, should I believe anything you say or do? What little trust I had is wearing thin and will take allot of tending to be mended! For all I know you could be in league with them!" Ecco began to float upward and back slowly. "Give me a reason...a GOOD one..."

Meanwhile, in a distant part of the universe, two creatures pondered the events on Earth. There were thoughts stirring. Though they were not all very intelligent, they were still thoughts. Sete and Sosaris swam about in the night, in the empty void of nothing that they inhabited. "I don't like this." Sete began. Sosaris replied, "No one does. Nothing good can come of it. But what are we going to do?" Sete sang loudly, "Well we could go down there, if thats what your meaning. Its not like we have anything better to do." Sosaris never agreed with Sete. "Take the form of a mortal again? Id rather blink out of existence then have to do that again." They were not particularily bright, the brothers. They had a few ideas, and a few revelations, but nothing spectacular. They had watched over the years, as the events on Earth had unfolded. The unfortunate events with Vortex, and Ecco. The miserable quests of other singers (Which were fairly unpopular compared to the saving of the world) And other things like that. They werent Gods. Gods were powerful. They were just spirits that loitered around, pretending to be higher powers."I want to try the fish on Earth again." Sete said. "All you think about. Fish. We are talking about the possible destruction of...er...something. You know. Whats it called." Sete insisted "The world?" Sosaris was gleeful. "Yeah. Thats it."They couldnt do much. Perhaps just watch the events and make stupid comments like "Wow, that was a big explosion." Or "Jeez, I'll bet that would hurt." But they decided to go anyways. "We will stay out of the way, is all." Sete suggested. The two Star singers swam through the endless voids of space, down to Earth, to watch from afar...and eat some much wanted fish.

And some anime.Here is my Side 7 archive//www.arkonviox.com/modules.php?op=modload&name=phpBB2&file=posting&mode=newtopic&f=5and my TeamArtail archive//art.teamartail.com/cgi-bin/imageFolio.cgi?direct=Cynthia_Beehrit's basically the same stuff, but I don't put anything non-furry there, since it's meant mostly for furry art.I also have a couple pages on the old gallery//www.teamartail.com/fanart/beehcynt/ (don't try to go to the website link there, it doesn't exist anymore).And, finally, my website//members.tripod.com/tiarra2/There's a few pieces of art there that isn't anywhere else, and along with that there's also some things that I wrote.Tiarra is one of my online aliases, in case you are wondering.It will take you a while to get through everything. Shit. Yeah, they are.

"Well, Arkonviox? What have you to say?" Ecco continued with him.Arkon's reply was a faint growl of frustration. "I thought you were Ecco.""I AM ECCO!" the dolphin harshly replied, "Why do you say such things?"Arkonviox just put a smirk on his face. "I can read your heart...and it has been hardened over 500 years with loss, and pain. In just 500 more years, I predict, you will have lost that heart altogether. Providing, that is, we live that long." And he showed Ecco the sky, the red Vortex planet coming ever nearer to them.Ecco cast his look downward, away from the face behind the golden mask in front of him. "I cannot deny that. But even so, I would never have attacked you purposefully like you have done me. Tell me a good reason that I shouldn't leave and just let the Vortex king destroy you, or I swear, I will leave your malformed body to the sharks."Arkonviox's eyes widened. Ecco was never like this before he'd gotten his powers. As he was staring at the hardened dolphin in front of him, he suddenly had a sinister idea. "Ecco, I have a proposition for you. If you fight this evil, I will loan you my mask and armor."Crestoe gasped. "You cannot do that! You will..." but he was cut short by a dangerous glare from Arkonviox. He remained silent, and just supposed he knew what his master was doing.Ecco glanced back. "I cannot take your armor. I already have powers stronger than any other in the sea. If I wanted to fight this entity, I could do it with my eyes closed.""But you don't understand, Ecco," Arkonviox relayed calmly, and dangerously quiet, "I too am immortal, to the point which you have just seen. My armor has greater powers of sonar, of charge, and even speed. Hidden blades will slash through your enemy before he even knows he's dead. And this entity I predict is stronger than five Vortex queens combined. With my help, you can and will defeat him."Ecco looked over Arkonviox with curiosity and suspicion. Hmm, it does look like it could be useful... he thought to himself. "I think I shall swim here for a bit longer. I am interested, but you will have to wait the next day for my descision.""Take all the time you need. I'll be waiting." With that, Ecco left. Crestoe confronted Arkonviox. "Have you gone crazy? You haven't lived without that armor for years!"Arkonviox just smiled. "I know the risks. See, I intimately know my powers well. This mask and armor does indeed bestow power upon its wearer, but there is one complication. It also replaces their spirit with one of it's last wearer. My body may disentigrate, but I will inherit the body of Ecco. Then, even though it seems Ecco's the one saving the world again, it will instead be me! And I shall regain my former glory!"Crestoe was quite confused, but decided to go along in spite of his own safety.

Ecco swam in silence now, his heart heavy, his thoughts clouded and full of questions."Could he be right? Have I changed so much?" He stopped swimming and bobbed in thought. "...if it were true...who could blame me I suppose... I had lost everything, everyONE I ever cared for. I am no longer OF this world and cannot fit in anywhere.... and for what?" He closed his eyes as a cold realization set in. "I do not know......nor do I care...." He opened his eyes once more and with a powerfull kick swam to the surface breaking the water surface into a cool night sky. He looked around and up. No visible landmarks could be seen. The moon, full, large and blue, hung shining in the sky, offering Ecco the comfort of an old familiar face."Lunar bay?" "I.." He began. "I wish none of this ever happened. I wish I was still back with my pod, with my family and that the Vortex never......" Ecco's breath cought in his throught. "That's it! The Vortex! If the Vortex never came.....never existed....it would never have happened!" A wave of excitement washed over him. "Within the Asterite's cave there is a glyph with no song inside it, an empty shell that was never used. I shall use the song of recreation given by the Asterite to copy myself, my essince into that glyph. No one knows of it's existence other than me and the Asterite, should something go wrong, at least I will survive within the glyph!" Ecco chattered with exticy. "I can....no....I will do it!" If I swim all night I should be back before sunrise tomorrow! Then I shall take up the offer given me by Arkonviox, use his armor and the Atlantian time machine to go back to the time before the Vortex came and destroy them on their own grounds!" And with hardly a second thought Ecco sped off into the dark waters below......

Lemme try this, hope you dont mind my Character Arkon. ^_^****************The dark waters is a place that few go, for in the dark many evil things linger, there you will find a fish who will swallow others many times its size, there, you will find the giant squid with its terrifying giant beak....Not that it necesarilly make the dark waters a very evil place, little life lives here and you will only run into the giant beasts now and then, an occasional shark will pass through here only in hopes of finding any large animals that had died and sunk to the bottom.Which made Atolm wonder why there were so many sharks in a particular area.There they were, darting here and there, trying to go to a particualr area but quickly darting out, as if something was down there. Ah yes, the stench of blood was in the water, it was a strong intoxicating scent indeed, so much that even she was attracted to it.A six gilled shark passed her, barely missing her protruding spikes and she watched him rush into the fray.She swam closer, sonaring on what it could be.Sound told her it was two massive shapes, one was obviously a sperm whale and they were a common site here, they spent their time hunting down the giant squid and that was okay to Atolm, Squid was not a favorite in her diet and so she did not fear any competition from them.The other shape was alien to her yet almost too familer, it struck an old hatred within her, yes, what ever this creature was, it brought back bitter memories.Her yellow eyes focused beyond the fray of sharks and it was then did she see the mamgled body of the sperm whale.what was left of the body anyways..... the lower jaw was missing, only a few threads of muscles was left hanging and these were gladly being picked off by the sharks and the scanvenger fish. The stomach area was split wide open, entrails hung out leaking out their bodiliy like fluids and the tail of the animal was missing, only bits of muscle remained.but it was the sound of flesh being ripped apart that made her look upward from the sperm whale...The creature happily crunched on the dorsal side of the whale, his mandibles clucthing hard on the body, his teeth diggin into the tender flesh.Atolm knew the creature instantly, the infamous Vortex race!Legends of the Vortex was known throughout the seas, they would feed upon the plaet every 500 years, their quantities of food increasing every time.... this was no ordinary legend to tell among the normal creatures!but the legends also speak of the dolphin known as Ecco who saved the earth one time from this fearsome race, the dolphin boldly confronted the queen and defeated her...But there was alos the legend of Arkonviox, a masked dolphin who would defeat the Vortex as well.which would be true, both Arkonviox and Ecco were worshipped in all the seas, but then both are also known as evil beings depending on which pod you would happen to run into.Ecco, to some pods was the destroyer of certain futures, only his future, with the flying dolphins was made possible trough his actions.Arkonviox was a creature of destruction, only existing on this world so that it may suit his needs.Atolm swam away from the carnage, the Vortex was very much into his prey to notice her. The Vortex had made their apperance after so long! Yet Atolm knew that she did not have the power or strength to fight this beast, her last battle with the Sichem creature nearly done her in...... not that she could get killed anyways.... but it was the fact that she suffers from wounds like any other creature...So starts her journey to Atlantis, the only place where she heard of the ancient legends and in hopes of finding the dolphin heroes there...

I hope you don't mind me adding Whitey now either :)***Ecco pumped his tail quickly, slicing through the cold dark waters like a bullet. He was drawing nearer to his destination, but it had seemed too easy... way too easy. Something isn't right... he charged his sonar and sent it rippling through the waters ahead of him. Nothing... its like when the Asterite died, all life around him went with it.... Ecco shuddered, and continued fowards, reaching the entrance to the Asterite Tunnels. The waters had grown so dark that he had to rely on his sonar vision only. He swam on and on, no traces of life drawing near, but the caverns grew lighter as he neared the chamber the Asterite formerly occupied. The light of the sole glyph in there growing brighter with every thrust of his tail flukes. Almost there... Ecco praised himself mentally. It was almost over, he would copy himself and stop the threat of the vortex, and nothing would stop him from achieving this. "Halt!" a deep feminine voice rang out through the caverns, just as Ecco was about to enter the grand chamber. What the? Ecco froze, looking for the source of the voice. "These caverns are forbidden, how dare you intrude..." a long, bulky dolphin rose up from behind the solitry glyph. Her black fur tainted with blue light was long and sleek, her eyes where cold. "What? Who are you!" Ecco demanded harshly. "I am but a loner, an Atlantean, who are you?" she replied darkly.

I was looking into the Glyphs for my Maybe One Day Will Be Written Atlantis Story, and dictionary.com says that 'glyph' is 1) a universally recognizable symbol (such as the Recycling Arrows, or a Stop Sign or something) or 2) a key of some kindMakes sense.

((Hope he doesn't mind Miana joining, she's basically a human now, but she can change into her 'phantom' dolphin))*~*~*Sunlight filted through the waves above, glinting off the scales of small fish swimming through the reefs. Bright pinks, reds and yellows of the plants were vivid, and the assortment of creatures matched that very color scheme.Against the outcrop of a cliff, man-made stone. Intricate designs were skillfully carved into the white marble. A square opening into pure darkness. But that wasn't what caught your interest. A young woman sat on the stones, her legs hanging over the edge, swinging softly. Pale white skin gave a golden glow if the light could hit her. She wore blue robes, with silver trim. A velvet black choker with a silver circle adorned her neck. Her lips were a soft velvety pink, and her eyes wide. The top was black and faded to baby blue framed by long black lashes. Floating around her frame, was her hair, a strong blue tint contrasting a pure silver. Miana watched the fishes swim about in their erratic manner, her thoughts lost to concentration. /Something's disturbing she thought, she spun for a moment, looking behind her and deep into the darkness. /I better go see Whitefin, if I know her, she's probably has sensed this as wellWith a blinding flash of light, and scaring the bejeezes out of the fish as well, the young New World Atlantean changed into her white dolphin form. She blinked, her eyes adjusting before swimming off into the ocean.

Man, I always seem to fail at catching you guys off guard with levels from the older games...oh, whatever. Yer right! Your turn, Stenellya! :D

Miana followed her gut instincts. Ever since she was driven out of Atlantis, she lurked around the Asterite's caves... she swam deeper, and deeper, reaching the entrance to the caverns. The stars atop her head providing light for her. "Whitefin?" Miana swam in deeper, hearing voices echoing, no - bickering. "I am Whitefin, a prehistoric atlantean" she shifted her crest, looking at Ecco with glazed eyes. "I need to use the glyph" Ecco began to swim by her, but was stopped by one of her long fins. "Ah, no" Whitefin smirked. "Whitefin?" a soft voice echoed through the waters.

Two silvery dolphins swam through the sea. It was not a majestic, or beautiful sight. They were lost. "You don't even know where we are?" Sete asked, annoyed. "well what does it look like? Do I have a map, you idiot?" Sosaris replied. They swam for awhile longer, the sea large and unfamiliar. They had not thought things through before hand, and now they were paying for it. As far as Sete knew, Atlantis was on the other side of the planet. "I never liked Earth that much anyways..." Sosaris began, in an attempt to redeem himself. "Oh, Shutup."They did not retain there powers here. Those would be gained gradually, over time. Sete hoped they wouldnt be here that long in any case. They had watched Arkonviox from the skies since time of memory. He was always their favorite creature. What he was, they weren't sure. They were Gods of a sort. They were not planet ruling God's, nor did they have power to back that up. They were called watchers...made to observe the world of the living, for easy reference. The Gods would call on them when information was needed. Since that hadn't happened in over 11,000 years, they figured it would be okay to take a vacation.The sea was cold, the sky was red, and the watchers were getting tired. "Let's just get to Atlantis." Sete said. Sosaris disagreed. "We can't make it. It will take weeks." Sete insisted "What about the wind tunnel?" Sosaris groaned.The Earth was riddled with little secrets, unseen by eyes of mortal beings. They were little devices and tricks, planted by Watchers and God's to make travel easier. Wind tunnels were patched, all across the sea. They came up in the form of cold spots, or warm spots in the water, to the living. To the God's, they were a complicated mixture of apparatus, used to make a quick hole in hyperspace. The Tunnels could hook up to almost anywhere on Earth, and with the blink of an eye, and a very painful ride, travel could be made within seconds; only for higher powers, of course. Creatures like Crestoe, Ecco, and other divine creatures knew little of these. Arkonviox was the only being to have a real knowledge of them, but he did not use them often; it was a most uncomfortable trip."Oh, that is cold." Sete said, stopping in the patch of ocean water. "do we have to do this?" Sosaris asked. "As you said, it will take weeks if we dont. Activate it! This water is most chilly." Sosaris sang, his deep rythym of voice bouncing through the sea. The colder water tinted purple, giving a very visible glow to differentiate itself from the rest of the water. Suddenly, Sete felt his body, twisting and pulling. He was slowly slurped up into the purple void, Sosaris falling behind. It closed behind them, as if it was never there. Travelling through the Wind Tunnel was like riding a vicious roller coaster; If you multiplied the speed by 100, and took away all sound, sight and smell. It was a horrible feeling, as if your soul had left your body, floated up into space, and then was shot out of a gun, down into your body again. In a word, it was Nauseating.But then, it was over, as quickly as it had come. And they were no longer in the middle of the dead ocean, but now facing the massive expanse that was Atlantis, in all of it's glory. "Well. That was most fun. Now let's rest...My head is dizzy." Sete said, as he slowly sunk to the bottom, trying to get over the feeling of travel.
