Welcome back! =DI was wondering when you would show up!

Atolm's black flukes puped through the water, not a moment's rest for her! Atlantis was not too far off anyways.However it has been many years since she last passed through the ruins, many years indeed and she recalled the legends Sichem had once told her."Atlantis was a wondeful place indeed, human and dolphin lived together in harmony, they understood each others words, together they leanred how to change their forms and together they learned how to travel through time.A series of time machines were created by the Atlatians, each one placed in a vital city, for use only when should the danger arise, if such a danger would reveal itself. Foolish Atlantians, they knew no concept of Vortex, they never expected something from the skies that would betray them and that flaw of theirs left their empire in dismal ruins. They may have escaped into the past but they did nothing to stop the Vortex foe. The Vortex continued their consuming of the Earth it was only then that Ecco defeated them.""The Atlantians are lost in time now, scattered, only a few pockets of them remain in this present era... their only thoughts are the Nostalgic days of what has been."A deep growl from Atolm's throat as she recalled Sichem's gender-less voice, she had learned long ago to not listen to that beast nor the rantings of any other creature.Or course dolphins always had their strange songs, the high pitch squeals, the happy clicks, the piercing whistles......and then their songs of happiness! Songs of delcious fish, songs about how good it was to be alive and then the songs of legend like those of Ecco and Arkonviox......Atolm took a sharp turn in disgust, "What kind of shit is that? singing songs? As if they are singing to Gods or idols or a presence that cannot be seen..... They live only to be eaten and to decay on the ocean floor..." She recalled the taste of Dolphin flesh, it was something that she had stopped consuming many years ago, but the sweet taste of it was fresh in her memory....As she pondered this two faint images of dolphins came into view, silver in color they were but overall very plain as if done on purpose. One of the dolphins started to sink toward the bottom, obviously very tired from what it seems to be a very long trip. An exhausted dolphin does not tend to last that long and would be a welcome sight to any scavengers out there.This oddity attracted Atolm and with a strong flick of her serpent tail flukes, she rushed toward the two dolphins, wondering what was amiss...

umm i don't want to come across cynical and horrible etc, but its just a movie! its a movie with crappy acting and a big fat dude that terrorises the other inmates (yes i have seen it).it suprises me that its been out for AGES since before i was in 5th grade (im note entirely sure, but its been out for years) and only now you watch it??? come on!maybe the animals realise that when the door are opened they want to stay inside. they realise that they're getting food for free, a nice clean tank and just about nothing to worry about.this brings me to another point im going to make. how can we be sure that the urge for freedom is universal and is shared by all living things? the reason why an animal may run away when you try to close in on it is fear of you and what you may do to it once youv'e caught it. this orca you talked about has been in captivity for a long time, it realises that humans aren't gonna hurt it. it lives a life of luxury and plenty. it isn't like these animals are chained to a wall and beaten contiunously (at least im pretty sure they aren't). an orca isn't a little child, it can think rather well. it is content. isn't that what we all want? to be content? if i gave you all the freedom you could imagine, you wouldn't use half of it coz either you were afraid, coz you didn't understand, or coz you couldn't give less of a damn. even now you are free to do a whole lot of stuff, stuff that you haven't done in a while, be it ask out that girl you've had a crush on since the 2nd grade, or paint a masterpiece, or even watch a sunrise in the morning. everbody seems to believe that there is more to life than they will ever know - why can't they ever be content??

(why don't we stop trying to bring in our own characters and stay with what we've got? i think this quest of ecco's is getting a bit too crouded! - atolm i hope you don't mind me taking control of your character)The two dolphins shuddered and cringed at an unseen pain that coursed through their bodies. Atolm peered at the odd pair and tried to figure out what was up with them. Although they looked like dolphins, their entire demener was completely wrong. Usually dolphins would never approach these depths unless very foolhardy, or trying to display some foolish sense of bravado. Atolm approached the two singers feeling secure that they would not be able to harm her, after all they were only a pair of very stupid dolphins weren't they?Atolm greeted the two curiously but suspiciously. 'Greetings young ones. what brings you to these depths of waters?'one of the two clicked in ammusment. 'Young ones, she calls us - young!' The other gave the first a sharp prod with his beak. 'I apologise for my brother's stupidity - he has a brain the size of a peanut, you see' Atolm didn't follow, what is a peanut? in any case, she assumed it to be small. 'My name is Sosaris, this is my brother, but you have no need to know anything about him. We are on our way to an area known as Atlantis, perchance you have heard of it?'Atlom gazed at the two in bewilderment. She had expected the two to be slightly 'off' but they were simply out of it - and yet they too were on their way to Atlantis. 'Let me introduce myself. I am Atolm - ' at this the other dolphin broke in'Your name is Atolm? What a coincedence! my name is Sete.' The two dolphins howled with laughter. Atolm was left puzzled, where was the coincedence? she decided that this must what the dolphins found so ammusing, but the truth was that the amusing thing was the look of confusion on the visage of such a fearsome creature.She continued 'As i was saying, i too am on my way to Atlantis and you two are welcome to join me' he said, flashing her sharp teeth in a most fearsome smile.The two dolphins stimply looked at each other and said 'okay' in unision and stared to swim slowly but steadily in the direction that Atlom was heading when they met, leaving Atolm confused and now slightly with the two dolphins - maybe she would revive his long relinquished taste for dolphin.wow that was pretty good!

this orca you talked about has been in captivity for a long time, it realises that humans aren't gonna hurt it. it lives a life of luxury and plenty. Of course...Luxury, separated from his mother (for the ones who know orcas, the link between the mother and the child is one of the strongest in the animal kingdom), his brothers; obliged to live with orcas he didn't know...In a tiny tank (Marineland Canada has one of the oldest and smallest tanks of the dolphinariums history), where there isn't nothing to do but eating and sleeping; or masturbating for hours(so much that some males have the penis torn, due to rubbing it against the concrete)...With his sons and daughters who die 2 or 3 years after their birth (his son Algonquin- To live for your whole life with your loved ones, free to do all you want to do, to go where you want to go, to visit who you want to see, to eat what you want to eat; but, of course, you'll have to work hard to have money, food and a home- To live for your whole life separated from your family, in a little room, without any exit, with white and naked walls everywhere, without the noises of the "real word"; but where you'll be fed all days, with the same food every daysA little description...You live like a captive orca (yeah, let's imagine); so you live like that//www.captivitystinks.org/orcas.html

dont worry trelluis i switched them around.theres a couple of problems with the story. Arkonviox cannot take off his armor. its apart of him. also even if he could only he can benefit from its power.I think now is the time for a mass killing spree. o.o~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Ecco looked to Arkonviox. They were right in front of the time machine and ecco was ready to take on Arkons armor. Whitefin didn't understand why they stopped but she continued to be a obstacle past them.Arkonviox looked around and felt a presence. "Seven Dark Shadows....seven dark whales...seven for the secreat never to be told."Ecco was confused but then seen what Arkonviox was talking about. Seven orcas surrounded them and they didnt even know it. Whitefin looked in back of her. "Halt, do not disobey the princess of Atlantis."A dark orca swam beside her and she seemed aggitated. She was ready to attack though..but she wasnt watching in back of her. To her surprise a dark orca came behind her and bit her intire backside off then his eyes glew red as he lifted a red electrical charge and burned up whitefins remains.The deadly orca looked at Arkon just like the others the orca was completly black with three pupils in his eyes. each pupil seemed to pierce the others with an intimidation that this orca was watching everything and ready to slice anyone who oppose it.Miana looked over what was going on and decided this was no place for her to be. she swam away never to be seen again. meanwhile Atolm and crestoe showed up. ecco looked at arkon insisting if he was gonna wear his armor he would need it now. Crestoe looked at Ecco. "what are you talking about? arkon cannot give you his armor its apart of him."Arkonviox smirked. "damned strait"Arkonviox formed a small light which glew like a star over his head. he heald it up much like a seal holding a ball. the star grew into a giant blue sun and absorbed energy all around it. Crestoe yelled out "Arkon what are you doing?! your gonna kill us all..."Atolm looked at crestoe "what is that?"Arkonviox looked to atolm...."my ultimate slap in the face....i call it the bitch slap.."Crestoe looked at atolm "no. thats his deadilest attack...the supreme."Arkonviox threw the attack downward the dark whales moved out of the way.The giant sphere of light and energy consumed atolm ecco and crestoe killing them all.sete and soraris swam out of know where to tackle arkon but arkon just moved out of the way as they fall into the firey glow of the ultimate supreme which consumed them dead.Arkonviox laughed but then Ecco emerged from the light. crestoe too them emerged badly wounded and whimpered away. then Arkon closed his long fins like a bird does during flight when it has just pushed wind beneath it. Arkonviox them opened his fins and let out a fury of energy rockets. ecco moved out of the way them atolm emerged from the attack wounded only to get torn to shreds by the fury of the energy rockets.Crestoe looked at arkon "you missed us you idiot!"Arkonviox laughed "but your still wounded down to your last life and i managed to kill everyone else."The seven dark whales gathered around the supremes deadly glow as it died down.Crestoe yelled to arkon "so....your with them...you sell out."Arkonviox laughed as the dark whales captured ecco, crestoe dragging there wounded bodies away.

Here me out please Its a lot to read, but its just explaining what to do Great job! to the always welcome Instead of just drawing a nice picture, I want you to draw a nice picture that means something a little more to you. There is a theme, or a story or any kind of concept behind your art. Of course it doesnt have to be a picture! Post poems, short stories, speed drawings, comics, anything artistic. This is all about expression! Its kind of like talking whats the use in speaking all the time if you have nothing to say? Just do something that means something more then what it looks like.When we hear a song on the radio, it can move us and strike our emotions; but no matter how much of an impact that song has on us, it can never mean to us what it means to the writer. It can be just as powerful in a different sense, but there is no way to know exactly what it meant to the author of the song. It is the same for all art, and what we want to get out of this what it means to others.How the hell is this gonna work?Well heres how this is gonna workhttp://beisick.dolphinparadise.net/home.jpgAnd if you have a picture, feel free to give us a title or a small caption on it!So I called this one This is My Home. Now you guys can tell me what you think it means, or what it means to you and how big or small an impact it has and blah blah blah (of course the artist will also be involved in these discussions). So then I can say, well what this is about (to me when I drew it) is that I think it is important to take a piece of your home with you wherever you go. Now matter how far or how different a live you are going to, it is necessary to remember where we came from -good or bad- in order to grow. Ta-da! Now you can feel free to discuss that further, or start something new for us to discuss!Of course, if you think that what you have done should and will be discuss a lot, post a whole now thread for it! Just make sure the subject includes the words Skin Deep so we know what its about. But if you have something small, or something you dont think can be extremely expanded on, feel free to keep it in this thread.Do we all understand? If not, Ill clear it up, and if so let anyone be the first to start us off!!!

Well, that's interesting. I was thinking she looked lonely. Something about the expression. And I thought maybe it conveyed homesickness. Or that maybe she had problems at home and is running away or something.Guess I'm the odball in the group, being the only one to come up with a negative interpretation.Well, as for thia idea, I think it's a cool idea and I like it. I just can't draw anything that has any sort of meaning to it. I sometimes come up with ideas, but never anything I could actually do. At least not without it looking like total crap. I write poetry sometimes, but not very often, and it's mostly about nature and stuff so it doesn't really have much personal meaning.But, it's still a good idea. Hiya guys...Then...I wanted to talk about my reaction when Stenella arrived on the forum.First, Stenella, I know that "Stenella" is the scientific name of some dolphin species (like Stenella Longirostris or Stenella Attenuata).My username, Stenellya, comes from this scientific term too.In second...I had a pretty stupid reaction, coz I was angry to know that someone else took my name.But now it's done, so I have to accept it, even if I don't like it...So...Stenella, let's make the peace...I've been stupid...I also reacted badly because I was afraid to be kinda "replaced" by someone else, I was afraid to lose the love and friendship of my friends on ark.com ... You mean something special for me, you're my "pod", a "second family" on Internet; and I feared to lose you all..... ...Please excuse me...

Crestoe snorted, snapping his long jaws shut when Battino turned to face him. "Dolphinia" he simply said. Ecco felt his blood run cold, he looked to the surface of the water, the sunset above casting pale orange water webs across his body. They couldn't, could they? Ecco let a stream of bubbles emerge from his blowhole, and surfaced, looking at the night sky that was starting to take place, the light of the stars where bright, even at this hour in day. Above him he saw the seven stars that where known as Dolphinia, smiling down at him brightly. "Hey brat, get back down here!" One of the Whales bellowed from below. Ecco grunted, taking a long, deep breath of fresh air, before diving below the surface again.

Meanwhile Arkonviox was sitting in his lair pondering deeply on how to go about the destruction of the Vortex King. When suddenly a bright light filled an entire half of his lair. a tall human with red hair floated in the center of the mass."Fool" the man said "you have let my future be destroyed, and for what, your own personal gain, so you will be the hero that destroys the vortex king, i will live my life to its fullest making sure that you are known as 'Arkonviox the deciever' you shall not be a hero, much less a suffering peon hoping to gain his way back into life, any honor you once had as guardian of atlantis, is forever lost!"Arkonvix glared at the stranger, dressed in black "who are you and why have you come here if not only to birate me?" he said"I am Thyme, son of Leonus, creator of the vortex race, i am not a god, nor have i come to birate you, i come only to warn you, your time for judgement is coming, beware of ecco for he has the power of the asterite, this you cannot defeat.""I am Arkonviox i will defeat who i will", with that arkonviox hurled his massive head at Thyme, missing him and thyme picked up his sword which was called WhaleHammer, it looked large enough, it was much to heavy to be wielded by any human though, it had a blue translucent blade with a streak of red in the center. "you are seeing the blade of Leonus, this you cannot beat." he yells.then leonus raised his sword and began slashing arkonviox repeatedly into tiny scattered pieces. and as the pices began to regenerate into Arkonviox, Thyme scowled at the face of the monster and said "i leave you now fool of fools, go back and ponder the defeat of the Vortex King, but always remember the words i have said here." Thyme stepped back into the light and it shrank to the size of a pea, and then unknowingly to Arkonviox it dropped to the bottom of the lair to the carcass of whitefin and the light and whitefin disappeared.later on a distant planet of war a light passed through a grat white tower in the sea, and thyme jumped free, "hello father, i have brought you the body of whitefin as you requested, unfortunately arkonviox is still alive, and the asterite was nowhere to be sensed.""i feared this would happen" the tall man with gleaming white hair said "it is time, come we will warn the Vortex King"Theres my not so little addition to the story, i hope you like it, and i hope arkon and whitefin dont mind me taking control of their characters. :)

The tabletop RPG "Blue Planet" has a new supplement book, "Ancient Echoes," focusing on the cetacean civilization in that setting. "Blue Planet" is a well-developed SF setting on an ocean world, and might appeal to gamers wanting to play dolphin or orca characters... missile racks optional. I've found the main Player's Guide worth reading even though I've never played the game.Of course there's also "GURPS A Game of Species and Civilizations," because it's a unique and well-developed fantasy world with a well-thought-out magic system. Um, no 'phins in it, but there are two races like hyperactive shapeshifting otters and hovering octapi!

A roar. That was all it could be classified as. A bubbling cry that rose from the depths of a crevice beneath where Ecco and the whales now swam. The rocks began to crumble as a large quake tore through the small space. The roar came again, and it gained definition. It was desperate, a plea of anger, sadness, rage, and pain. Another quake moved through the earth beneath the water as Ecco and the whales began to back away, slowly at first, but almost franticly in reaction to what came next. Clawing sounds could be heard, bone against rock. Whatever it was, it was coming closer, they were sure of that now. The roar came again, and with it, a large blue three-fingered claw stuck out from the space between the rocks. The claw grabbed at the rimming of the rocks, of its cage, its prison. Finally, the claw went down for a moment, and all was quiet. For many seconds there was no sound, no movement. All at once, there was a large crash as the roar sounded itself again. The origin of the frightening sound could now be seen, however, as the rocks gave way to a large light blue colored creature. Its wings were bound to its back in a seemingly painful position, one of its arms also stuck in the strap. Its mouth was bound in a similar fashion, and its legs could only kick while its tail moved about hurriedly. The creature was no larger than one of the whales, but its distinguishing horns and spike running down its back, on its head and on its tail suggested that the creature was dangerous. The creature wasnt normally, but any animal bound and scared would be. It roared, flailed and tried to escape, but could only manage to entangle itself more. A loose wire on the straps caught it in the neck, and with each jerk of its tail, it dug it deeper into the skin. With everything going on at once, the trapped animal could only mutter a few words through its brace.Out! Let me out!

It had taken a few moments, but now its mouth was free now, and it worked with it's teeth to free the rest of his body. It bit at the wire around its neck, and pulled it away. He then moved to his wings, releasing them from the imprisoning band. Finally, he workon the portions of wire and band that were on his tail. Once that was finished, he concentrated on his surroundings.The first thing he saw was Cameroon. The sight would have intimidated him at any other time, but in his enraged state he dove at the dark sea dragon, raming it head on. It only took a second to realize how stupid the move really was, and then he fled as well, following the path of Ecco and Crestoe. I think your art is just fine too Eao!Personally I believe that you should not compare your art to others. Oh yes, I have seen the art of Dark Natasha and it is very impressive, but you must consider the fact that not everyone is into the realism style. If you try to make your style to another's then you are just only hurting your own style, of course it is always good to explore stlyes as well. I have tried Realism, and while it was all good and fun, it is not the thing for me, to me it is just so common and tiring that I want to show something different. I did the style and I did not like it, it was just not for me.There are many great artists on this forum, each with their own method of drawing of what is going on in their heads. Hey that is all good because it allows everyone to see what is really out there. Do not hesitate to show your art on here becaues i am sure everyone will look at it and enjoy what they see. Such things allow me to continue with my drawings, I have doubted myself many times before, sometimes I wonder if any of you guys really like my art or you are just saying these kind things to me. But that is doubt that is looming there.So dont doubt your self Eao! I wanna see more drawings from you, and I will give you feedback if you need it. Feedback is always good, especially when it comes from other artists...meh.... i said too much.....

No, At, you are exactly right. I don't think it's very fair to you if you compare your stuff with others. I mean, sure, everybody says at one time or another, "Oh, this artist is a way better drawer than me." But I think that you're not being true to yourself when you do that. You should be happy with your skills - I mean, look at me - At, Eao, vantid...there are a lot of people here who draw better than me. But I'm content with my skills. ^_^And Eao, I just love your stuff!! It's so cute! I like the Ecco as a human one. Rarwf. :3

back on the planet of war...Thyme walked down the gleaming halls, his father following closely behind."we have little time, you know what you must do?" Leonus inquired"aye father" Thyme replied"the dimensional gateway will close soon, you may not be able to return to us."Leonus said"do not fear father, they have a time machine, i may be able to refashion it into a gateway" Thyme Informed" you must hurry. time is against you, and the asterite has not fallen yet." Leonus said"okay, okay father, i know." Thyme complainedThey stepped into a large room with a huge bubble in the center. it seemed to float, yet it was supported by one short spire, with a thin point.thyme slowly walked into the bubble, took his clothes off, except his sword. his sword was different, it was not the WhaleKiller, instead he wielded the armor piercer. it was black, and had white where the blade was thinned.the operator said "okay sir, this will only take a second, please try not to move"the bubble slowly changed colors, from red to blue to red again, until finally it was no longer transparent but a silver ball of liquid. inside, thyme was being ripped apart, his whole body was being mashed, and pulled like silly putty, then his sword rammed through his chest and out his back to form a dorsal fin, his hands morphed into large flipper like wings, and his face formed to the shape of a dolphins.he swam out of the bubble in his new from, he was now of the earths future singers.he floated through the dimensional gate, and went to earth for his last time.

Arkonviox looked up feeling a presence unnatural. a being from another demension has appered but this creature could have been linked with the vortex since that race of creatures live only for survival.two threats bod near and a third awaiting in a distant future...the dark whale apacalypes.the sky was purple with a second red moon blazzing out of the sky. most of the singers of this time were ignorant of names....the planet to them was....dark clouds....the creatures who lived on it were eithier the vortex the foe or the threat...Ecco and crestoe managed to get away from the dark whales and found themselves in a group of dolphins. the dolphins were startled because they never seen a dolphin like crestoe. crestoe smirked. ecco and crestoe were in a sea called the mederteranian. another city lie dorment here without a name. ecco wondered why atlantis was scattered throughout the sea....and not in one place.Crestoe felt the need to answer him "atlantis was destroyed by the vortex king in the year 14,098 bc....the city was a floating island powered by the hanging waters generator. It was created by our dolphin ancestors known as the old world atlantean dolphins. back then we lived with creatures who dwelled the land with the ability to create massive machines. it was thanks to atla a scientist beyound anything that we have our technology. but it is also because of atla we have to deal with fools like arkonviox, dark whales, or anything that threats us with technology. the thirian kind..my kind are destined to destroy those in possession of the machine so we can liberate ourselves from the destruction it can cause."Crestoe thought to himself...."SHIT! my people are in danger...!"Ecco looked around part sof thira were scattered here...but thira was many amny amny many miles away. ecco also knew crestoe was eager to head back before the dark whales do."Ecco you have a mission to fafill nearby an acient dolphin people guard another time machine known as solomon you must get to it fast and travel back to the moment dark clouds decended over earth. the vortex king is collecting life on earth as we speak and growing massivly in power. only you can destroy him while he is weakened. you can do it ecco."Crestoe swam off on his way back to thira.Ecco was alone the time machine was far.....his mission was alot to think about but he went on anyways not pondering about it but planning on what to do next.

Or more correctly "on top" of the water fall" because you'll roll around on some solid ground that has "water graphics"For more fun, grab the "helper dolphins" when you cross the waterfall they may depart, but will be near a rockk wall very close to where you fall.You easily return to the level by messing with the current near the sharks (there is a rock thats half in and half out of the 'level'. Just talk to the coach to return the players/helpers to your side (they teloport from nowhere)also, I'm trying to see how long I can go without the "game playing by it's self" when the mother whale blocks the current (waterfall). you can get to the player dolphins (I didn't find them) I'd like to see them by your side when and if the game 'warps' you to the next level.

Heres a story I wrote. Prelude Push your knees down more. Extend your arms. It was this saying that Kai had heard hundreds of thousands of times already, in his seven years in the world. Sweat beaded on his forehead. His arms and legs were tired, and a burning sensation ran through him. His ankles shook, and he wanted to fall down on the school floor, and sleep. He was practicing the knee bend stance, and had been doing it for a long time now. It was a harsh training technique, but it was used by most teachers to train their students to be stronger. And in this school, also used as punishment, for putting off training, which Kai had been doing a lot lately. The school was a large one, the walls lined with worn mirrors, the faces of many famous practitioners of the Huo Long Mountain Kung Fu style martial art, Huo Long being the name of a famous dragon God from the old world, Kung Fu meaning hard work in the common language. He was the fire dragon, who was said to have created all life on Earth, and the style had been passed down through the generations by priests, and monks, all over the world, and to this temple. Huo Long Mountain was said to be the center of the universe, where the great dragon God rested, and watched over the world. Now, he slept eternally, becoming one with the stone of the mountain, to watch over the world until the end of time. It was all myths and legends, of course. Myths spawned through thousands of years of study and prayer to the God's of the old world. It was believed there had been five. Five dragons for the five elements of the world. Fire, Water, Earth, Wood, And Metal. They each played a part in the creation of Earth, the Fire dragon being the most powerful of the five. The humans based most of their religion and culture on the theories of these five dragons. They called it Longism, and the main theory behind it was improvement on oneself. They believed in heaven and hell, but not in worship. Only by improving yourself, and becoming the best person you could, could you be able to reach the heavenly kingdom, and break the bondings of mortal life. They were right, the Longist monks. Infact, many of them had gone through over fifty mortal lives already, and were getting quite bored of the living world. Kai didn't practice Longism. It was rare for such a young soul to believe in such things. What he did practice was Huo Long Kung Fu, and with much suffering. His father Chong pushed him hard to be his best, and at the age of seven, was Chong best student. Don't forget to breathe. Chong said, stroking his long thin beard. He was a tall, lanky man, or so it appeared when he wore his robes. Underneath, he was very strong, and had a hard, worn body. Kai always remembered what his father had taught him about appearance. When you are out in the street buying pork buns, do you show everyone your allowance? Kai replied no, though this was not fully true. He liked to show his friends what he had earned for his work in the fields, and was proud when he had money. Then why would you show everyone how strong you are? If you got in a fight, and showed someone how strong you had become, you would lose the element of surprise. That is why we wear robes, and do not demonstrate our Kung Fu like some other so called Masters. This, I am sure you can understand. Kai thought the lesson over in his mind. He was taught that last year, and he remembered it more clearly then most lessons he had been taught. And he never showed his money to anyone anymore. Remember to clear your mind, and let your Qi flow freely. His father said, as he observed his sons stance. One thing Kai still hadn't been able to grasp was the concept of Qi. It was said to be, or at least how he had analyzed it, as a spiritual energy that flowed through everything. For thousands of years, humans had studied Qi around them, and even learned to manipulate it, for health, and even combat. It was once more spiritual then today, used for religion, and to become one with nature. But in the dangerous world that this country had become, it was used more with Kung Fu, and had become more of a dangerous tool then a spiritual outlet. Kai sat in that low stance, feeling as if all of his muscles were tearing. He had been there two hours now, and while it was easy in the beginning, it was now unbearable. He looked as if he was pretending to sit in a chair, but with his arms pointed straight out in front. It was a stance used to gain strength in the legs, and build up the muscle there. If you open up your channels, and let the Qi flow, you won't even need to use your muscles. It will become much easier. Only two hours, and already you look like your going to burst. The Bing Ge family, which was what they were called, had always been powerful martial artists. Kai's father was hard on Kai sometimes, but usually with good reason. The school of Huo Long Mountain style Kung Fu was always well known for it's rigorous training, and painful teaching, but it wasn't until recently that it had been accepting students not born with the Bing Ge name. There was not just one school, or one type of Kung Fu in the world. There were many thousands of styles and forms, scattered throughout the country, and were all unique in different ways. The Huo Long Mountain school had competition. The school of Lei Shang Kung Fu was their greatest opposition, and the two schools had been fighting for years. The Lei Shang Kung Fu used the Thunder Kick style; a vast range of powerful kicking forms, used to quickly destroy the enemy. While Huo Long used a mixture of weapons, strikes, grapples, and kicks, Lei Shang was mostly just kicking techniques. Huo Long and Lei Shang had been in a deadlock for years, neither school having the advantage. So every year, the school would pick out their finest of students, and would send them to spar one another, to prove who the greatest school was. It had been a tie so far, and that trend didnt seem like it was going to change. Kai had made friends with other children from the Lei Shang school. His closest friend and rival Kuai Jiao, was the youngest member of the Lei Shang school. His father, Kuai Kun had trained him to be the fastest and strongest of his twelve children, so Kai and Jaio would someday fight with each other. That day was coming quickly. In just a few weeks, the first competition would begin. The competitors were Jiao and Kai. Kai wanted to fight Jiao, though they were friends. They had always trained together when they played, and though they were just play fighting, the both of them took it very seriously. The truth was, they were equally matched in skill and strength, but Jiao had one serious advantage. He could manipulate his Qi quite well for his age, and Kai could not. Kai thought about his disadvantage, and began to ignore the pain in his numbing legs. He let it rip through his body, and fill his head with pain, but remained relentless. He would not be beaten. He would either last out the two minutes of the spar, which had happened year after year leaving no victor, or he would defeat Jiao. A few minutes later, his father said, Thats enough. And Kai immediately fell to the ground, rubbing his crippled thighs with his hands. Youre getting stronger, Ill admit that. But you have a long way to go yet. When I am finished with you, you will have to hold that pose for daysand you will be able to. His father gave him a quick pat on the shoulder, and walked outside, to tend his garden. Kai stood up, and limped to the door. His grey robes wagged behind him, his one long black braid of hair bouncing on his back. He was young, but very well groomed and dressed. His eyes were a deep blue, and his hair was black. His eyes conflicted with his light brown, tanned skin, and made him look even younger then he was. Outside, beyond the doors of the dojo, lay long rows of rice fields. Beyond that was the Huo Long river, named after the school. It ran far away, into the forest to the east. There were two bridges that crossed the wide river, all painted and decorated in bright, beautiful colors, connected by an arch in the shape of a dragon, which was made of gold, with parts painted red. There was another dragon arch on the other side of the river as well, and it was all built with great symmetry and care. The twin bridges led out into another field, with merged with the forest town of Talon, about three miles to the north of the school. Smoke could be seen coming from the rooftops of the buildings there, floating deep into the sky. Kai looked beyond the smoke, to the great mountain range of Czu, which was far in the distance past Talon. It was deep in that very mountain range, within the icy cold tops of the Czu mountains, where Huo Long mountain lay, high above the clouds. The region of Czu was a dangerous one. Getting through the hazards of the range was perilous enough. If one could make it through, and could reach the peak of the towering mountain of Huo Long, they would see the challenge they faced; a mountain with no visible top, that led straight up, in a vicious, icy slope. There had only been one person in the history of the world who had actually climbed mount Huo Long, five thousand years ago. He was called Wu, and was said to be one of the greatest practitioners of Kung Fu to ever have lived. No one recorded what he found, as he never came down from the mountain once he reached the top. Some say he found a cave filled with gold, and many magical things, and lived out the rest of his days in glory; others say he simply froze to death at the top. Kai believed he survived. Kai reached into his pocket, and found a couple of brass coins. He smiled, and squeezed them happily, running over the rice fields, across the bridge, through the field there, and into the town of Talon.

Silently, stealthily, swiftly he swam beneath the dolphin known as Ecco. He knew who it was, everyone did, but his rage was forgotten. In its place came playfulness and joy, the eagerness of a journey now filling his mind. He was not shallow minded at all, he just almost never cared. However, the appearance of so many dark creatures, his capture, and now the arrival of Ecco, stirred his thoughts, and he decided to merely watch. In this way, if it was over his head he could simply swim away. On the opposite end, he could move into a position to help if that was needed. Ecco began to move in one direction, following one of the other strange looking dolphins, and he followed. He kept his thoughts short, his mind open and his eyes watchful. One couldn't be too sure in a place like this.

The slipstream created by the the new comer, the roar of the dragon, amplified underwater, the beating of the wings and the smell of freash blood. All these things together cuased a cacofany of confusion, but Ecco's mind was cristal clear. "The creature from the crevis." He recalled their first encounter not too long ago. With a powerfull kick he made his way to the surface, his eyes searched the strange sky and fixed at last on the hovering image of the large reptile. "Creature of the deep!" He began. "Calm your fury! This one is not with.....me, and I imagion it seeks to harm us both! I propose a truce, my power lies in the waters, yours in the air, let us aid one another now, lift me from the ocean and carry me to my destination, I in turn shall help you escape this place. More then this I cannot promise untill my quest has been fullfilled! Aid me in this task and we may yet survive! Do it not, and we will suffer a fate worse than old Atlantis!" Ecco paused waiting for a reply, then added as an after thought. "Delphinus smiles on us in this, we cannot loose!" ">Unles the Powers decide this to be the end of our time....<" He thought to himself....

What garuntee is there that I will be able to return through this new machine?"Ecco was confused, bewildered, tired and hungry. Only recently had he become aware of the latter, and the need was now growing in intensity. Another thought returned to him and he slowed his pace, sinking a little. He was unsure of what to do. Mystery was on his side here, and the less they knew the more could do. He could leave, and leave it at a guess with those he was following. Though if he was to find out what was truly going on...The shadow was scarcely larger than Ecco at first, but it grew larger, and ever larger, until it was several times the dolphins size. The creatures nose broke the waves first, then the long face and finally the neck. That was all he let above the water, save for one three-clawed hand. The creature was roughly about five times Ecco's size, shiny blue, with feet that waved beneath the waves, large wings that beat softly underwater, added to a long tail that moved slowly. Its voice was slow, diliberate, the sound very low but soft."You have called for me. Here I am."He looked from Ecco to Crestoe, then sank to where only his head was above water.

One sentence. That was all he had managed to speak to the two smaller ones. No longer interested in forming words any longer, the water dragon roared loudly, one recognized by Ecco and Crestoe as the one the heard from the ocean floor. It dove deep, deep enough to touch the bottom so it desired, but this was far more important. Using its wings, feet, arms and tail, it propelled itself at an amazing speed toward the surface. He broke the surface seconds later. His momentum carried him high into the air, and he beat his large wings to keep himself airborne."Was that of your doing?"With that, he starred at the two little ones.

now now now, first off don't take this the wrong way ok?looking at http//www.lassenart.com/images/l/Leap%20of%20Faith.jpg reminds me of a photo I have 0_o Then again there are those nasty "cliqushes" (sp)One person puts a whale in space, we all have to. I've seen few dolphins jumping in sand and one out of spilt water froma glass.2 nights ago I serched for "public domain dolphin images" and sadly got none, thus If i wanted to paint from a pic I'de either have to dodge lawyers or get my own whales. (I was looking for an Arkon.com banner fodder)anyway can somone point me to some "ownerless" photos? those few kind souls that gave up the're copyright on a photo for other's use?now as I said don't take it the wrong way...just more like "whutzzup wif all dez Lassen Knock offs"i wish I could be great. people pay for a "name brand." In art class once a man came in not looking for just wild life art, but Carol Decker's images. She's not the kind of person whos been dead for 300 years, no but wower-willekers a print can sell for $500 a copy no less! heres her work! http//www.novaspace.com/POSTERS/Schimposters.html)sheesh this is enough to make a "wanna be relist" cry to death? to happy your selfs i guess you can gander at my Okekikae (whatever) skills! and drool over my fusslinger skyies! yess my skies are wooly...why?(oekeki at COH's Oekiie)repete do't take this the wrong way...this is an art post for the little guy out there, all of you forgoten artists being steped on by the pros while trying to make a name for yourself. most angles of "over done" wild life i want may require me to work with taxerdermy'ed ones...which is easer to get than a living tigar.*adorns some antlers and leaves*

The great dragon surged further and further into the air, before releasing a roar of triumph. He unfurled his wings in a act of grace and magnificance. He launched his huge body skyward and after a spectacular feat of flight he returned to the ocean. In a far more controled way he turned to ecco. 'Dammit, don't you just hate it when you can't pop your ears?' The dolphin was puzzled for a momment but the dragon continued.'You think i need YOUR help in escaping??? I AM FREE, i need no one!' With that, he let loose a blast of fire large enough to scortch entire cities. 'I am not your taxi service, dolphin - you should be glad, it would be difficult to find a parking place this big. How about this, you bugger off and shit yourself or whatever you dolphins do. And i'll go off and open up a bigass can of whoopass on a few black orcas?' Ecco was annoyed by cameroon's apathy of what ecco was trying to say. 'The destruction of the world is immenant if we do not join together and fight this menace!' Now the huge dragon did take notice. 'Look dolphin, would it really matter if the world did end? like you i've lived a very long time. and for the last 3000 years i've been trapped by a magical force, in my opinion, this world doesn't deserve being saving. if you don't mind, im off to torch something or another, 3000 years really makes you wanna KILL! you can kiss my scaley ass!'With this ecco shouted back at the dragon. 'Look buddy, i don't care how big you are, you can die. If this Vortex King puts his plan into motion, you probably will die. Now, your probably right in thinking you don't care about your own life, and really, one less stupid lizard's not gonna take any skin off my ass.'Cameroon looked down at the tiny dolpin. 'okay you little shit. i'll take you where you wanna go. just don't expect me to sit around and play second fiddle to you!' with that he whisked ecco out of the water. 'Hang on, tight!' he shouted as he shot off into to the sky and did a few loops. as expected, a dolphin can't hang on - tightly or otherwise, and started plumeting downwards....

Many many days went by as a giant red star began to form into a giant second moon over earth which overshadowed the sun. The planet was silent but then a giant swarm of creatures flew out of it as giant tenticles emerged from the planet and attached to earths skys. from withen the tubes more swarms of creatures emerged. The creatures fell to earths seas capturing any life they could and returning to the tenticles which were tubeways that led back to the planet.The panet known to many as dark clouds where the vortex kind thrived feeding upon earth. Much of there technology was damaged but still functional. tubeways connected the alien hive which look like a giant city. though it was not a city for only a civilized race could form such a thing these creatures were drones who worked under the command of one. a creature known by the atlanteans as the vortex king. it was a giant beatle like creature brown in color connected to a giant machine which controled everything. the eyes of this monster opened red.when ever the vortex kings eyes opened it ment someone was going to die.....someone far off but who?a gateway opened to the planet of war. the vortex king seen ther eintire planet and became aware of there plot. the vortex king became aware of Leonus aware of there goals. they werent gonna get away with it.a New improved whitefin appeared in our demension connected to new technology. when the portal opened the king anaylized its signature.....the vortexs awareness of these intruders awoke a being from the distant future. he knew what he had to do.a gateway opened to the planet of war and out appeared the legendary great dark whale apacalypes. he had emerged from a future that hasnt happened yet. his interference in the past was a sign....and what he was about to do was send a message.Apacalypes wore gold metal armor over his dead orca body. his tetth were sharp and power immense. apacalypes looked down upon the planet of war and prepared for his ultimate attack. the oblivion.apacalpyes swam in circles forming a giant red fire which grew in size. the speed of this deadly god like orca was fast forming energy which this deadly attack of mass destruction was about to inflict. then apacalypes stopped. looke down which in turn directed the giant fire to fall. Leonus looked up it was headed for him and his planet. the attack fell right on him burning him into non existence then it consumed the planet and destroyed everything. Leonus and the planet of war was no more...nor would they ever come back.Apacalpyes vanished in an instant..the seven dark whales looked up. they felt his presence and there purpose became more clear. they were setting the stage for a future ruled by orca kind ruled by apacalypes. but they ahd apacalypes there now to aid them whenever they needed him. apcalypes became aware the vortex knew about this altered demension with a planet of war. he knew he had to destroy it cause they were a threat.apacalypes sent a message to thorax...the leader of the seven dark whales....find tyme and kill him....then find ecco.

She felt rage shift through her long body at the sight of this 'god' and charged - but he vanished before she had a chance to attack. Grunting with dissapointment, she swam out into the open ocean. my family lets us open 1 gift christmas eve about 9:00 pm. and all we gotta do is wake up mom and start unwrapping christmas morning

Well, we used to go to our grandma's house on Christmas Eve and open presents, but since she moved we don't anymore. On Christmas Eve we have an old fashioned Christmas where everyone buys a gift that would exist in the 1800's. You can't wrap it in regular paper, you have to use brown bags. 30 a.m. and it's present time!!!

Thyme felt a surge of death wave across him, his home was destroyed, and his father, was dead. "IMPOSSIBLE!" he thought, "why would the King destroy him, he never betrayed anyone." Thyme jumped from the stormy waters and flew up one of the tubes to the vortex king. "King, you have disappointed me, you betrayed my father, only because he was trying to help you!?, he was going to revive whitefin, and the atolm, to put them to your use! you have betrayed for the last time! i will stop you!" the vortex had now started attacking Thyme, he dodged one, and was swiped by one of the kings tentacles, "foul beast! prepare yourself, you will now be judged!" Thyme began to whither, and shake violently, his entire body tore itself apart, he was now in human form again, he began slashing with his sword at the vortex, killing all in the room, then he moved on to the king, he slashed and slashed, the King not looking hurt at all, if you dont see the tentacles falling off everywhere. then thyme blew apart again, he was in dolphin form again, his song pierced through the kings shell, attacking his core, the vortex king was now mortal. then thyme blew apart again, to reveal his true form, an apocalypes, he moved close to the king and sang, "you have been judged, you will not survive to see your so wanted future, thyme exploded in a ball of purple light, and it began to swirl. his very being was stretched beyond belief. then the light exploded again in white light, and imploded. as the air cleared of light, the king was still alive, and Thyme was nowhere in sight. ecco, whitefin, crestoe and the dragon all saw a white light, and thyme appeared in the center still wielding his sword, looking exhausted. ecco and his party were paralyzed, they could breathe though. "great defender, you must destroy the Vortex king, you must put an end to evil, and you must eradicate Arkonviox. do this, and your wishes will be granted." thyme spoke then his light expanded, and he disappeared, and he was never seen again.

((This is to replace OxyMorons post. That is NOT how my character acts, nor does it appear that OxyMoron had read any of my other posts before that. I would ask for the same respect that I give others by not playing their characters for them.))The dragon flapped his wings slowly, lowering himself to the water level. He looked at the little ones evenly. The loud, low voice came from his lips again, still slow and diliberate."Your offer is tempting, small one, but I would have to hear more of your predicament. My name is Myth. I was once king of the sea dragons, but age has forced me to leave leading to the others of my kin."With that, he waited and listened to what the dolphins had to offer.((The following part is in responce to Thymes post.))The flash came, and Myth instantly dove underwater. His age had not given away his sight or hearing, and so he saw the person who had appeared, and heard what he had to say. When he was gone, Myth rose from the water to show only hea head, which was still larger than Ecco."You two seem the topic of great interest this day."

I hope you don't mind me taking control of your char for a bit Myth :)***Whitefin squealed as the bright light flickered across the sky, causing them to freeze. Thymes voice booming across to the group, before dissapearing. Ecco shook his head and rose to the surface of the water, his head jutting out; pumping his tailflukes to stay in place. "Who or what was that?" Ecco questioned to the sky. Myth rose up beside Ecco, looking in the same direction. "I do not know littlefin, all I know is we have a quest to fulfill." "That was Thyme..." Whitefin spoke, startling the two. "Whitefin! Your alive!" Ecco squeaked happily at the sight of another friend. "Yes, I was dead... but Thyme's people became of use to me..." she paused, not wanting to continue to the fact that she felt partly responsible for the destruction of the war planet. "You where dead?" Myth turned and bent his head down, looking at Whitefin's furry face. "I don't trust..." he started, feeling uneasy after the past events. "Its alright, shes a friend" Ecco reassured Myth. Myth nodded. "We better not waste anymore time littlefins" Myth said, as he effortlessly lept from the water into the air, flapping his wings to hover delecately, before lowering his long clawed hands into the water, picking Ecco up carefully, and gripping him so he wouldn't slip from his fingers. "Yes, it is time" Whitefin nodded. "What about you littlefin, I can only carry one" Myth started. "I have my own way of things" she said, hoving out of the water like the great fins of the good future. "Alright" Ecco chirped. "Lets go!"

Okay, so it's just one image.The thing is, I thought it'd be cool to give each of my gaurdian characters a symbol. So, I made up symbols that each stand for something specific and correspond with each ocean and its respective gaurdian.So, I drew all four gaurdians with their symbols. Oh, and btw, it's not to scale. In other words, Salacia and Alignnak are both much bigger compared to the other two than they should be. They're actually quite a bit smaller than that.Hrm...here it is//www.arkonviox.com/modules.php?set_albumName=album03&id=gaurdiansymbols&op=modload&name=gallery&file=index&include=view_photo.phpMechanical pencils are horrible for shading. But I have nothing else.

Myth beat his wing lightly, rising up into the sky. There was no forward motion, or in any other direction, only up. After a moment or two, he let the wind spill from his wings and he dropped. Making sure not to drop Ecco, hew opened his wings to their full length, overshadowing Crestoe and Whitefin. His decent slowed and transfered into forward movement. He raced above the water, the sun reflecting of the waves and illuminating the underside of his body."Where are we going, little one?"The voice seemed a little louder than usual, as if he had to force his mouth and throught to work. Ecco noticed this, and Whitefin did as well as she struggled to keep up.

yessir.

My entire family was sick. But not me. I am freaking invincible. I have immunities to the ten crimes of bhudda, and the million plagues of the world. But I catch cold easily. Go figure.

I actually made all those ymbols up on the spot.Well, actually Tethys's symbol, the Harmony one, was based more-or-less on the Sympathy crest that I made up for my old Digimon fan character. It's supposed to be like two cycles intertwined or something...something like that...I dunno..But the others I just kinda drew without much thought...they were just what came out of my head when I was thinking of those concepts.For each one, I just thought about which concept could be well associated with each ocean. Peace was associated with the Pacific because it means "peaceful", so that was easy. The others I dunno how I came up with...I guess I associated them more with the gaurdians themselves than the oceans. I don't know why the Tethys and the Atlantic is Harmony--it just seemed right. Salacia is a more playful character so I associated her with joy. I had a harder time with Alignak and the Arctic. I wanted it to be something positive and all I could think of was cold. Well, I figured anything that lives there has to be strong. And things in cold waters tend to be big for whatever reason. So I came up with Strength.Yeah...so that's the explanation.

I just joined Deviant Art!Here's my archive//nueva-paz.deviantart.com/Of course, I don't have much at all yet. But just wait.

Lets make a geniric dolphin game togher with rpg maker, or write/design/ect a generic dolphin game, sell it and split the money using high mathimatical skills, and still demand our names on said product.so who's with me?

If we were all near species-less spirtual entities watching the evolution go about "naturaly" (conserning humans as an outside forces raised, and or created and released into the wild by Aliens)who or what would fill in the gap? would real monkeys/apes rule? or would birds be next? this is an open discussion. Sorry it is taking longer then expected. I got some cool art shit for xmas, and I have been fucking around with it all. New pens, paper, what have you. So I am trying to find a good, permanent format for the frames that will allow me to have more room in the comic, and Im looking for easier ways to draw the comics and whatnot. The roughs are done, but I need to screw around with some shit before I get the final versions up. But I am not slacking off, I can assure you. They might come out looking the same when you see them, but I might have found some new, better techniques. Just thought I should post it here since I have been spending less and less time in the chatroom.

This is the first chapter of the new fanfic I am writing. I'm tossing it up here to prove that, in fact, I am still alive and doing stuff of no consequence. Format's kind of screwy, but it's still legible. So look at it, read it if you must, and leave an opinion. If you do not like it and don't leave a reason, I shall be forced to ignore your comment. Which you'll never know about anyway.Two Cities of the Sea~~~~1~~~~ Ketrul looked across the waves from the bow of his ship. The sky wasclear and the sea was calm. There would be smooth sailing on his journey. Helooked up at the great sails that would sent his ship on its way. The sails wereobsolete compared to the abilities of his people, but they were a necessarydisguise in case they encountered a ship from the mainland. His people did notwant to be noticed by the humans, even if they did owe part of their heritage tothem. At the slightest glance the ship could be distinguished from a mainlandvessel. Ketrul's ship, like most others from his native Teranias, was white. Itwas a striking contrast to the usual brown wooden hulls used by Mainlanders.There wasn't much white hull to see in any case. The ship floated low in thewater. The aft deck was nearly level with the surface. The large sails used bythe ship, though not necessary, could alone propel the ship to match the paceof the fastest ships used by the Mainlanders. Atop the sails waved the banner of his people. A blue circle for themother ocean, watched over by the daystar. The daystar promised to alwaysreturn to guide and protect after the darkest night or harshest storm. Ketrul feltreassured that this symbol alone would give his ship the respect it deserved,warning any mainland ships to keep their distance. Ketrul looked down. Dolphins were already gathering around the ship'sprow. He wished he could dive in with them, but his mission dictatedotherwise. His people had been weary of those of Atlantis, and the feeling wasmutual. The two cities were nearly equals, and far superior to those of themainland. All mainland vessels yielded to ships from the two cities, whoyielded only to each other. The first olive branch had been extended a few years ago. It was anattempt endorsed only by Councilor Kinsus. It had been a surprise to the wholecouncil when the Atlanteans returned the offer. The resulting trade agreementbetween Atlantis and Teranias had greatly benefited both cities. Ketrul's mission was to propose a new endeavor to Atlantis. An "Allianceof Knowledge" it had been termed. It was hoped that the resulting cooperationwould open new frontiers in the sea, and maybe someday lead to the stars. Ketrul noticed an Atlantean ship docking across the harbor. Its crewalready preparing to unload cargo and possibly stay for shore leave. Ketruldecided his crew had better get ready for their own voyage.~~~ Bavos swam down the canal. He was a large dolphin, and the respect hehad won from his pod was the reason why he was chosen to represent his kindin the council of Teranias. His powerful flukes sent him on his way quickly andwith a feeling of importance. His aide, a much smaller dolphin, struggled tokeep up. "Why are we in such a hurry to reach the Tower?" asked the aide,respectfully. "Kinsus has requested that we council at noon." Bavos called back. Slightly puzzled, the smaller dolphin swam close to the water's surfaceand cast his eyes toward the sky. "The daystar can not yet be seen above the Tower's gate, why are we insuch a hurry?" Bavos let out a quick laugh. "The meeting's time does not matter. We race to beat the Orca councilor.You watch for her. I believe she lives in that tower just waiting for council to becalled. She even beat Kinsus to his own Atlantis proposal." Bavos had not taken kindly to Kinsus' optimism toward the Atlanteans,and had only reluctantly accepted the series of alliances he had planned. "Has he yet explained his reasoning for calling council?" Questioned theaid. "No, Balae," Responded Bavos, "But I'd wager it has to do with thisAtlantis business."~~~ Tega stepped forward to meet the captain of the Atlantean ship. He wasthe aide to Kinsus, who had asked him to escort the captain personally. "Taj et vey tu." He greeted her. The Atlantean cocked her head slightly as a look of concentrationcrossed her face. Then she smiled. "If I understand correctly, 'Pleasure and good day?'" "I'm impressed." Replied Tega. "I do not know many Atlanteans whohave bothered to learn our language." He walked away from the dock as the Atlantean walked beside him. "We don't have the... skill as you Teranians have at cracking languagebarriers, but I took it upon myself to learn yours." "It is a trick of the mind. We hear and understand. We speak and areunderstood. A gift from the Ancients." Said Tega, referring to the gods ofTeranias. He couldn't help but notice the skeptical look cross the captain's face. "I'm sorry, I don't believe I caught your name." Tega added, politely. "Oh, I should have introduced myself," Said the Atlantean, "I am Lera,Captain and now envoy to Teranias." A smile crept over Tega's face. "May your new title serve you well."~~~ "Who's that, father?" Asked a young child, pointing up at a large statue ofa women dressed in a long, flowing gown. Kinsus looked up at the figure his son was pointing at. "That, Ralu, is Ika Arelia. She rules the night and oversees all the stars,planets, moons, everything beyond the sky." Kinsus had chosen today to bring Ralu to the Museum of the Ancients inthe center of Teranias, to gain a greater appreciation for the gods. "How many stars are up there?" Ralu asked innocently. "Far too many," Replied Kinsus, "Only Arelia knows, for only she hasenough time to count them." Seemingly satisfied, Ralu ran into the next room where an equally grandlikeness of another of the Ancients resided. Kinsus followed as memories of hisown childhood welcomed him back to the room. Ralu stood at the far end, looking confused at the statue that dominatedthe center of the chamber. "Father," He began, "This one isn't like the others." Kinsus looked up at the statue, feigning a look of surprise. "What?" He asked, then looked back at Ralu. "What makes it different?" Ralu looked at his father with disbelief. He knew his father was a smartman, why could he not see the difference? "It doesn't look like us. It's a dolphin." Kinsus looked back at the statue. Then again at Ralu. "Why does that matter?" He asked. He wanted to judge his son's reaction. Ralu thought it over. Well, he thought, Dolphin's look different. That's so they can live in the water. They are smart, but can't build things since they don'thave hands. An Ancient wouldn't need hands, would it? Why would an Ancientlook like a dolphin? Then a larger thought came to mind. Why would an Ancientlook like a Teranian? Ralu couldn't find a good reason. "Does it matter?" He asked. Kinsus smiled. "No. This is Ika Setra. She oversees the ocean, and guides those who tryto sail it. She can be as calm as ice or as angry as a tempest. She is just the sameas the others, and if she lives in the sea, why shouldn't she choose to look likeone of its residents?" Ralu found justification in the answer, and studied Setra's likeness witha new found respect. Kinsus couldn't help but do the same. All Teraniansshowed reverence toward to sea, and Kinsus made a point to respect everythingit included. He didn't notice Tega walk up behind him until he heard hisbreath. "Excuse me, Sir," Tega began, "But the Atlantean ship has docked and itscaptain is awaiting you and Bavos in the Tower." Kinsus nodded. "Yes, thank you, could you watch over Ralu for me? I hope for this to bequick." Tega looked over at Ralu, then smiled at Kinsus. "Revisiting your childhood I see." Kinsus returned the smile. "Maybe he will enjoy it as much as I do." Tega began to follow Ralu, who was slowly entering the next chamber. "I'll see to it." He called back. As he walked back to the museum's entrance, Kinsus had to laugh at thesound of Ralu's voice drifting back from the next camber. "What is this one!" "That," came the sound of Tega's voice now, "Is what the Mainlanderswould call a 'dragon.' To us, it is Tyras, Ika of Fire." Kinsus wished he could see the look on Ralu's face now.~~~ "What do you mean 'It's not here?'" Ketrul asked his crew mate. "I mean what I said," the sailor replied, "The navigation electronics saythis is where Atlantis is, but there is no evidence we can see of there ever beinga city here." Ketrul frowned. "Are you sure it is working? Electronics have been known to lie." "Not likely, electronics don't make such mistakes any more. We'vebecome much better over the years at building and teaching them." Ketrul didn't like placing his trust in an electronic. He walked out on tothe deck of his ship, its false sails billowing in the fresh breeze. It certainlydidn't look like the great city of Atlantis should be there. He went to the edge of the deck and gave a long high-pitched whistleover the side. Shortly after, the head of a blue dolphin rose above the water.Teranian dolphins were known for their odd and seemingly random skincoloration. Ketrul was grateful he was Teranian or else he would need anotherelectronic to talk to the dolphin. "Artreus," He called down. "Can you see anything that looks like it wasfrom Atlantis from down below?" The dolphin sank into the water, then rose almost clear of it by strongsweeps of its tail. He could almost look over the low deck of the ship. "I have seen nothing from bellow but the ocean's floor." Came thedolphin's response. Ketrul frowned. "Take Surina and go back down. Make a thorough search. If you suspectanything down there can be linked to Atlantis, come back and tell meimmediately." At this comment, another head rose from the water, this one pale gray."We will look hard," Said Surina, "Nothing of Atlantis can hid from out sight orsound." The two dolphins sank back into the water, hardly making a splash. Ketrul headed back for his cabin and pulled out a small box from underhis bed. "What's that for?" Asked the sailor, who stood anxiously by his captain'sside. "This," said Ketrul, holding up a sextant and compass, "Is my shield froma broken electronic."

And a new CG! Gasp! O.o; This is also for my friend.http://sailorgalaxy.vortx.net/rpc/kinjisano.png

I was sitting here thinking just now...what if there was a thread where we artists could post art trade requests? So I made this thead! I'll explain how it works, with rules and all, then I'll give an example.How It Works1) If you ask to do a trade with a specific artist, that person has the right to reject the request.2) When leaving a trade out on the floor, so to speak, it's first come, first serve. For example, if I started a public trade, the first person to reply to my request is the person I will do the trade with; any posts after that will be ignored.3) When replying to a trade, make sure you quote that person's post by using the "Quote" option on the forum; for those of you who don't know (but really, who wouldn't around here?), the "Quote" option is that little button in the corner of every post - it looks like quotation marks.Example TradeType of Trade humanResources for Piece (these can either be text links or pictures posted using the image tags)//sailorgalaxy.vortx.net/junsui.pngNow let's say that someone accepted my trade. When they reply, in their message they should include my original post, plus their picture info.That's all there is to it! ^_^ Let's get trading! I'll start by posting my first trade request, which just happens to be the example trade. >;p~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Type of Trade humanResources for Piece//sailorgalaxy.vortx.net/junsui.png

I don't understand what a trade is...Sorry, Kitnee, but it's true... :?

httpshock: Are they 2 females ?!?!

Heh - no, Sten. ^^; The one on the left is my best friend (who is a girl), and the one on the right is one of my Phantasy Star Online characters that she finds particularly handsome. So I drew the two of them kissing. >^^<

Ah, that's my fault - didn't explain what a trade actually was. ^^;;;; An art trade is a trade of pictures between two people. Like, one person draws a picture for someone, and in return the other person draws a picture for the first person. Was that helpful?

That means adding some flash to the site or play with animated gifs. Both of the ways mean animation work, and that's hard to do.By the way, probably I'm wrong, but that necklace in your avatar reminds me that game... "fate of atlantis".

I have been having a dilemna lately. It concerns my comic, channel darkseas. My scanner, in short, is hooped. Shanked. dead. fucked. gone. I dont know what the hell happened when I was away, but its okay...I am getting it fixed soon enough, and can use my other one for minor things. I have been designing a new style...a new WAY for my comic. It will have the same characters, etc. But I need to think of a new layout, and an easier way to make it. A template of some kind. The fact is, I simply don't like how it looks. I always wanted it to have a certain level of...UN-professionalism. But that Idea just never worked, as the comics have good looking parts, and bad looking parts. In short, it makes them look stupid.I have been reading comics lately on the web, whos main feature is that they look bad, and can make fun of themselves because of it. This also makes it much easier for the authors of the comics to make them on a daily basis, giving you a wide range of comics to select from whenever you go to the site. I like that idea. And instead of copying it, I am going to make my own way that uses the same idea.Expect comics soon. Just not as soon as you hoped to see them

shuuuttuuup....o_o;Can anyone give me directions to a good sprite editing program? or a ripping program of some kind?

I dunno about a ripper - I just usually take screenshots and rip them by hand. What I do is disable the palette layers that comprise the background so it's easier for me to rip the sprite.As for the editor, just plain old MSPaint works. Or you could use PainShopPro or Photoshop if you have them.

Hmm, "Actives are set", eh? shock: Asterite's Cave. You had me replaying Ecco Jr. a minute ago.I guess that's the green flag for Atolm then.

Recently, one of my friends, and ex-manager at A&W (Arsenal and Delphi might have heard about this on the news...) was killed in a car accident. None of you probably knew him...so it might not matter to you. But the internet, and this webpage, has served as an outlet of my thoughts, and It is one of the only ways to show my respect.So I present to you a tiny article about him, and why he will be missed.Clayton was his name. The dude in glasses and an A&W tie that served all of those vicious, life sucking customers food every night, all night. He had to deal with some rough stuff. drunks, morons, people who dont like their meat "Raw". But he was always a great guy about it. Every day, he would go to sleep, as he worked night shifts. He would come in, and rant about video games for a few hours before he worked, and we would discuss all the tiny details of our meager lives. Mostly concerning Gamecube. I didn't spend a lot of time outside of work with the guy. We just made fun of people, drank pop, and talked about what level we were on in Timesplitters. He was 20, was a manager, had a girlfriend, and a good circle of friends...He also came from a family of 8 brothers and sisters, and everyone knew him around the area. Boxing day night, he was with his friend Will. It was Wills birthday, and they had just got off work. Popping a new cd into the player, they drove down the highway, having a good time. Clayton went to change cd's, and turned a corner. Instead of braking to slow down, he hit the accelerator by accident, and slammed into a pole. The pole fell, straight through the middle of the car, splitting the vehicle in half. Clayton was thrown out. The impact caused his seat belt to snap. He hit the pavement, and died instantly. Quick, and we hope, painless. His family is devestated. His brother and sister, age 15 and 18, go to the same school as me, and are in ruin. So, I finish this article. He was a great guy, and was only 20. He didn't deserve what happened. But it did, and there is nothing we can do.so buddy, I just hope your in a better place, playing better games, on better systems, with better women. You will be missed greatly by lots of us, and I just hope it is better up there then it is down here.Rest in peace. I'll go kill a Time Splitter for ya..- Joel "Phosis" Peterson

I only just got my computer back on in my room at the moment. Thank you so much for letting them know Trellia *hugs*. Currently we are again still on standby for the next three days, as high winds and scorching temps are a threat to the backburning they're attempting. I can tell you exactly how close the fires got to my house. We live in Conder, a southern sub-urban area. We are next to an area called banks, and about 10 mins walk away is Gordon. Te fires that broke out on the hill in Gordon spread right through it, and got as far as the shops there. That was freaky to know. What was freakier was that at 3pm the smoke went black and the sky was as dark as night, with red glows surrounding our area. It was so dark that it looked like it was 10 pm because the street lights came on. I think the current stats areFour people are dead,30 are injured - 2 are critically injured (have been flown to Sydney),368 houses have been lost (over a hundred of those are in Duffy and Chapman alone),Main Servaces have been put under preasure due to some of the sub-plants being burnt down; (Water, Gas, Electricity and Sewrage),The Sewrage Treatment plant is threatening to overflow and contaminate the Molonglo river, which is our water supply,All suburbs that where/are under threat are to remain on high alert as fires could break out again. I still have all my stuff packed in my suitcase and travel bag - we're readyto just load it into the car and run if we need to. Because what my dad said is that if we have to evacuate, and it comes over any of the ridges near us, we have about 10-15 mins to get out before it jumps the main road out. Meh... I hate fire.. but yes, i'm still alive, we still have a house, and even if we loose the house if fire gets near us, we've got photos of all our belongings and an inventory so we can re-insure all we own beforehand. Hehe. ^_^

Well, this topic might seem to be useless for some of you, but I want to ask if anybody knows... Who or what exactly is Asterite? Where he came from? And what is his mission on Earth? Could somebody who knows tell me please?

Yeah, I don't think I've ever met you before, either, but welcome back anyway! Nice to see more oldbies coming back. :)

To tell the truth, I don't think anybody really knows. All we know is that there was an evil Asterite in the past. Now whether this is the Asterite Ecco knows or just a twin brother or something (I prefer the latter in my stories) is a mystery. It's not really clear what the Asterite's purpose is, other than to aid Ecco on his quest to defeat the Vortex. I like to think of the Asterite as the all-powerful, all-knowing being of the seas that can grant anything to a sea creature; but then again, that's just my stories talking.

I think, At, that Tehys is waiting for someone to take her up on her trade.As for me, no trades as of yet, but I just wanted to say that I'm really glad this thread's taken off so nicely, and so fast, too!Oh, and Cally if you read this, because of your current situation, I don't even mind if you can't get my picture to me at all; that's the last thing you should worry about right now. *hugs*

Well I finally got around to reading your story there Pho, and I have to say I wish I would have read it sooner!! Did you really write that?! I think it's awesome!!! Seriously... the names, and style, and just the way your write is brilliant! I don't know what to say man, I didn't know you could write so well.First off... I really liked the five elements you chose: Fire, Water, Earth, Wood, And Metal. It's usually just fire, wind water and earth, but you really mixed it up there. I love the idea of the Metal dragon! I first got a wicked picture in my head... I think you should draw the five. ^_- I think that they would look really cool.Anyways, I'll tell you what I got out of it... the whole idea of Kai standing in that painful position brought up the idea of like, self-perseverance. And I really liked the part where his father was talking about not showing off your strength. I though that was a good theme too. The thing I liked most about it, is that you didn't just sit there and start talking about things for no reason... it all sprouted from Kai. No rambling.If you guys haven't read it, I suggest you READ IT! Good stuff Pho, really good stuff!

BAN!!!Ha hahaha! I loved that part... good stuff, good stuff. 8)

I actually really surprised myself with how that one came out. I'm not really good a computer coloring, so you can imagine I was pretty happy with that! I'll fill you in on a little trick that I leaned on skin that really gives it some life...After you coloring it all up, grab a big, soft paint brush (I use the size 65 one) and get a vibrant red. Like RED red. Then set the opacity to 0 and gently give him some color around the cheeks, nose, ears, knuckles, and places like that.I found that that really gives some depth!
