actualy we havent proven the earth is not hollow, again it could be a little hallow and a little not or hallow completly, but if you ever seen concepts of what the hallow earth would be like its actualy quite beautiful. imagine falling deep into the earth into a dark cave only to feel like you come out of the suyrface again to see the sun a sky and clouds but relly your just inside the earth.The geofront from Neon Genesis Evangelion.http://membres.lycos.fr/imagesmanganimation/Evagenesis/glossaire/geofront.jpg

Well, I was just saying, there's more evidence of the earth not being hollow. It is a very interesting concept however. Really we don't know what is in the center of the earth, most speculation says its molten but then again no one's ever been there. And it just goes to show how little we really know about our own miserable little planet.

Actually scientist's think the inner core is solid metal, due the pressure. The mantle has two layers, one that's flowing solid (kinda like silly putty or something) and the other that's partly molten. Than the outer core is molten. And the inner core is solid. Of course no one's been inside the earth to prove this, but the evidence comes from certain kinds of technology, as well as volcanoes and lava rocks and things like that. If the earth were hollow, how would you explain volcanoes and such. And it just doesn't seem like it would be possible, not with the way we think planets are created. And I can't imagine how a hollow planet could be created even if we were wrong.

I found this link which actualy gives how plato described atlantis and what its origins relly are, its a myth sorta, but it ties into ancient greek Atlantis - The isle of Atlas. And the continent of posied.http://www.pantheon.org/articles/a/atlantis.htmlThe story of the Isle of Atlantis first occurs in Plato's two dialogues the "Timaeus" and the "Critias." Plato's story centers on Solon, a great Greek legislator and poet who journeyed to Egypt some 150 years earlier. While in the Egyptian city of Sais Solon received the story of Atlantis from priests. The priests respected Solon's reputation and cordially welcomed him. They also respected the Athenians, whom they regarded as kinsmen, because they believed their deity Neith to be the same deity as the Greeks called Athena. Therefore, she was believed to be the patroness and protector of both Greece and Egypt.The story that the priests told Solon was unknown to him. According to ancient Egyptian temple records the Athenians fought an aggressive war against the rulers of Atlantis some nine thousand years earlier and won.These ancient and powerful kings or rulers of Atlantis had formed a confederation by which they controlled Atlantis and other islands as well. They began a war from their homeland in the Atlantic Ocean and sent fighting troops to Europe and Asia. Against this attack the men of Athens formed a coalition from all over Greece to halt it. When this coalition met difficulties their allies deserted them and the Athenians fought on alone to defeat the Atlantian rulers. They stopped an invasion of their own country as well as freeing Egypt and eventually every country under the control of the rulers of Atlantis.Shortly after their victory, even before the Athenians could return home, Atlantis suffered catastrophic earthquakes and floods until it disappeared beneath the sea. All of the brave men were swallowed up in one day and night of horror according to legend. This is why the Egyptians were ever grateful to the Athenians.Also in the story Plato gives is a history of Atlantis that shows how the rulers eroded to such a state were they wanted to conquer everyone. This history had been recorded by Solon in notes that were handed down through his family.According to Solon's notes the history of Atlantis began at the beginning of time. It was then that the immortal gods divided the world among themselves and each ruled their proportion. The god Poseidon received Atlantis, an island larger the Libya and Asia combined. He chose for a wife the mortal woman Cleito, and with her begun the royal family of Atlantis.Poseidon built Cleito's home on a high hill at the very center of the island. The home overlooked a fertile plain bordered by the sea. For his beloved wife's protection Poseidon surrounded her house with five concentric rings of water and land. He carved the rings with the ease and skill of a god. He made hot and cold springs come from the earth. With the development of a future city his descendants never lacked for water.Cleito bore Poseidon ten sons, five sets of boys. Atlas the first son of the first set of twins, was made king over the vast territory by his father. His brothers were appointed princes and each ruled over a large section of the territory that was distributed to him. The most valuable section of the kingdom remained his mother's home on the hilltop and the land surrounding it. This was given to Atlas. Atlas himself had many sons with the succession of the throne always passing to the eldest son.For generations Atlantis remained peaceful and prospered. Almost all of the population's needs were met from the island's mines, fields and forests. Anything that the kingdom did not produce was imported. This was possible because a channel was eventually built which transversed all the rings from the ocean to the center of the kingdom, or the acropolis. On this stood the royal palace near the original home of Poseidon and Cleito. Each succeeding king tried to out do his predecessor in building a greater kingdom. Finally the splendid city Metropolis and the outer city of Atlantis existed behind a great outer wall.Poseidon sat down laws for Atlantis that the rulers were to fellow. The ruling body was to meet regularly. It was to consist of ten rulers that represented the first rulers -- Atlas and his nine brothers -- who reigned with absolute power of life and death over their subjects. These meeting occurred in the temple of Poseidon where the first rulers inscribed the laws on a pillar of orichalcum. First, as required by ancient ceremony, pledges were exchanged. Then a sacred bull was captured and killed. The body was burned as a sacrifice to the god. Then the blood was mixed with wine and poured over the fire as a act of purification for each man. The rulers were served wine in golden cups, each poured a libation over the fire and swore by oath to give judgment according to the inscribed laws. When ending his vow each drank his wine and dedicated his cup to the temple. This was followed by a dinner that preceded the rulers putting on magnificent blue robes in which they judged matters concerning the kingdom according to Poseidon's laws.As long as they judged and lived by Poseidon's laws they and the kingdom prospered. When the laws began to be forgotten trouble began. More of the rulers eventually began marrying mortals and started acting like foolish humans. Soon pride overtook the rulers who soon began grasping for greater power. Then Zeus saw what had happened to the rulers. They had abandoned the laws of the gods and acted in an evil coalition as men. He assembled all the gods of Olympus around him and was to pronounce judgment on Atlantis. This is where Plato's story stops.Whether Plato intended to end his story of Atlantis so abruptly or whether he intended to extend it no one knows. Just as no one knows whether Plato believed in the real existence of the island or whether it was purely a mythical kingdom. Many have said they believe that Plato believed in the island's existence because he exerted so much detail in its description, while others reject this by claiming since the story was purely fiction Plato could put in as much detail as he wanted, it does not prove a thing. Also in doubt is the time period of the story. Solon writes the island existed 9000 years before. This would place the time period in the Early Stone Age. In this period it is hard to imagine the type of agriculture, architecture and sea navigation as described in the story. One explanation for this time period inconsistency is that Solon misinterpreted the Egyptian symbol for "100" for "1000." If this be the case then Atlantis would have existed 900 years before. This would place the Atlantians in the Middle Bronze Age where they would possess the tools and equipment needed for the development described within the story.To collaborate this 900 year theory there is geological evidence showing that roughly about 1500 BCE there was a gigantic volcanic eruption which caused half of the island to sink into the sea. Also a lost city has been said to have sunk in the Bay of Naples. At the time several rich and luxurious seaside resorts were located in the area. In the retelling of the story of Atlantis it is easy to see how one of these cities could be associated with it. The story is still being told which enthralls hundreds, as archaeological digs are conducted to unearth evidence of the real Atlantis. Until then the myth remains.

Oh man, that happened to me too! I saw myself loged in under Tethys. I went ahead and loged out right then. :?So you were me and I was you. Interesting...Argh! I went to post in here and it happened AGAIN! >.< Something weird is going on here.But then that's a pretty obvious statemtent.

i'll look into it and see whats going on when i get a chance.

I actually read the whole thing this time.The story about Poseidon kinda contradicts what I've read about Greek mythology. He was ruler of the sea, so it makes sense he would rule over an island like Atlantis. But his wife was a naiad (se nymph) called Amphitrite, and there's even a story about how he sent the dolphin named Delphineus to bring her to him so that he could marry her. Also, Atlas is the name of a titan, who was said to hold up the earth, or the sky in some versians. It was that Atlas that gave his name to the Atlas mountains. However, mythology does often chance over time, and sometimes names are changed or given over to different characters. And it doesn't mean Atlantis itself wasn't real in some form or another. Though I do kind of have to wonder if Cleito only had sons, than where did the rest of the people come from if they didn't marry anyone outside Atlantis...I think the stories about Atlantis are probably mostly legend, but it's possible that they are all based off an actual place. Sometimes people or places become attached to stories and legends and are thus transformed into something completely different. And names are often changed, especially in older times when every group of people that encountered a place would have a different name for it. And they gave different names to the people they encountered as well.I was just thinking that Atlantis is actually kinda similar to Avalon. Avalon was a magical island inhabited by faery people--referring to people that were descended from the gods, althogh there are different versians of who they were exactly. And like Atlantis, Avalon eventually dissappeared. Although as far as I know there was no volcano associated with it, and it apparantly just disappeared without a trace.Chances are anything with a similar story to Atlantis is really the same place, just with different names and other variations. The mythology of peoples of Europe were all similar in many ways, and there are even some stories that reach overseas. So a story such as the one of Atlantis could easily have spread to other areas in the same way. And it it was based on a real place, different groups of people could have seen the same place and created similar stories.

I really do hate the use of "lol" 95% of the time. "Lol" is supposed to mean "laugh out loud". Thing is...when do people actually laugh out loud when they write that?

I use LOL when I'm making a sarcastic comment. It's more like a soft chuckle to me. O_o. But it does sound stupid if you use it every other word. 'blahblah LOL blah LOL blah blah...'...Childish, if you ask me.

I can actually hear a dog whistle, too.But dogs do hear much higher frequencies than we do.I already knew that about dolphins, though.But research has been indicating that animals communicate in more advanced ways then we previously thought. Like elephents actually make sounds at a lower frequency than what we can hear, and they have many different sounds that they make that all mean different things.Basically it shows animals are probably more intelligent than we give them credit for. Sure they don't go around building machines or anything, but they don't have need for anything like that. And some animals do build stuff.

trilobite

one apon a time there was a princess named tootie. Her kingdome is in termoil with neghboring termoil. Perviously in centureys past they were at war with the next most prolific kingdom, but they made a contract. Tootie had to marry the prince. Tootie was a true individual, she was kind, pretty and had humor. The only thing thouh is she had terrible flautance. Tootie didn't let this hold her back she traind every day to be the best queen she could, even with some poots and toots, she'd stride with books on her head, practice the harpisacord and study diplomacy. Even if her constant breaking wind somtimes broke her consitration. The day came when Tootie learnt that she was being used as a political object, this broke her heart and made her loose confidance in herself...now shes just barter to get a past advercasy to join forces!? Never! Tootie sobed and sobed all day and night, her studies failed and her apperance looked as bad has her gas was. She kept on thinking of this prince as a stuck up fop, alhough the idea of marrying a sexy man was titliating, it still unerved her to no end. "I'm only 13 she cried, this lechurchus feind must be some 34 year old pompus basterd" Her fists pounded the mattres as the sorrowfull rain pounded the earth.The day finnaly came when she was meeting her life-mate to be. Tootie scuffled down the isle with her head tilted down to hide her tears. When she reached the alter she sniffed and sniffled with sadness. Then she sniffed the air......"what in gods name is that odor?" she thought "it smells like burning Minks and ripe cheeze" when she looked up there, in royal garb was a ganngly pencil necked skinky prince....they looked each other in the eyes, and pooting with excitment she fell in love with him instantly, the prince also sought reffuge in her passions. and from that day on they made a new kingdom based on true love.the moral of this story is to be yourself

As for the giant medusa, that's just what it is...not it's name. The term medusa refers to the adult stage of a jellyfish, or something like that. Same goes for the moray, that's just a species name. And I figured "eight arms" was just what they call octopi, the same way they call sharks "hungry ones" and dolphins "singers".And you forgot Kitnee.

tethys was actualy a greek god if i remember right and also the name of one of i think saturns moons but i might be wrong.Tethys is a titaness, that is a female titan. She was married to the titan called Oceanus. As I have mentioned more than once in the past. And yes, it is also the name of one of Saturn's moons. But I got the name from Greek mythology--I hadn't heard of anything else with the name at that time.Scientists are always naming stuff after Greek and Roman gods. And some from other mythologies as well.

http://www.pantheon.org/articles/t/tethys.htmlThe personification of the fertile ocean. She married her brother Oceanus and had over 3000 children by him, they were the springs, lakes, rivers of the world. Tethys was the god-mother of Rhea and raised her during the civil war between the Titans and the Olympians.

http://www.pantheon.org/articles/t/tethys.htmlThe personification of the fertile ocean. She married her brother Oceanus and had over 3000 children by him, they were the springs, lakes, rivers of the world. Tethys was the god-mother of Rhea and raised her during the civil war between the Titans and the Olympians.See, I already knew all that. Except for the part about her being godmother of Rhea. I figured the titans were all siblings. But she raised her during the war between the titans and the gods? That doesn't really make sense considering Rhea is the mother of the Olympian gods.And 3000 children may -seem- like a lot, but you have to consider they were all the rivers and lakes in the world. Or rather in the ancient Grecian world, which basically just consisted of Europe and part of the middle east. Consider how few 3000 is, if their children had been ALL of the rivers and lakes in the ENTIRE world.And it wasn't uncommone for gods and titans to marry their sisters, either. But I figure that's because there wasn't anyone else. Especially early on, when there weren't any humans or semi-devine beings or even any gods besides the original six. And what god is gonna marry a mortal anyway.

I like cats...My mom's a total dog person though, I haven' had a cat since I was about five. Always had dogs my entire life, but they're great pets. Save when they bark and don't shut up....Hee hee. My doggy. She's five, but still looks like a puppy.

Ha ha, I was just thinking about that earlier. Time is relative. At least the way it's measured. I mean, a year here is only a year here...go to some other planet and a year there is totally different. Time exists, but not in hours and minutes the way we measure it. Days here are as long as they are because that's how long it takes for the Earth to rotate 360 degrees. A day on Venus, for example, is over 200 Earth days.... And like Thethys said, time in the depths of space is totally different. There's nothing really to measure it by.When we say 'the solar system formed 4 billion years ago' that's four billion of our years. Sure it's the same amount of time however you measure it, but 'year' 'minute' and 'hour' exist for our convenience.Gwa. Time theories...they make the brain hurt.

Plants are alive, but you wouldn't consider a plant a character. Even if it played a significant role. Listen up brothers and sisters! Come here my desperate tale, I speak of our friends of nature trapped in the dirt like a jail. Vegetables live in oppression, served on out tables each night, this killing of veggies is madness, I say we take up the fight! Salads are only for murderers! Coalslaw's a facioust rajime! GabrielIn Judeo-Christian belief, the archangel of Annunciation, Resurrection, Mercy, Revelation and Death. Also known in Hebrew orthography as Gabri-el. The angel who gave the Annunciation of Christ's birth to the Virgin Mary, and also the angel responsible for blowing the Trump on Judgment Day.In Islamic belief, the angel who dictated the Q'uran to Muhammad, and the angel of Truth.Some theological thought holds that Gabriel is (as much as angels can be) female, the only one among a male or androgynous Host. The name is derived from the Sumerian root GBR, governor. mainly arkons traits are he can regenerate, and he is a see'er when st gabriel was destroyed he was reborn as arkon's there are seven all together.for some reason Arkonviox is the one destined to collect the powers of the others. he is both good and evil, and even as a badguy somehow fate plays under his rules. This was just a light pencil drawing in my sketchbook that I never bothered to finish...well I wanted to do something with it so I scanned it and coloured it on the computer. Sadly I have no tablet so I had to do it all with the mouse...but I'm fairly pleased with the way it turned out. Could of done a bit more shading on the dragon though. And it got a little messed up when I converted it to jpeg, but not too badly.

Once upon a time in ChinaSome believe around the year, one-double knot-three.Head priest of The White Lotus Clan Pai MeiWas walking down the roadContemplating whatever a man with Pai Mei's infinite power would contemplateWhich is another way of saying, who knows.When, a Shaolin monk appeared on the road traveling in the opposite direction.As the monk and the priest crossed paths...Pai Mei in a practically unfathomable display of generosityGave the monk the slightest of nods.The nod, was not returned.Now was it the intention of the Shaolin monk to insult Pai Mei ?Or, did he just fail to see the generous social gesture?The motives of the monk, remain unknown.What is known, were the consequences.The next morning Pai Mei appeared at the Shaolin Temple,And demanded that the temple's head Abbot offer Pai Mei his neck to repay the insult.The Abbot, at first, tried to console Pai Mei, only to find, Pai Mei was inconsolable.So began, the massacre of the Shaolin Temple,And all sixty of the monks inside,At the fists of the White Lotus.And so began, the legend of Pai Mei's Five-Point PalmExploding Heart Technique.I went and seen Kill Bill 2 a few weeks ago and ran into a guy in the movie called Pai Mei turns out he was the same actor playing the same character in another movie i seen a few years back called Fist of the White lotus.Well to make this story wierd and more interesting turns out Pai Mei actualy was a real historical figure who relly did have a five finger technqiue that killed people and relly did take over a temple.Anyhow i just thuoght id post this cause Pai Mei kicks ass.

I started working on information on what Ecco 1 and 2 are about. Problem is im not a very good writer because my grammar is poor.So i just wanted to see if anyone wanted to help me patch this up some.If your gonna patch this up i need you to copy the intire thing and repost it with the changes. I dont want you to make changes and post only the changes i need the whole thing. So if your interested please help me with this.---------------------------------------------------------------About Ecco the DolphinEcco was a young dolphin, with five bright silvery marks on his head, which looked like stars forming constellation delphenuis. His family believed the marks on his head where a sign of his destiny. One day a great storm happened, which swallowed his family in a vortex of wind and water, they vanished into the sky. Ecco set off to find his family, meeting an orca who guided him along his journey to find Big Blue, a blue whale who is very old and very wise.Ecco meets Big Blue, who awaits his death in the cold Arctic sea. Ecco has fought off Arctic spiders to get to this point. Big Blue reveals that the storm, which has taken Ecco's family, is a rare one which occurs once every 500 years. All life vanishes at the eye of the storm, but it is unknown why this happens, but there is one older and wiser then Big Blue, called the Asterite. The Asterite is the oldest creature in the sea, and may have existed since before prehistoric times. Ecco sets off to find the Asterite, who lives within a deep chasm, inside a dark cave. Ecco lays his eyes on a creature of great mystical power and benevolence. It is made up of spheres or globes, each individually colored, moving in rythm with one another. The Asterite recognizes Ecco as if they met before, speaking only through thoughts. Ecco notices the Asterite has an empty spot in its rhythmically moving globes, one missing globe. The Asterite shows Ecco a city called Atlantis, a machine that can go back in time, and a place where the missing globe lies. If Ecco can retrieve this globe the Asterite can grant him incredible power. Ecco finds the gateway to Atlantis where he finds crystals called glyphs, which when sung to, sing a different tune back. He also finds rings, which when swam through, can take you to a place far off. The glyphs tell Ecco of great disaster which caused Atlantis to sink. A beam from space put everything into ruins. Survivors fled into the past using their technology. Ecco finds the time machine, a message reveals to him only recognized ones are allowed to travel in time. Ecco precedes with using the time machine, it recognized him, Ecco opens a doorway into the past.Ecco travels back 65 million years, he finds creatures different from his own era. He jumps into the sky for a breath of air, a Pteranadon grabs him. The Pteranadon drops him in a place where creatures communicate much like dolphins. Ecco sings to them, discovering the songs come from creatures on land. The land creatures must be ancestors to Ecco, to dolphin kind. They hear Ecco's song and plunge into the sea to investigate. Ecco dives, noticing he is near his objective. Deep in a dark cave Ecco finds a completely whole Asterite. Ecco attacks it as it attacks back with bolts of energy, Ecco manages to free a globe which triggers his return home, to the future, to the present.Ecco returns the globe to the Asterite who empowers Ecco. Ecco can heals himself, doesn't need to go to the surface for breaths, is stronger. Can create a pulse of sound that becomes an energy wave, is faster. Ecco is now ready to travel back to the moment of the storm and save his family.Upon returning to Atlantis Ecco finds a library of glyphs he did not notice before. The glyphs tell of a planet called Vortex in the star system Cassandra, located in the head of constellation Pegasus. Vortex is dying and can no longer produce food. Every 500 years when Earth and Vortex have a clear path, the Vortex feed upon the Earth. The Atlanteans inscribed messages into glyphs, created teleport rings to help a Dolphin of the future travel to Vortex. Ecco's destiny has just been revealed to him.Ecco finds the Atlantean time machine, he travels back to the moment of the storm. The storm begins and Ecco is pulled up with his family, into a tube, into a machine. Ecco fights his way through strange Vortex creatures, all the way up to their Queen. Ecco destroys the Queen and saves his family and returns to Earth. As Ecco and his family celebrate, one of his family member asks him "Do you think the Vortex are destroyed?". ---------------------------------------------------------------About the Tides of TimeWhen Ecco traveled to the Vortex world, the Queen realized the Asterite empowered him. As Ecco escaped with his family, the Queen followed him back to Earth. She quickly finds the Asterite and destroys it. Ecco loses his power in response, he is no longer safe as Vortex close in on him.Suddenly a doorway much like the one that allows Ecco to travel in time appears. A very unusual Dolphin appears with very long fins and dorsal. She calls herself Trellia, from a possible future opposite to a dark future created by Vortex. She wants Ecco to travel forward with her, an old friend wishes to speak to him. Ecco touches her, allowing him to follow her.Trellia shows Ecco her world, water tubes which can be swam through, islands which float on air. Ecco finds pockets of air which when exposed to sound can launch him high into the sky. After millions of years great eruptions occurred and the ocean became conscious. It created water tubes connecting all the seas of Earth. Dolphins realized the eruptions created a lot of helium. Much of the rocks of the floating islands can hold helium. The Dolphins learned to carry helium allowing them to float. After ten thousand years they learned to fly.Trellia takes Ecco to the water tubes where he can find his friend. She tells him how a giant Medusa which resembles a jellyfish lurks the tubes. The tubes have currents, have holes, have whirlpools many traits that can be found in the sea. Ecco keeps his focus, knowing one wrong move will cause him to fall thousands of feet to his death. As Ecco became more comfortable with his new environment the Medusa lurked towards him, reaching out with her tentacles to grab whatever she reaches to throw out of her aqua nest. Ecco knew the only way to get passed her was to be quick, because fighting her pose an extreme risk, she can float, Ecco cannot. Ecco discovers metaspheres left by the Asterite to allow Ecco to morph into different life forms. Ecco uses the metaspheres to transform into a bird, then a shark, and a jellyfish, until he reaches his destination. Trellia brought Ecco into the future so the Asterite could speak to him. The Asterite is much evolved now, with silvery globes. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex queen tried to destroy it. Ecco must return to his own time to collect the globes to restore it back to life. The Asterite tells Ecco he is the stone which splits the stream into two, that theres two possible futures for Earth and only he can prevent the dark vortex future. The asterite gives Ecco a metasphere which sends Ecco back to his own time.Ecco returns to the present where he eventually meets Blackfin of the four islands. Blackfin takes Ecco to Tara who knows the way to the sea of darkness where he can find the first pair of the many Asterite globes. It's in the sea of darkness Ecco learns Vortex from the dark future have come and stolen the final pair, but the first pair is under the possession of the Moray deep in the abyss. Deep in the abyss the shelled Moray becomes a keeper. Ecco defeats the Moray gaining the first two of many globes. The first pair tells him to go out and seek more of them. Ecco travels back and forth with the aid of teleport rings collecting the missing globes. Ecco collects them all realizing theres a final pair that cannot be retrieved. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex Queen has gained knowledge of the time machine. Vortex from the dark future used this knowledge to steal the final pair of globes, but the time machine cannot travel into the future, it can only go up the stream of time into the past. Ecco searches for another way to retrieve the final pair, he discovers the Queen has spawned a new race of Vortex that dies when exposed to light. He also notices how the regular Vortexes have changed blue from being on Earth. Then out of the darkness Ecco is grabbed by two strange creatures. They open a doorway in time and take Ecco into the future, the dark future.When Ecco arrives into the dark future his two captors burst into pieces. The sky is a red and orange color, Ecco appears to be in some sort of machine. Strange round squishy creatures called Amoebas start noticing there new visitor. Ecco also realizes this machine he's in can defies gravity. There is not a lot of creatures guarding this machine, but the machine has a lot of traps. Ecco searches for the final two globes. As he searches, he wonders, where are all the Dolphins? Then the answer comes to him, a metal creature awakens. It looks like a metal shark, then a sharp spike emerges from its face.Something begins to emerge from this creature's backside, a rocket ready to propel this creature full speed into Ecco. Ecco realizes this creature is a Dolphin. The creature attacks with its beak and charges into its enemies, sharks charge into their enemies and bite. Dolphins are no longer a living organism but soulless machines. Ecco easily defeats this strange Dolphin and seeks out the globe holder. The globe holder is round and sphere like, inside the globes fight trying to trust their way free. The globe holder is attached to the walls by two gooey arms. Ecco attacks the arms bursting the sphere free. The globes fight inside as Ecco fights the outside, the giant sphere tries to smash Ecco by thrusting itself into the walls. Eventually the sphere breaks and the globes are freed. Ecco swims to the globes as a portal suddenly opens returning the globes and Ecco back to the present.Ecco returns the globes to the Asterite and revitalizes with power and restores Ecco his. The Asterite summons fellow singers to help Ecco defeat the Vortex, and Ecco travels to the Queens new earth hive where the final battle will begin. Ecco travels into the machine and emerges into the Queens chambers. The queen reaches for Ecco with her long tongue but Ecco dodges and rips her tongue off. Ecco attacks the Queen with his newly restored power and after a few hits, the queen starts to dissolve and a small Vortex larvae emerges.Ecco returns home to celebrate then seeks out the Asterite who summons him one last time. The Asterite congratulates Ecco on defeating the Vortex Queen. He tells Ecco how when he sent Ecco into the past originally that caused the stream of time to split into two, that is why he is the stone. To prevent this from happening again Ecco must destroy the Atlantean time machine, peace cannot exist unless Ecco does this last task. Ecco returns to Atlantis, he finds the time machine and strange Vortex larvae swimming amongst it, Ecco decides not to destroy it.When Ecco defeated the vortex queen she made her way to Atlantis as a Vortex larvae. She used the time machine and escaped into the Earth's past. When the Queen arrived into the prehistoric era she encounters creatures she cannot rule, she has no choice but to live within the life cycles of the Earth. Through the eons the Vortex kind integrate with life on Earth.Ecco finds the time machine, instead of destroying it he uses it and disappears into the tides of time.---------------------------------------------------------------

Probably for the same reason....Was too busy watching Mythbusters before that, hehheh. Remote control taxis and blowing stuff up....Also they did something about sinking ships and bubbles, and it seemed to prove the same thing, that too many bubbles=sinking ship.

Heh, yeah....UFOs do seem a popular theary about the Bermuda Triangle....and everything else....everyone wants to blame things on aliens.I saw that was on, but I didn't watch it either. Probably for the same reason....Was too busy watching Mythbusters before that, hehheh. Well because I have a severe abundance of free time, I shall help you out. I RP all the time, my grammer's pretty good....About Ecco the Dolphin Ecco was a young dolphin with five bright silvery marks on his head that looked like stars forming constellation Delphenuis. His family believed the marks on his head were a sign of his destiny. One day a great storm occured, which swallowed his family in a vortex of wind and water; they vanished into the sky. Ecco set off to find his family, meeting an orca who guided him along his journey to find Big Blue, a blue whale who is very old and very wise. Ecco meets Big Blue, who awaits his death in the cold Arctic sea. Ecco has fought off many Arctic spiders and other threats to get to this point. Big Blue reveals that the storm, which has taken Ecco's family, is a rare one which occurs once every 500 years. All life vanishes at the eye of the storm, but it is unknown why this happens He tells Ecco that there is one older and wiser than himself, a being called the Asterite. The Asterite is the oldest creature in the sea, and may have existed since before prehistoric times. Ecco sets off to find the Asterite, who lives within a deep chasm, inside a dark cave. Ecco lays his eyes on a creature of great mystical power and benevolence. It is made up of spheres or globes, each individually colored, moving in rythm with one another. The Asterite recognizes Ecco as if they met before, speaking only through thoughts. Ecco notices the Asterite has an empty spot in its rhythmically moving globes, one missing globe. The Asterite shows Ecco a city called Atlantis, a machine that can go back in time, and a place where the missing globe lies. If Ecco can retrieve this globe the Asterite can grant him incredible power. Ecco finds the gateway to Atlantis where he finds crystals called glyphs. When sung to, glyphs sing a different tune back. He also finds rings, which when swum through, can take you to a place far off. The glyphs tell Ecco of great disaster which caused Atlantis to sink. A beam from space put everything into ruins. Survivors fled into the past using their technology. Ecco finds the time machine, and a message reveals to him only recognized ones are allowed to travel in time. The time machine recognises him, and Ecco opens a doorway into the past.When Ecco travels back 65 million years, he finds creatures different from his own era. As he jumps into the sky for a breath of air, a Pteranadon grabs him. The Pteranadon drops him in a place where creatures communicate much like dolphins. Ecco sings to them, discovering the songs come from creatures on land. The land creatures must be ancestors to Ecco, to dolphin kind. They hear Ecco's song and plunge into the sea to investigate. Ecco dives, noticing he is near his objective. Deep in a dark cave Ecco finds a completely whole Asterite. Ecco attacks it and it attacks back with bolts of energy, butEcco manages to free a globe which triggers his return home to the future, to the present. Ecco returns the globe to the Asterite who then empowers Ecco. Ecco can heal himself, doesn't need to go to the surface for breaths, and is stronger. He can create a pulse of sound that becomes an energy wave, and he is faster. Ecco is now ready to travel back to the moment of the storm and save his family. Upon returning to Atlantis Ecco finds a library of glyphs he did not notice before. The glyphs tell of a planet called Vortex in the star system Cassandra, located in the head of constellation Pegasus. Vortex is dying and can no longer produce food. Every 500 years when Earth and Vortex have a clear path, the Vortex feed upon the Earth. The Atlanteans inscribed messages into glyphs and created teleport rings to help a Dolphin of the future travel to Vortex. Ecco's destiny has just been revealed to him. Ecco finds the Atlantean time machine and he travels back to the moment of the storm. The storm begins and Ecco is pulled up with his family, into a tube, into a machine. Ecco fights his way through strange Vortex creatures, all the way up to their Queen. Ecco destroys the Queen, saves his family, and returns to Earth. As Ecco and his family celebrate, one of his family member asks him "Do you think the Vortex are destroyed?". --------------------------------------------------------------- About the Tides of Time When Ecco traveled to the Vortex world, the Queen realized the Asterite empowered him. As Ecco escaped with his family, the Queen followed him back to Earth. She quickly finds the Asterite and destroys it. Ecco loses his power in response, and he is no longer safe as Vortex close in on him. Suddenly a doorway much like the one that allows Ecco to travel in time appears. A very unusual Dolphin appears with very long fins and dorsal. She calls herself Trellia, from a possible future opposite to a dark future created by Vortex. She wants Ecco to travel forward with her, an old friend wishes to speak to him. Ecco touches her, allowing him to follow her. Trellia shows Ecco her world, water tubes which can be swum through, islands which float on air. Ecco finds pockets of air which when exposed to sound can launch him high into the sky. After millions of years great eruptions occurred and the ocean became conscious. It created water tubes connecting all the seas of Earth. Dolphins realized the eruptions created a lot of helium and much of the rocks of the floating islands can hold helium. The Dolphins learned to carry helium, allowing them to float. After ten thousand years they learned to fly. Trellia takes Ecco to the water tubes where he can find his friend. She tells him how a giant Medusa which resembles a jellyfish lurks the tubes. The tubes have currents, holes, and whirlpools; many traits that can be found in the sea. Ecco keeps his focus, knowing one wrong move will cause him to fall thousands of feet to his death. As Ecco became more comfortable with his new environment the Medusa lurked towards him, reaching out with her tentacles to grab whatever she reaches and throw it out of her aqua nest. Ecco knew the only way to get passed her was to be quick, because fighting her poses an extreme risk--she can float, Ecco cannot. Ecco discovers metaspheres left by the Asterite allow Ecco to morph into different life forms. Ecco uses the metaspheres to transform into a bird, then a shark, and a jellyfish, until he reaches his destination. Trellia brought Ecco into the future so the Asterite could speak to him. The Asterite is much more evolved now, with silvery globes. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex queen tried to destroy it. Ecco must return to his own time to collect the globes to restore it back to life. The Asterite says Ecco is the stone which split the stream into two; there are two possible futures for Earth and only he can prevent the dark vortex future. The asterite gives Ecco a metasphere which sends him back to his own time. Ecco returns to the present where he eventually meets Blackfin of the four islands. Blackfin takes Ecco to Tara who knows the way to the sea of darkness where he can find the first pair of the many Asterite globes. It's in the sea of darkness Ecco learns Vortex from the dark future have come and stolen the Asterite's final pair of globes. The first pair is under the possession of the Moray. Deep in the abyss the shelled Moray becomes a keeper. Ecco defeats the Moray gaining the first two of many globes. The first pair tells him to go out and seek more of them. Ecco travels back and forth with the aid of teleport rings collecting the missing globes. As Ecco collects them all he realizes theres a final pair that cannot be retrieved. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex Queen has gained knowledge of the time machine. Vortex from the dark future used this knowledge to steal the final pair of globes, but the time machine cannot travel into the future, it can only go up the stream of time into the past. As Ecco searches for another way to retrieve the final pair, he discovers the Queen has spawned a new race of Vortex that dies when exposed to light. He also notices how the regular Vortexes have changed blue from being on Earth. Then out of the darkness Ecco is grabbed by two strange creatures. They open a doorway in time and take Ecco into the future, the dark future. When Ecco arrives into the dark future his two captors burst into pieces. The sky is a red and orange color, and Ecco appears to be in some sort of machine. Strange round squishy creatures called Amoebas start noticing there new visitor. Ecco also realizes this machine he's in can defy gravity. There is not many of creatures guarding this machine, but the machine has lots of traps. Ecco searches for the final two globes. As he searches, he wonders--where are all the Dolphins? Then the answer comes to him when a metal creature awakens. It looks like a metal shark and a sharp spike emerges from its face.Something begins to emerge from this creature's backside--a rocket ready to propel this creature full speed into Ecco. Ecco realizes this creature is a Dolphin. The creature attacks with its beak and charges into its enemies, sharks charge into their enemies and bite. Dolphins are no longer living organisms but soulless machines. Ecco easily defeats this strange Dolphin and seeks out the globe holder. The globe holder is round and sphere like; inside the globes fight trying to trust their way free. The globe holder is attached to the walls by two gooey arms. Ecco attacks the arms bursting the sphere free. The globes fight inside as Ecco fights the outside, and the giant sphere tries to smash Ecco by thrusting itself into the walls. Eventually the sphere breaks and the globes are freed. Ecco swims to the globes and a portal suddenly opens returning the globes and Ecco back to the present. Ecco restores the globes to the Asterite, which revitalizes with power and restores Ecco his. The Asterite summons fellow singers to help Ecco defeat the Vortex, and Ecco travels to the Queen's new earth hive where the final battle will begin. Ecco travels into the machine and emerges into the Queens chambers. The queen reaches for Ecco with her long tongue but Ecco dodges and rips her tongue off. Ecco attacks the Queen with his newly restored power and after a few hits, the queen starts to dissolve and a small Vortex larvae emerges. Ecco returns home to celebrate, then seeks out the Asterite who summons him one last time. The Asterite congratulates Ecco on defeating the Vortex Queen. He tells Ecco how, when he sent Ecco into the past originally, that caused the stream of time to split into two, that is why he is the stone. To prevent this from happening again Ecco must destroy the Atlantean time machine; peace cannot exist unless Ecco does this last task. Ecco returns to Atlantis. He finds the time machine and strange Vortex larvae swimming amongst it, but Ecco decides not to destroy it. When Ecco defeated the vortex queen she made her way to Atlantis as a Vortex larvae. She used the time machine and escaped into the Earth's past. When the Queen arrived into the prehistoric era she encounters creatures she cannot rule, and she has no choice but to live within the life cycles of the Earth. Through the eons the Vortex kind integrate with life on Earth. Ecco finds the time machine, and instead of destroying it he uses it and disappears into the tides of time. Well there ya go, I fixed what seemed to need fixed, changed a few words here and there...hopefully that'll do.

I think that how the sky merges is done quite well. Mouse art is a pain to do and a much need of patience.Anything that bothers me would be the thickness of the tail in certain areas and the wings dont exactly connected to the body, despite two colors being used.But other than that it is a nice job. ^^

I know I posted this way back when, but I though of reviving it.I need some help making 4 desktop theams for Windows, and possibly somone who can alter the windows XP graphics as to fit the chosen color scheme (i found it won't allow you)i need possibly some .wav pruning, i downloaded the DOtF soundpack from COH, but some need pruning.I need windows exit and windows open "song snippts" this would be the hardest unless I give acctual numbers (like it places from 2.34.00 to 2.34.15 from song "a")I need, cusome screen savers.i need guidence on saving pictures as .ico and.cur on windows xp....I can work on the Mornica Chrunky computer, it has curcer dance on it.also all of them will need "test runs" and CC.I have,island of tranqulity-87% donehas an almost complete sound scheme, needs windows op and close.has bkg/wallpaperhas color schemehas no icons, curcers or screen saver.Man's nighmare-i'm going to say 65% donehas bkghas color schemehas half finished sound schemeneeds icon, curcer and screen saverneeds windos close and open sounds.Dolphin's nighmare-23% donehas color schemehas bkg/wallpaperhas some sound.needs, windos op and close musics, sounds (my fault) icon, curcer and screen saver.Domane of the foe-2%it has a folder and maybe a color scheme.I'm trying to make the wallpaper look alieny.----------------if you want to see my wallpapers ask and i'll e-mail them.you must set the wallpaper useage to 'can inable jpg and .gif.also the screen resolution may be dependant on the picture.warning! Dolphin's Nighmare is very purply, I tryed to make it look like the somthing the clan would make.

Right then. Here are some of the avatars I've made.

You can just smell the Anime-ish influence in makingthe movie Well, obviously. Quentin Tarintino made this film as a sort of collabaration of all the cool japanese things he loves. All the characters from the film are from somewhere, for example O-Ren iishi is lady snowblood, etc.

Heh, I used to watch DragonBall Z all the time.They've only recently started showing the original Dragonball over here, I occasionally watch it when it's on because I was interested to learn about the history behind the characters, etc.

http mainly europe is the only place that has been through as a country what we have. the middle east, well where over there fucknig with them, so they have every reason to hate the US. but brazil who we probably help out alot, and we do, i say the united states needs to pull the plug on countries like these and let them fend for themselves.i dont hate brazil but i mean after reading this article you cant help but think. they talk so much shit in there papers of how the US is an imperialistic threat to the world, they talk the most shit about the united states president, and whenever we put them in the spotlight and say one small thing about there president they get all pissed off and go as far as banning the newes paper the article is in. when im sure we allow all there shit about how the united states is satan go into our country.you'll be surprised how much ive learned about this country, its not a bad place, but there politics seem to just bite there own asses. Back in 1985 they used to be under a military dictatorship. The united states isnt so special i know that, as a country its degrading because of failed leadership, our new elections isnt even bringing anyone good to the office: john kerry. puh john kerry is a pussy, and bush, well i hate him alot and think he's a dumb ass but you cant help but say he has got alot accomplished while in office, i just think its sad we had to loose all our allies with his idiocy of running things. About Ecco the DolphinEcco was a young dolphin with five bright silvery marks on his head that looked like stars forming constellation Delphenuis. His family believed the marks on his head were a sign of his destiny. One day a great storm occured, which swallowed his family in a vortex of wind and water; they vanished into the sky. Ecco set off to find his family, meeting an orca who guided him along his journey to find Big Blue, a blue whale who is very old and very wise.Ecco meets Big Blue, who awaits his death in the cold Arctic sea. Ecco has fought off many Arctic spiders and other threats to get to this point. Big Blue reveals that the storm, which has taken Ecco's family, is a rare one which occurs once every 500 years. All life vanishes at the eye of the storm, but it is unknown why this happens He tells Ecco that there is one older and wiser than himself, a being called the Asterite. The Asterite is the oldest creature in the sea, and may have existed since before prehistoric times.Ecco sets off to find the Asterite, who lives within a deep chasm, inside a dark cave. Ecco lays his eyes on a creature of great mystical power and benevolence. It is made up of spheres or globes, each individually colored, moving in rythm with one another. The Asterite recognizes Ecco as if they met before, speaking only through thoughts. Ecco notices the Asterite has an empty spot in its rhythmically moving globes, one missing globe. The Asterite shows Ecco a city called Atlantis, a machine that can go back in time, and a place where the missing globe lies. If Ecco can retrieve this globe the Asterite can grant him incredible power.Ecco finds the gateway to Atlantis where he finds crystals called glyphs. When sung to, glyphs sing a different tune back. He also finds rings, which when swum through, can take you to a place far off. The glyphs tell Ecco of great disaster which caused Atlantis to sink. A beam from space put everything into ruins. Survivors fled into the past using their technology. Ecco finds the time machine, and a message reveals to him only recognized ones are allowed to travel in time. The time machine recognises him, and Ecco opens a doorway into the past.When Ecco travels back 65 million years, he finds creatures different from his own era. As he jumps into the sky for a breath of air, a Pteranadon grabs him. The Pteranadon drops him in a place where creatures communicate much like dolphins. Ecco sings to them, discovering the songs come from creatures on land. The land creatures must be ancestors to Ecco, to dolphin kind. They hear Ecco's song and plunge into the sea to investigate. Ecco dives, noticing he is near his objective. Deep in a dark cave Ecco finds a completely whole Asterite. Ecco attacks it and it attacks back with bolts of energy, but Ecco manages to free a globe which triggers his return home to the future, to the present.Ecco returns the globe to the Asterite who in responce empowers Ecco. Ecco can heal himself, doesn't need to go to the surface for breaths, and is stronger. He can create a pulse of sound that becomes an energy wave, he is also faster. Ecco is now ready to travel back to the moment of the storm and save his family.Upon returning to Atlantis Ecco finds a library of glyphs he did not notice before. The glyphs tell of a planet called Vortex in the star system Cassandra, located in the head of constellation Pegasus. Vortex is dying and can no longer produce food. Every 500 years when Earth and Vortex have a clear path, the Vortex feed upon the Earth. The Atlanteans inscribed messages into glyphs and created teleport rings to help a Dolphin of the future travel to Vortex. Ecco's destiny has just been revealed to him.Ecco finds the Atlantean time machine and travels back to the moment of the storm. The storm begins and Ecco is pulled up with his family, into a tube, into a machine. Ecco fights his way through strange Vortex creatures, all the way up to their Queen. Ecco destroys the Queen, saves his family, and returns to Earth. As Ecco and his family celebrate, one of his family member asks him "Do you think the Vortex are destroyed?".---------------------------------------------------------------About the Tides of TimeWhen Ecco traveled to the Vortex world, the Queen realized the Asterite empowered him. As Ecco escaped with his family, the Queen followed him back to Earth. She quickly finds the Asterite and destroys it. Ecco loses his power in response, he is no longer safe as Vortex close in on him.Suddenly a doorway much like the one that allows Ecco to travel in time appears. A very unusual Dolphin appears with very long fins and dorsal. She calls herself Trellia, from a possible future opposite to a dark future created by Vortex. She wants Ecco to travel forward with her, an old friend wishes to speak to him. Ecco touches her, allowing him to follow her.Trellia shows Ecco her world, water tubes which can be swum through, islands which float on air. Ecco finds pockets of air which when exposed to sound can launch him high into the sky. After millions of years great eruptions occurred and the ocean became conscious. It created water tubes connecting all the seas of Earth. Dolphins realized the eruptions created a lot of helium and much of the rocks of the floating islands can hold helium. The Dolphins learned to carry helium, allowing them to float. After ten thousand years they learned to fly.Trellia takes Ecco to the water tubes where he can find his friend. She tells him how a giant Medusa which resembles a jellyfish guards the tubes. The tubes have currents, holes, and whirlpools; many traits that can be found in the sea. Ecco keeps his focus, knowing one wrong move will cause him to fall thousands of feet to his death. As Ecco became more comfortable with his new environment the Medusa lurked towards him, reaching out with her tentacles to grab whatever she reaches and throw it out of her aqua nest. Ecco knew the only way to get passed her was to be quick, because fighting her poses an extreme risk--she can float, Ecco cannot.Ecco discovers metaspheres, left by the Asterite, which allow Ecco to morph into different life forms. Ecco uses the metaspheres to transform into a bird, then a shark, and a jellyfish, until he reaches his destination. Trellia brought Ecco into the future so the Asterite could speak to him. The Asterite is much more evolved now, with silvery globes. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex queen tried to destroy it. Ecco must return to his own time to collect the globes to restore it back to life. The Asterite says Ecco is the stone which splits the stream into two; there are two possible futures for Earth and only he can prevent the dark vortex future. The Asterite gives Ecco a metasphere which sends him back to his own time.Ecco returns to the present where he eventually meets Blackfin of the four islands. Blackfin takes Ecco to Tara who knows the way to the sea of darkness, where he can find the first pair of the many Asterite globes. It's in the sea of darkness Ecco learns Vortex from the dark future have stolen the Asterite's final pair of globes.The first pair is under the possession of the Moray. Deep in the abyss, the shelled Moray becomes a keeper. Ecco defeats the Moray gaining the first two of many globes. The first pair tells him to go seek more of them.Ecco travels back and forth with the aid of teleport rings collecting the missing globes. As Ecco collects them, he realizes the final pair cannot be retrieved. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex Queen gained knowledge of the time machine. Vortex from the dark future used this knowledge to steal the final pair of globes, but the time machine cannot travel into the future, it can only go up the stream of time into the past. As Ecco searches for another way to retrieve the final pair, he discovers the Queen has spawned a new race of Vortex that dies when exposed to light. He also notices how the regular Vortexes have changed blue from being on Earth. Then out of the darkness Ecco is grabbed by two strange creatures. They open a doorway in time and take Ecco into the future, the dark future.When Ecco arrives into the dark future his two captors burst into pieces. The sky is a red and orange color, Ecco appears to be in some sort of machine. Strange round squishy creatures called Amoebas start noticing there new visitor. Ecco realizes this machine he's in can defy gravity. There is not many creatures guarding this machine, but the machine has lots of traps. Ecco searches for the final two globes. As he searches, he wonders--where are all the Dolphins? Then the answer comes to him when a metal creature awakens. It looks like a metal shark, but then a sharp spike emerges from its face .Something begins to emerge from this creature's backside--a rocket ready to propel this creature full speed into Ecco. Ecco realizes this creature is a Dolphin. The creature attacks with its beak and charges into its enemies, sharks charge into their enemies and bite. Dolphins are no longer living organisms but soulless machines. Ecco easily defeats this strange Dolphin and seeks out the globe holder.The globe holder is round and sphere like; inside the globes fight trying to trust their way free. The globe holder is attached to the walls by two gooey arms. Ecco attacks the arms bursting the sphere free. The globes fight inside as Ecco fights the outside, and the giant sphere tries to smash Ecco by thrusting itself into the walls. Eventually the sphere breaks and the globes are freed. Ecco swims to the globes and a portal suddenly opens returning the globes and Ecco back to the present.Ecco returns the globes to the Asterite, which revitalizes with power and restores Ecco his. The Asterite summons fellow singers to help Ecco defeat the Vortex, and Ecco travels to the Queen's new earth hive where the final battle will begin. Ecco travels into the machine and emerges into the Queens chambers. The Queen reaches for Ecco with her long tongue but Ecco dodges and rips her tongue off. Ecco attacks the Queen with his newly restored power and after a few hits, the Queen starts to dissolve and a small Vortex larvae emerges.Ecco returns home to celebrate, then seeks out the Asterite who summons him one last time. The Asterite congratulates Ecco on defeating the Vortex Queen. He tells Ecco how, when he sent Ecco into the past originally, that caused the stream of time to split into two, that is why he is the stone. To prevent this from happening again Ecco must destroy the Atlantean time machine; peace cannot exist unless Ecco does this last task.Ecco returns to Atlantis. He finds the time machine and strange Vortex larvae swimming amongst it, but Ecco decides not to destroy it.When Ecco defeated the vortex queen she made her way to Atlantis as a Vortex larvae. She used the time machine and escaped into the Earth's past. When the Queen arrived into the prehistoric era she encounters creatures she cannot rule, and she has no choice but to live within the life cycles of the Earth. Through the eons the Vortex kind integrate with life on Earth.Ecco finds the time machine, and instead of destroying it he uses it and disappears into the tides of time.

http NautikaNautika is the Arkon of water, when the 7 incarnations were born she was captured and sent into the far future so her power could never reuinite with the other Arkons. In the future she was injured, injured to a point where her immortality couldnt recover her. It is said she died, until the Lemurians (an advanced culture of the future) descovered her and upgraded her Wings of burden making her the strongest of all the Arkons. Her only weakness is the one thing a creature of water cannot defeat: lightening. Nautika is sent into the past to aid Ecco in preventing the dark future. When Nautika arrives she descovers a traitorous Arkonviox has also joined Ecco. Nautika knows of Arkonviox's dark plans but relizes she must not intervene with the past too much. During her whole quest she tries to put up with Arkonviox's childish behavior, Arkonviox is able to read her thoughts and tries to provoke her into battling with him. She is able to endure Arkonviox long enough and even manages to sacrfice herself to save Ecco and Crestoe from a swarm of Vortex. After her death Arkonviox goes off and kills 5 Arkons on a quest for power. Arkonviox returns to the very place where Nautika sacrificed herself, finding shes still there and has been waiting for him all this time. She tells Arkonviox, just finish me and shut up. They have a final battle and Arkonviox kills her.

Though I can't say it doesn't sound somewhat familiar.I think I was gonna say something else, but I forgot. o_o;Her name doesn't have "arkon" in it?

Tethys was originally a completely different character altogther. Many years ago, I made up this species called Sanayas, which look like dolphins but they come in all colors of the rainbow and shine like polished gems. They lived in like some kind of alternate universe or something. So when I came to this site and saw everyone had they're own characters, I figured I should make one too. I remembered the Sanayas, so I made that into my character, except I tweaked the design to make the species a bit more unique. My character was originally purple and white (more white than she has now and no funky designs or anything), with blue eyes, and looked like a dolphin but with a shorter beak, long fins that had little round thingies at the ends, and the same funky tail that she retains now. Then I named my character Tethys, which I got from Greek mythology. I kept trying to come up with different names, but Tethys kept popping into my mind, so I decided that was destined to be her name.Oh, I should make it clear, that the picture I have right now for my avatar is not Tethys, but one of my other characaters.Anyway, later on I decided I wanted something a little different. So I changed Tethys's design almost completely. I based her new look off a plesiosaur. But I made her face more dolphin-like. And I kept the tail because I really liked it. Now she has several shades of purple instead of just one, and less white. Plus the markings. When I changed Tethys's design, I also changed what she was and her entire story. She became an Ocean Gaurdian. And then I created three more, her sister and brothers, one gaurdian for each ocean. And I never really did develop Tethys or the others very much after that.

A tree IS a plant ya know.Duh. e.eI mean a TALKING plant is different, cuz then it can have a personality and such. It can be developed as a character, if it has the ability to talk. But obviously a talking plant is no ordinary plant. It has some sort of magical property, or else it is some kind of spirit, or an ent (like in LOTR). Or something along those lines. So that's different. The way I see it, in order for something to qualify as a character, it has to be able to interact with other characters, and have the ability to show some growth and development (whether it actually does is another thing, but what counts is it -could- be developed if so chosen).Basically, a character's gotta have some sort of personality. Otherwise, well there's gotta be some sort of word for it, but I can't think what it is.

Neither have I, actually, but I figured it out just by looking at it backwards.You see, back in the day, some people actually used to make smileys like this (-:

Arkon, you have more problems besides grammar.Good thing I decided against being an English teacher. I think I'd go insane.I was gonna say some things, but I forgot what, and I'm too tired now.Well one thing was the run-on sentances. There's a ton of them.And I just have to say this: Don't you read much?About Ecco the Dolphin Ecco was a young dolphin with five bright silvery marks on his head. These marks looked like stars forming constellation Delphinus. His family believed the marks on his head were a sign of his destiny. One day, a great storm swallowed his family in a vortex of wind and water, and they vanished into the sky. Ecco set off to find his family. On the way, he met an orca who guided him along his journey to find the Big Blue, (I'm pretty sure it was "the" in the game) a blue whale who is very old and very wise. Ecco meets the Big Blue, who awaits his death in the cold arctic sea. Ecco has fought off arctic spiders to get to this point. Big Blue reveals that the storm, which took Ecco's family, is a rare one which occurs once every 500 years. All life vanishes at the eye of the storm, but it is unknown why this happens. , there is one older and wiser then the Big Blue, called the Asterite. The Asterite is the oldest creature in the sea, and may have existed since before prehistoric times. Ecco sets off to find the Asterite, who lives within a deep chasm. Ecco lays his eyes on a creature of great mystical power and benevolence. It is made up of spheres or globes, each individually colored, moving in rythm with one another. The Asterite recognizes Ecco as if they met before, speaking only through thoughts. Ecco notices the Asterite has an empty spot in its rhythmically moving globes , one missing globe. The Asterite shows Ecco a city called Atlantis, a machine that can go back in time, and a place where the missing globe lies.. If Ecco can retrieve this globe, the Asterite will grant him incredible power. Ecco finds the gateway to Atlantis where he finds crystals called glyphs. When sung to, the glyphs sing a different tune back. He also finds rings, which when swam through, can take you to a place far off. The glyphs tell Ecco of great disaster which caused Atlantis to sink. A beam from space put everything into ruins. Survivors fled into the past using their technology. Ecco finds the time machine, and a message reveals to him only recognized ones are allowed to travel in time. Ecco, recognized byt the time machine, precedes to use it, opening a doorway into the past. Ecco travels back 65 million years. He finds creatures different from his own era. When he jumps into the sky for a breath of air, a Pteranadon grabs him. The Pteranadon drops him in a place where creatures communicate much like dolphins. Ecco sings to them, discovering the songs come from creatures on land. The land creatures must be ancestors to Ecco, to dolphin kind. They hear Ecco's song and plunge into the sea to investigate. Ecco dives, noticing he is near his objective. Deep in a dark cave Ecco finds a completely whole Asterite. Ecco attacks it as it attacks back with bolts of energy. He finally manages to free a globe which triggers his return home--to the future, to the present. Ecco returns the globe to the Asterite who empowers Ecco. Now Ecco can heal himself, doesn't need to go to the surface for breaths, and is stronger. He can create a pulse of sound that becomes an energy wave, and is faster. Ecco is now ready to travel back to the moment of the storm and save his family. Upon returning to Atlantis Ecco finds a library of glyphs he did not notice before. The glyphs tell of a planet called Vortex in the star system Cassandra, located in the head of the constellation Pegasus. Vortex is dying and can no longer produce food. Every 500 years when Earth and Vortex have a clear path, the Vortex feed upon the Earth. The Atlanteans inscribed messages into glyphs, created teleport rings to help a Dolphin of the future travel to Vortex. Ecco's destiny has just been revealed to him. Ecco finds the Atlantean time machine again and travels back to the moment of the storm. The storm begins and Ecco is pulled up with his family, into a tube leading to a giant machine. Ecco fights his way through strange Vortex creatures, all the way up to their Queen. Ecco destroys the Queen and saves his family and returns to Earth. As Ecco and his family celebrate, one of his family members asks him "Do you think the Vortex are destroyed?". --------------------------------------------------------------- About the Tides of Time When Ecco traveled to the Vortex world, the Queen realized that the Asterite had empowered him. As Ecco escaped with his family, the Queen followed him back to Earth. She quickly finds the Asterite and destroys it. Ecco loses his power in response. He is no longer safe as Vortex close in on him. Suddenly a doorway much like the one that allows Ecco to travel in time appears. A very unusual dolphin with very long fins and dorsal appears. She calls herself Trellia, from a possible future opposite of a dark future created by the Vortex. She wants Ecco to travel forward with her--an old friend wishes to speak to him. Ecco touches her, allowing him to follow her. Trellia shows Ecco her world. Water tubes which can be swam through. Islands float in the air. Ecco finds pockets of air which when exposed to sound can launch him high into the sky.<<(There has GOT to be a better way to write that, if only I could think of one) After millions of years great eruptions occurred and the ocean became conscious. It created water tubes connecting all the seas of Earth. Dolphins realized the eruptions created a lot of helium. Much of the rocks of the floating islands can hold helium. The Dolphins learned to carry helium allowing them to float. After ten thousand years they learned to fly. Trellia takes Ecco to the water tubes where he can find his friend. She tells him how a giant Medusa which resembles a jellyfish lurks in the tubes.(a medusa is a KIND of jellyfish) The tubes have currents, holes, whirlpools, and many other traits that can be found in the sea. Ecco keeps his focus, knowing one wrong move will cause him to fall thousands of feet to his death. As Ecco became more comfortable with his new environment, the Medusa lurked towards him, reaching out with her tentacles to grab whatever she reaches to throw out of her aqua nest. Ecco knew the only way to get passed her was to be quick, because fighting her poses an extreme risk. She can float, Ecco cannot. Ecco discovers metaspheres left by the Asterite to allow Ecco to morph into different life forms.(I thought the Atlanteans created them...But I could be wrong) Ecco uses the metaspheres to transform into a bird, then a shark, and a jellyfish, until he reaches his destination. Trellia brought Ecco into the future so the Asterite could speak to him. The Asterite is much evolved now, with silvery globes.(they looked gold to me) The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex queen tried to destroy it. Ecco must return to his own time to collect the globes to restore it back to life. The Asterite tells Ecco he is the stone which splits the stream (of time) in two, that there are two possible futures for Earth, and only he can prevent the dark Vortex future. The Asterite gives Ecco a metasphere which sends Ecco back to his own time. Ecco returns to the present where he eventually meets Blackfin of the four islands. Blackfin takes Ecco to Tara who knows the way to the sea of darkness where he can find the first pair of the many Asterite globes. It's in the sea of darkness Ecco learns Vortex from the dark future have come and stolen the final pair, but the first pair is under the possession of the Moray deep in the abyss. Deep in the abyss the shelled Moray becomes a keeper. Ecco defeats the Moray, gaining the first two of many globes. The first pair tells him to go out and seek more of them. Ecco travels back and forth with the aid of teleport rings, collecting the missing globes. He collects them all, realizing there is a final pair that cannot be retrieved. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex Queen has gained knowledge of the time machine. Vortex from the dark future used this knowledge to steal the final pair of globes. But the time machine cannot travel into the future, it can only go up the stream of time into the past. Ecco searches for another way to retrieve the final pair. He discovers the Queen has spawned a new race of Vortex that dies when exposed to light. He also notices how the regular Vortexes have changed to blue from being on Earth. Then out of the darkness, Ecco is grabbed by two strange creatures. They open a doorway in time and take Ecco into the future--the dark future. When Ecco arrives into the dark future, his two captors burst into pieces. The sky is a red and orange color. Ecco appears to be in some sort of machine. Strange round squishy creatures called Amoebas start noticing there new visitor. Ecco also realizes the machine he's in can defy gravity. There are not a lot of creatures guarding this machine, but it has a lot of traps. Ecco searches for the final two globes. As he searches, he wonders, where are all the Dolphins? Then the answer comes to him. A metal creature awakens. It looks like a metal shark. Then a sharp spike emerges from its face.Something begins to emerge from this creature's backside, a rocket ready to propel this creature full speed into Ecco. Ecco realizes this creature is a dolphin. The creature attacks with its beak and charges into its enemies; sharks charge into their enemies and bite. Dolphins are no longer a living organism but soulless machines. Ecco easily defeats this strange dolphin and seeks out the globe holder. The globe holder is round and sphere-like. Inside the globes fight, trying to thrust their way free. The globe holder is attached to the walls by two gooey arms. Ecco attacks the arms, bursting the sphere free. The globes fight inside as Ecco fights the outside. The giant sphere tries to smash Ecco by thrusting itself into the walls. Eventually the sphere breaks and the globes are freed. Ecco swims to the globes as a portal suddenly opens, returning the globes and Ecco back to the present. Ecco returns the globes to the Asterite and revitalizes with power and restores Ecco his.<<(I think you need to rewrite that sentance because I don't quite understand it) The Asterite summons fellow singers to help Ecco defeat the Vortex, and Ecco travels to the Queen's new Earth hive where the final battle will begin. Ecco travels into the machine and emerges into the Queen's chambers. The Queen reaches for Ecco with her long tongue, but Ecco dodges and rips her tongue off. Ecco attacks the Queen with his newly restored power and, after a few hits, the queen starts to dissolve and a small Vortex larva emerges. (larvae is plural) Ecco returns home to celebrate. Then he seeks out the Asterite, who summons him one last time. The Asterite congratulates Ecco on defeating the Vortex Queen. He tells Ecco how when he sent Ecco into the past originally, that caused the stream of time to split into two, and that is why he is the stone. To prevent this from happening again, Ecco must destroy the Atlantean time machine. Peace cannot exist unless Ecco does this last task. Ecco returns to Atlantis, finding the time machine and strange Vortex larvae swimming amongst (around?) it. Ecco decides not to destroy the time machine.When Ecco defeated the vortex queen she made her way to Atlantis as a Vortex larva. She used the time machine and escaped into the Earth's past. When the Queen arrived into the prehistoric era, she encounters creatures she cannot rule. So she has no choice but to live within the life cycles of the Earth. Through the eons the Vortex kind integrate with life on Earth. Ecco finds the time machine, instead of destroying it he uses it and disappears into the tides of time.

Arkonviox.....i'll explain that story in a few days.Mr Prawn *points at discoulored cell avatar* Theres a history behind that. In the blundercaves episode i used to do Mr. Prawn was the arch villian. In the older days the blundercaves was forum based, it was me basicaly picking people form the forum and making fun of them. Mr. Prawn was basicaly my evil hacking alter ego. i used to be apart of an ecco website called the undercaves and we used to joke about what if someone hacked it. So we came up with Mr. PrawnI remember the lines from that blundercaves sketch. "I am Mr. Prawn, I am the perfect hacker, i go from website to website taking them over for spot, but unlike most hackers i dont hack into websites i simply take them over."well, seems i ended up becoming like this alter ego. I took over the undercaves, without hacking, and like mr prawn it was a dark time, and a hostile evil takeover that created other sites like cavernsofhope. i had a war with cavernsofhope where i attacked theremessage board, i got banned 20 times each time id come back withen 3 minutes under someone elses name, most of there members accounts i had access to because in those days i knew everyones passwords from my site, from looking at the member profiles (cant do that now) anyhow from that war silverfin psysonic and i became good friends. then i got access to a message board of someone who was attacking caverns ofhope. I learned there password and gained access to ther epersonal forum, from ther epersonal forum i was able to hack many of there other members personal forums. i destroyed 6 forums and turned the forum i was after into "the mr prawn forum". i also hacked a site that once existed called legend of zelda.com well i didnt hack it, but i flooded there forum through a flaw and caused the whole server to shut down, in responce i made them link to my website. anyways theres more then that, its not something to be proud of but lets just say when you fuck me over i never forget and im very powerful as an ememy but luckly no one here has to worry about that, i do like everyone here, there are some people who occasionaly annoy me but they cant do alot to piss me off. but lets say its because of that temper i dont have a girlfriend (id rather not hurt anyone, i have alot of guil from the past i have to live with.)

Hmm, I remember when you were trying to figure out a name for this character. At least I think it was this one. I see the resemblance now. Despite what they tell you in some English classes, especially earlier ones, there's nothing wrong with starting a sentance with "and" or "but" as long as you don't do it too often. Plenty of professional writers do that, and I've even been told by college professors that it's okay.There are other things like that that teachers tell you not to do, that are actually okay to do so long as you don't do it too much. Basically the "rules" for writing that you're taught in school are more like suggestions or guidelines. Well, not all of them, but there are several.

Hehheh.....I haven't taken any writing classes, mostly because they don't offer them to anyone at my school except seniors.....but I write like I talk, mostly. Beginning a sentance with 'and' and 'but' conveys more feeling than if you try to stick to the 'rules.' I read alot. You should see how much professional writers disregard the 'rules.'
