i did a little bit of work on the story.About Ecco the DolphinEcco was a young dolphin with five bright silvery marks on his head that looked like stars forming constellation Delphenuis. His family believed the marks on his head were a sign of his destiny. One day a great storm occured, which swallowed his family in a vortex of wind and water; they vanished into the sky. Ecco set off to find his family, meeting an orca who guided him along his journey to find the Big Blue, a blue whale who is very old and very wise.Ecco meets the Big Blue, who awaits his death in the cold Arctic sea. Ecco has fought off many Arctic spiders and other threats to get to this point. Big Blue reveals that the storm, which has taken Ecco's family, is a rare one which occurs once every 500 years. All life vanishes at the eye of the storm, but it is unknown why this happens He tells Ecco that there is one older and wiser than himself, called the Asterite. The Asterite is the oldest creature in the sea, and may have existed since before prehistoric times.Ecco sets off to find the Asterite, who lives within a deep chasm, inside a dark cave. He lays his eyes on a creature of great mystical power and benevolence. It is made up of spheres or globes, each individually colored, moving in a harmony with one another. The Asterite recognizes him as if they met before, speaking only through thoughts. Ecco notices the Asterite has a missing globe. The Asterite showed Ecco an ancient city called Atlantis. It tells him of a time machine built by the Atlanteans, and instructs him to use this machine to go back in time and retreive the missing globe. If he can retrieve the globe, the Asterite can grant him incredible power.Ecco finds the gateway to Atlantis where he finds crystals called glyphs. When sung to, glyphs react in many different ways; they could echo messages back, release air for a dolphin to breathe, or open pathways. He also finds rings, which when swum through, can teleport a dolphin great distances. Ecco sings to the glyphs which echo back a message of a great disaster which caused Atlantis to sink. A beam from space put everything into ruins. Survivors fled into the past using their technology. Ecco sings to a glyph near the time machine. It responds: 'only recognized ones are allowed to travel in time'. Ecco reconized by the time machine, precedes to use it, opening a doorway into the past.When Ecco travels back 65 million years, he finds creatures different from his own era. As he jumps into the sky for a breath of air, a Pteranadon grabs him. The Pteranadon drops him in a place where creatures communicate much like dolphins. Ecco sings to them, discovering the songs come from creatures on land. The land creatures must be ancestors to Ecco, to dolphin kind. They hear Ecco's song and plunge into the sea to investigate. Ecco dives, noticing he is near his objective. Deep in a dark cave Ecco finds a completely whole Asterite. Ecco attacks it and it attacks back with bolts of energy, but Ecco manages to free a globe which triggers his return home to the future --to the present.Ecco returns the globe to the Asterite who in responce empowers him with great power. Now Ecco can heal himself, doesn't need to surface for breaths, and is stronger. He can create a pulse of sound that becomes an energy wave, he is faster. Ecco is now ready to travel back to the moment of the storm and save his family.Upon returning to Atlantis Ecco finds a library of glyphs he did not notice before. The glyphs tell of a planet called Vortex in the star system Cassandra, located in the head of constellation Pegasus. Vortex is dying and can no longer produce food. Every 500 years when Earth and Vortex have a clear path, the Vortex feed upon the Earth. The Atlanteans inscribed messages into glyphs and created teleport rings to help a Dolphin of the future travel to Vortex. Ecco's destiny has just been revealed to him.Ecco finds the Atlantean time machine and travels back to the moment of the storm. The storm begins and Ecco is pulled up with his family, into a tube, into a machine. Ecco fights his way through strange Vortex creatures, all the way up to their Queen. Ecco destroys the Queen, saves his family, and returns to Earth. As Ecco and his family celebrate, one of his family member asks him "Do you think the Vortex are destroyed?".---------------------------------------------------------------About the Tides of TimeWhen Ecco traveled to the Vortex world, the Queen realized the Asterite empowered him. As Ecco escaped with his family, the Queen followed him back to Earth. She quickly finds the Asterite and destroys it. Ecco loses his power in response, he is no longer safe as Vortex close in on him.Suddenly a doorway much like the one that allows Ecco to travel in time appears. A very unusual Dolphin appears with very long fins and dorsal. She calls herself Trellia, from a possible future opposite to a dark future created by Vortex. She wants Ecco to travel forward with her --an old friend wishes to speak to him. Ecco touches her, allowing him to follow her.Trellia shows Ecco her world. Water tubes which connect islands that float in the clouds. Ecco descovers air pockets in the sky that are sesitive to sound.When exposed to sound, the pockets can launch him, with bursts of wind, high into the sky. After millions of years great eruptions occurred, the ocean became conscious. It created water tubes connecting all the seas of Earth. Dolphins realized the eruptions created a lot of helium and much of the rocks of the floating islands can hold helium. The Dolphins learned to carry helium, allowing them to float. After ten thousand years they learned to fly.Trellia takes Ecco to the water tubes where he can find his friend. She tells him how a giant Medusa which guards the tubes. The tubes have currents, holes, and whirlpools; many traits that can be found in the sea. Ecco keeps his focus, knowing one wrong move will cause him to fall thousands of feet to his death. As Ecco became more comfortable with his new environment the Medusa lurked towards him, reaching out with her tentacles to grab whatever she reaches and throw it out of her aqua nest. Ecco knew the only way to get passed her was to be quick, because fighting her poses an extreme risk--she can float, Ecco cannot.Ecco discovers metaspheres, left by the Asterite, which allow him to morph into different life forms. He uses the metaspheres to transform into a bird, a shark, a jellyfish, and even a school of fish. He relizes Trellia brought him into the future to speak with the Asterite. The Asterite is much more evolved, with metallic-like globes. It tells Ecco how the Vortex Queen tried to destroy it. How Ecco must return to his own time to collect the globes to restore it back to life. It tells Ecco, he is the stone which splits the stream of time into two; there are two possible futures for Earth and only he can prevent the dark vortex future. The Asterite gives Ecco a metasphere which sends him back to his own time.Ecco returns to the present where he eventually meets Blackfin of the four islands. Blackfin takes Ecco to Tara who knows the way to the sea of darkness, where he can find the first pair of the many Asterite globes. It's in the sea of darkness Ecco learns Vortex from the dark future have stolen the Asterite's final pair of globes.The first pair is deep in the abyss, where the shelled Moray becomes its keeper. Ecco defeats the Moray gaining the first pair of many globes. The first pair tells him to go out and seek more globes.Ecco travels back and forth with the aid of teleport rings collecting the missing globes. As Ecco collects them, he realizes the final pair cannot be retrieved. The Asterite tells Ecco how the Vortex Queen gained knowledge of the time machine. Vortex from the dark future used this knowledge to steal the final pair of globes. But the time machine cannot travel into the future, it can only go up the stream of time into the past. As Ecco searches for another way to retrieve the final pair, he discovers the Queen has spawned a new race of Vortex that dies when exposed to light. He also notices how the regular Vortexes have changed blue from being on Earth. Then out of the darkness Ecco is grabbed by two strange creatures. They open a doorway in time and take Ecco into the future --the dark future.When Ecco arrives into the dark future his two captors burst into pieces. The sky is a red and orange color, Ecco appears to be in some sort of machine. Strange round squishy creatures called Amoebas start noticing their new visitor. Ecco realizes this machine he's in can defy gravity. There is not many creatures guarding this machine, but the machine has lots of traps. Ecco searches for the final two globes. As he searches, he wonders--where are all the Dolphins? Then the answer comes to him. A metal creature awakens resembling a shark. A sharp spike emerges from its face. Something else emerges from it's backside--a rocket ready to propel this creature full speed towards Ecco. This creature must be a dolphin; it charges using it's beak to pierce it's enemy. Sharks charge into their enemies and bite. Dolphins in this world are no longer living organisms but soulless machines. Ecco easily defeats this strange dolphin and seeks out the globe holder.The globe holder is round and sphere-like. Inside the globes fight, trying to trust their way free. The globe holder is attached to the walls by two gooey arms. Ecco attacks the arms bursting the sphere free. The globes fight inside as Ecco fights the outside, and the giant sphere tries to smash Ecco by thrusting itself into the walls. Eventually the sphere breaks and the globes are freed. Ecco swims to the globes and a portal suddenly opens returning the globes and Ecco back to the present.The globes are returned to the Asterite, who in responce grants Ecco the power needed to defeat the Vortex. It summons fellow singers to help Ecco with the many vortex drones. Ecco travels to the Queen's new Earth hive where the final battle will begin. He travels through the machine and arrives in the Queens chambers. The Queen reaches for Ecco with her long tongue but Ecco dodges and rips it off. He attacks the Queen with his newly restored power and after a few hits, the Queen starts to dissolve and a small Vortex larva emerges.Ecco returns home to celebrate. Then he seeks out the Asterite who summons him one last time. The Asterite congratulates him on defeating the Vortex Queen. He tells him how, when he sent Ecco into the past originally, that caused the stream of time to split into two, that is why he is the stone. To prevent this from happening again Ecco must destroy the Atlantean time machine; peace cannot exist unless Ecco does this last task.Ecco returns to Atlantis, finding the time machine and strange Vortex larvae swimming around it, but Ecco decides not to the time machine.When Ecco defeated the vortex queen she made her way to Atlantis as a Vortex larvae. She used the time machine and escaped into the Earth's past. When the Queen arrived into the prehistoric era she encounters creatures she cannot rule, and she has no choice but to live within the life cycles of the Earth. Through the eons the Vortex kind integrate with life on Earth.Ecco finds the time machine, and instead of destroying it he uses it and disappears into the tides of time.

I'm writing this in my story about my game, since my game isnt relly linear i have it split up into different parts explaining different characters and the events they bring forth.About the Stone in Time The Tides of Time, The VoidThe Tides of Time is basicaly a purgatory, where alternate realities continue to exist even if they are no longer apart of the main time line. The dark vortex future was sent here since it is no longer apart of the main timeline. In Ecco the Dolphin time exists in two manners, you cant change your past but you can change your future. Even though Ecco can travel into the past whatever he does to alter it has already happened in his present, anything he does to destroy it is impossible since existing in the past, his fate has been determined. The future on the otherhand cannot be controled by fate, it has not been written. Ecco causes time to split into two streams because of his journeys into the past. Now that the dark future has been prevented, it continues to exist but outside the main timeline. It has to exist cause Ecco traveled there, which means somehow it exists parrallel, but even as it exists in parrallel it remains to be a dead future. The reason why it was sent is the same reason a body might reject a virus. In Ecco's case he had to go on his own free will otherwise time would continue to suffer.this is my explaination of why Ecco vanishes into the tides of time. I can't think of a better way so i thuoght id share it and see if anyone thinks they can break my point with a better point.anyways have fun n.n

Wow, I was expecting a different reaction from Arkonviox. c.cWelcome back Eccofreak.

I don't want any correction done on this since its not finished yet, i just thought id show people my near complete story line to my game. So without further adu here it is with almost everything i could think of explained.-------------------------------------------------About the Stone in Time500 years after the disapperence of Ecco the Dolphin, a forgotten threat reveals itself again, it's the Vortex. Ecco defeated their Queen, destroyed an intire hive of on Earth, but failed to defeat the hive on there home planet. It is belvied without a Queen the hive dies, although most of the Vortex have died others have keapt alive searching for a new hive. The mindless drones fall in disarray, but a very old, powerful, bull drone brought order to chaos, which has come by the name, The Vortex King. It is unknown the full intention of the Vortex King, where it came from, how it assumed control. What is known is they want to keep the pathway between Earth and Vortex open, with a new machine that connects Earth and Vortex called Why Ecco vanishes into the Tide of TimeEcco is able to stop the Vortex future from existing by defeating the Vortex Queen, her hive and restoring the Asterite. These are all key elements that lead up to the reason why the Vortex Future came into being in the first place. But Ecco relizes it's not over yet, that his existence is the reason time split to begin with, that without him, the Vortex Queen would of never came to Earth in the first place. He relizes if he destroys the time machine it would cause more damage to time then fix. If the time machine's destroyed the Vortex from the dark future would never be able to steal the final globes, and Ecco's journey into the future to retreive them would never have happened, it was too much of a risk to take. It also seemed time itself was calling for Ecco, like the future he removed from the time axis, for time to continue Ecco also had to vanish at his own free will. He uses the time machine, completing the final task, and time is allowed to flow smoothly once again.About the Stone in Time The Seven Dark WhalesThe Seven Dark Whales are a clan of Orcas who came into existence when the stream of time split into two. Their purpose is to prevent the natural future from happening. In the far end of the Dark Future a revolution will occur, an Orca will stand up to the Vortex threat using a special Atlantean armor that has been keapt away by an extinct Dolphin race called the Thirians. In the Dark Future, Dolphins decide not to revolt, hoping to find a better way to stop the Vortex without sacrificing more lives. Orcas on the other hand want no part of the Dolphin's weakness and steal the holy Atlantean Dolphin armor causing a revolution. The one to wear this Armor is an Orca named Clondike, who will rise up and become known as Apacalypes. When the revolution ends the world will be ruled by Orca kind and Apacalypes reign will last for an eternity. The Armor which Apacalype wears is called the Wings of Burden, which once belonged to a Dolphin Atlantean named Arkonviox. About the Stone in Time MonArkWhen the 7 incarnations of Gabriel awoken they were sent into different parts of time by the Atlanteans so there power could never reunite. MonArk the Arkon of fire, was taken into the far past by Apollo. MonArk is belived by Dolphin legend to be the Dolphin God of war. About the Stone in Time NautikaNautika is the Arkon of water, when the 7 incarnations were born she was captured and sent into the far future so her power could never reuinite with the other Arkons. In the future she was injured, injured to a point where her immortality couldnt recover her. It is said she died, until the Lemurians (an advanced culture of the future) descovered her and upgraded her Wings of burden making her the strongest of all the Arkons. Using her water elemental ability she can morph into anything she so desires. Her only weakness is the one thing a creature of water cannot defeat The ThiriansThe Thirians are actualy decendants of old world atlantean dolphins. They are also known by the name new world atlantean dolphins. They live in the city of Thira, a city that once was apart of Poseid, home of Atlantis. Thira now lies in ruins deep under the ocean. Thirians are different from normal dolphins, they resemble eels, have gills but can also breathe air. The city of Thira is ruled by Trident, they also have an army of warriors lead by Crestoe. The Thirians have been at war with the 7 Dark Whale Clan ever since Ecco brought the Vortex Queen to Earth. The 7 Dark whales want to kill off the Thirians and recover an ancient dolphin armor of immense power. The Thirians have tales about an ancient armor that was created in Atlantis and worn by Arkonviox. They worship Arkonviox like a god and belive in the far future Arkonviox will rise up and become the savior of Dolphin kind. The Thirians know Arkonviox lives in the city of Tantalus, a holy city that no being has ever returned back from.About the Stone in Time VernineusVernineus manefested itself from Ecco's worse fears and is in a way his opposite. Vernineus is a creature of pure energy, probably another creature who was trapped in time for the same reasons Ecco was. When the time portal opened allowing Ecco to return Vernineus followed him out. It sought great power so it could exist in this world and eventualy become a physical being. Only one power was great enough for it to feed upon, the Asterite. It finds the Asterite and hides the globes in a place far off and unknown, perhalps even out of time itself. Vernineus eventualy creates a physical form for itself resembling somewhat of a Vortex but very different, drawing energy from a globe it keeps in its chest. When the globe is drained of all its power it turns into stone becoming innert. As Vernineus draws energy from a globe he slowly starts developing flesh and bone over his energy projected body structure. Vernineus wants to kill Ecco, as well as work on another agenda which remains unknown.About the Stone in Time The Tower of MU and the Time MachinesThe Seven Dark Whales are the first to relize Atlantis had many time machines which once belonged to MU, as well as an Atlantean built time machine. There are five time machines altogether, two which can travel into the past, two which can travel to the future, and one which can open black portals. The time machines were once all keapt in the tower of MU where they were connected. In order for the time machine that opens black portals to work the other time machines power had to be unlocked. Unlocking them were the only way to make the black portal time machine work. When Ecco returns, this somehow triggers the black portal time machine to awaken. Its this same black portal that caused MU to vanish along with all its people.About the Stone in Time St. Gabriel and the MaskWhen Atlantis was devided by the Gods, St. Gabriel became Posiedens messanger. Gabriel was corrupt as he learned he could change his messages to things for his own desires. When Posieden learned of Gabriels treachory he turned Gabriel into a dolphin as punishment. Gabriel ashamed of his new form started wearing a mask with a human face to cover his shame. Gabriel eventualy wanted revenge against the gods and sought to destroy Atlantis. It was during this time the Atlanteans were ready to break from God rule which Gabriel got in the way. The Atlanteans eventualy kill Gabriel, wher ehis immortality cant bring him back to life. But Gabriels burden of hate and sadness lived on to eventualy become reborn as seven Arkons.About the Stone in Time AtlaAtla was one of the Levians who helped found Atlantis, he was also the creator of the Mu time machines. The Levians ruled Atlantis until the people sought to over thow there godlike rulers, Atla joined this revolt and became an Atlantean hero as well as the guru of sciences and technology. When Princess Cassandra predicted the destruction of Atlantis, Atla propose they create tools for him so he could travel to Vortex and defeat this menace. The tools would have to be usable by a dolphin, for Atla was a dolphin, the time machine would have to be set so it could reconize him. Atla promised sometime in the future he would find these tools and use them to avenge Atlantis. But Atla had to leave, in a far off future Sitna will awaken and seek to kill him. Atla wanted to keep his promise to Cassandra but at the same time Atla also wanted to gather knowlege and hide in a place where sitna could never find him. Atla decided to split himself into two, one part would be sent into the future, the other would be sent protected by an Arkon into the far far past. The plan was set, Atla could now avenge Atlantis and destroy Sitna.About the Stone in Time : The Marks upon his HeadA baby dolphin appeared out of nowhere, this dolphin had five bright silvery marks upon his head. This baby was eventualy adaopted by a pod of dolphins who found him abandoned. He grew up to be Ecco the Dolphin, one day a violent storm occured which swallowed his family and he descovered it was created by an alien race called the Vortex. Ecco avenged his family and saved them by defeating the Vortex. Time split into two because of Ecco's use of the Atlantean time machine, and eventualy Ecco found he had to vanish in time in order to save it. But certain events would occur for time to split again and Ecco was set free, he went off to defeat the Vortex once again to stop a dark future from being reborn. When his quest was over a clan of dark whales sought to re-awaken the dead dark future by summoning Apacalypes from it. Ecco had no knowlege of this, as he traveled into the past to save the Asterite and destroy Vernineus. So it was up to Arkonviox to destroy Apacalypes for him in a future that was destroyed and about to wreak vengence amoungst the intire cosmos. As both Arkonviox and Ecco returned to the present they came back to a world in ruines ruled by the Earth Clan, and led by a powerful magian dolphin named Sitna. Sitna's presence awakens Apollo the dolphin god and MonArk the dolphin god of war. Apollo has waited since the begining of time to face Sitna, but Apollo relizes only Atla can defeat him. When Ecco appears the marks on his head become evident, Apollo was looking for a dolphin with marks upon his head that represent Apollos rise from the sea. There was a meaning after all, the marks represent Apollo, if Apollo merged with Ecco they would become Atla once again. So Ecco's destiny was revealed.-------------------------------------------------

basicaly atla is both ecco and apollo. he split into ecco to save atlantis to fulfill his promise to cassandra, and became apollo so he could watch over sitna. ecco is basicaly atlas power and strength while apollo retains all his knowlege, apollo is the only one who knows who ecco relly is, who he himself relly is and everything atla used to know. also apollo is relly old while ecco is relly young.and to answer your question about atlantis, yes in my story atlantis was a dolphin human uptopia, there was a race of dolphins more intelegent then bottlenosed dolphins known as the atlantean dolphin race. but it was the gods who founded atlantis and the "gods" werent human or dolphin or relly anything, but from what you can probably figure out the "GODS" who founded atlantis were people of MU or people of the MU Levian society. And MU is actualy people who survived atlantis destruciton and traveled into the past becoming more advanced.basicaly the atlanteans are responcible for there own creation. which is another loop in the timeline, much like ecco and the asterite globe loophole.if you want to know what the "GODS" were they were originaly humans or dolphins. In Atlantean society technology rules and dolphins learned ways to overcome there limitations as dolphins so they could do things like humans could, atla for example had metal arms on his armor, small machinical grabblers which he uses like hands to build stuff.please if anyones got questions please ask them cause i dont even know if i got everything in my summery there.

And now for some info.These creatures reside on my made up fantasy world called Eutheria.Hawthry Also known as the Pocket Dragon, because it resembles a small dragon. But it is in fact a mammal, and is about 2 1/2 feet long (not including the tail). Very docile creatures that can be found all over Eutheria in large colonies. They are a common site. They are also very intelligent, and while do not have the ability to speak themselves, can understand human speech. They have retractable claws.Pokaydra come in any colors that you would find on cats, dogs, or horses.

what are scraps anyways?I won't get a chance to comment mainly cause i'm still kinda avioding deviant, everytime i look at it i kinda get a bitter anger that wont go away. i like your creations though, my best way of creating monsters is to combine traits and features of other ones to create something new.i didnt create this character but for exmaple....the Arkon who's a stingray, he wears armor thats of a bat, stingrays cant communicate with dolphins but since he's got armor thats of a bat and since bats use sonar that gives him new abilities. which is just wierd but interesting.

Scraps are a new feature that they added to seperate your sketches and unfinished work and other things from the stuff you really wanna showcase. Now even if you submit something as a deviation, if you put it as "doodles and sketches" it will automatically make it a scrap instead. So it's basically sketches and stuff, but they are seperate from your gallery. And since they're separate they get less veiws and comments. ;_; Especially since I think some people still haven't figured out how to 'watch" them.Anyway, that does sound kinda weird.. Bats can communicate with dolphins then? Why not dolphin armor?Well, thanks.The Pokaydra is basically like a little furry dragon, but it's kind of a cross between a cat and dog in some respects. And this particular drawing looked like a horse at first, before I changed some things, and still does a little bit. I mader it up originally for a story that I never got far with (the pocket dragon in that story could talk, but it ended up being too much like Nall from Lunar).The Hawthry is basically like a wyrm, but much smaller than how you would normally think of a dragon. And I don't think wyrms usually have wings, though there's no rule that says they can't. But the Hawthry is kind of like a hawk and an owl. I think the idea came from a dream, or something. I had never thought of a legless dragon before then--had never heard of wyrms or wyverns at the time.

basicaly the people of MU are way more advanced then the atlanteans. why?when atlantis was destroyed by the vortex the atlanteans used there technology to escape the disaster traveling into the past. when they arrived it was tens of thousands of years before atlantis ever existed. they created the city of MU (MU means 'nothing', named that because the city the people started with nothing.) they used knowlege they had from atlantis and advanced it making them become experts on time itself.eventualy mu was devided into two societies who used levian technology to produce a special natural energy or magic. the levians started atlantis when they started not being able to get along with the magians, a negotiation began....the world was devided amoung the two groups. posiden was given an island which he would have his son Atlas rule. the people of this island where given knowlege and technology in return that they would obey the rule of the gods. not all the "gods" were bad and the only reason they were referred to as gods is because remember the people of MU are immortal. Soleila are you really a realtor? And if you are, what kind?

I even don't know if this word is correct but looking into my dictionary I found 'realtor' next to my German occupation which is 'Immobilienmakler'. That means that I'm working on the property market but I am employed in a company that sells houses and flats. Luckily I don't have an own company yet. That's too stressy for me and I think I'm too young and need more experiences. My task is to find suitable flats and houses for people and so I think that I could call myself an (employed) realtor. I also offer financial advice and maybe one day I will have my own company but before, I want to study much more. It is a high risk.Man, it's so hard to describe jobs in English. Sigh.

Okay, I noticed in the other thread that there really is interest in my theory about the Asterite and so I could not resist and want to share it with all the people who do not know it yet.I also improved and updated my old post because in the meantime I discussed the topic very often and came to new conclusions that made more sense to me. So it is also interesting to read for those who already know it. Secondly I have to tell that this text has been taken from the original 70 pages long German theory text that I created to start writing my fan-book Stella Mea. Because I only translated few facts that might be interesting and proved enough to publish, it looks pretty unsorted and my language is not the best. I hope that you will understand everything I wanted to tell. It's also important for me to let you know that this is just my personal opinion and theory. Nothing has been confirmed which is sad but I just want others to read it too. Have fun and enjoy this confusing and mysterious topic.

My findings and theories about the Asterite1. General description(at first I just want to describe his lifeform)In ToT the Asterite consists of 24 pairs of globes, in Ecco 1 he has only 20 pairs. I think that this is inexplicable but my first thought was that he regained huge amounts of energy when Ecco brought him the long-time missed globe back. This new kind of completeness has probably led him to grow but Id rather call this artistic license to make the ToT levels, where Ecco had to rebuild him, harder. All the ideas that he usually grows on his own dont make sense at all because in the far away bright future he still has 24 pairs and so, an energy thrust might be the only possible explanation for the four new pairs. Each pair is revolving around an invisible center and never changes the distance from this core. He is moving in a double-helix-shape which is not so easily to recognise in the 2D-graphics of the games but easier to see in the downloadable 3D-videos. The double helix exists because every single pair is revolving, led by the force field in the center. Many people believe that the globes are connected to each other but my opinion is that only the cores gravitation field leads them and fixes the being as a whole. Maybe this core is his soul or source of life. I don't know but it is a fact that it only exists when a minimum of two globes has found each other. By 'finding each other' I mean that a new core comes to be which is only possible when you put two globes together (level Moray Abyss). Only in this case it is possible to attach the other pairs/globes. It is also interesting to see that the birth of such a new core only happens one time! When Ecco collected the other globes in levels like The Eye we can see that putting two of them together doesn't lead to the existance of a 'second Asterite' at a different place. Maybe the reason is that only one creature could exist at a time instead of more single ones. Every single globe, either connected to the main creature or not, has the desire to revolve around an energetic field and thats why they followed Ecco on their own. The disconnected globes are not able to swim without such a leading energy, they just float, pulsate and move when they are affected by a force. So he cannot put himself together on his own but looking at the level Dark Water where Ecco took one globe from him and where Asterite fell on the ground unconciously, we can see that he later must have rebuilt himself. This had happened because the disconnected globes were close enough to each other and thats why the Queen wanted to shatter him all over the oceans in ToT to prevent the possibility for him to rebuild himself. According to this, we can assume that he can rebuild his core when he is able to create a new one which only happens when two globes are close enough to each other. If not, another force (in this case it was Ecco) has to bring them at the right place to make him live again. Another point about this topic is that he only has his full power when all the 48 globes are together and when the creature is complete. When he is lacking of some of them, his 'main-part' isn't able to gather them on its own. The other connected globes always create a vacuum (these bubbles) and I suppose that this is to keep the balance. As you can see, he lives in a state of everlasting balance, he never changes and so I guess that these empty places are made for this purpose. Some people thought that he consists of single creatures but I dislike this aspect because he is talking in the I-perspective and he never uses the word 'we'. Maybe the globes are single creatures but they share one mind and act as a unit. Thats why they dont certainly act when they float around. Asterite cannot reproduce them like cells. If one is lacking, he needs this certain one back and this also supports my theory that they are not single independent creatures.There are four different colours the globes have - green, blue, red and brown - and my opinion is that they have different tasks. I really dont know which tasks this may be but in a fanfic a person thought that it could be defence (we can see that he is able to defend himself in Dark Water), control (I believe that this has to be a task because he moves himself, maybe he is even able to move from one point to another and he traveled through space somehow), memory (he saves a lot of knowledge) and sense (he can talk via telepathy, he can see and understand). This idea is funny but I like it. Who knows? He has twelve of every kind and the lack of one could mean that he is no longer able to fulfill a certain task perfectly. There also is a pattern, a certain order of the globes you can find out easily but Im too lazy to describe this now.What else can be told about his species is that he is definitely immortal. Even if he can die when he looses all of his globes, it is always possible to rebuild him. As mentioned before, all you have to do for this is putting two globes together and he starts to live again. Finding the whole rest will rebuild the same creature he had been before he died, and he seems not to loose his memory because of this. Another point is that the single globes are indestructable. A proof for that is the level Globe Holder where one of his pairs is locked up for several million years. It did not starve and I believe that the Queen had tried to destroy it but she wasn't successful. He still lives at the end and in the far away bright future and after Ecco completed him, he had his whole power back (a proof for him becoming very old or just for truly being immortal). I also believe that the globes don't need water to survive. I tried to push one out of the water in the level Ridge Water and it pulsated without returning from the surface. When I suppose that he came from the stars, it might be true that he doesn't need to breathe or even to eat. Another weird thing I once tried was leading a trilobite into his cave when I played the level Dark Water. Of course, he did not attack or eat this nasty creature, lol. I thought that he was eating because the globes are pulsating when they are disconnected from the main-creature but that has to be wrong when I suppose that he traveled through space for millions of years and looking at Globe Holder, we can find another proof that he doesn't need to eat. Or do you think that the Queen fed him? So it can be said that he is truly not a usual living animal - maybe he is a lifeform that contains the purest kind of life in itsself.The last question in this descriptive part of my text is his inexplicable change in the bright future. The globes seem no longer living, soft and pulsating. They seem to consist of crystal structures and I have no idea why. I believe that he just got older or evolved. Maybe the globes don't have different tasks in the far future or they gained new abilities. There is another VERY weird theory that came to my mind looking at the level Asterites Cave in the bright future: Any kind of creature except Asterite swims in pods and I think there is only one further exception - this strange worm thingy in the same level! I thought that this creature which is completely different from all the other creatures in this world, could be an Asterite larva. Maybe the Asterite has changed so much because he finally was able to reproduce himself after a long time and maybe he planed to become something totally new or more powerful. Of course, the worm doesnt remind to Asterite but larvas always look different. What if his globes only changed because he has some sort of a child? Lol, that goes too far but it is a new and interesting thought I think. Another change in this timeline is that Ecco cannot swim closer to him. The reason could be a water current that exists because the globes are solid or it is a further defence mechanism he invented after all his bad experiences in the present (look at the crystal in front of his cave to prevent others from entering, only those who are allowed may pass and only he allows them to escape from his cave).________________________________________________That was my general description. It's sad that we won't understand everything but that was all I found out about his species. Additionally, I left the Ecco Comics out. They contain lots of interesting stuff about his lifeform/civilisation but they are not official even if I also wrote a theory about the comics which I wont publish.

2. History/Characterization(a try to characterize him by looking at his possible history)My views about his history are much more speculative. Describing a creature is easier than imagining where it came from and how it developed or better said, how its character had been formed. I will try to explain my points as well as possible 'It will not sing to us'). After further years of watching the developement he sensed the attacks of the Vortex and felt that life was in danger, but missing a globe and being uncomplete forced him to wait. He was not able to act on his own because he was lacking of his full power or maybe he just didn't care about Earth and the Vortex. He still waited, maybe he wanted to be whole again and so he decided to communicate one day, when Ecco would appear in his cave. Because of studying Atlantean time travel he finally knew that the unknown dolphin who attacked him in the past came from the future and so he waited for the day to talk to him. Finally the moment came and present-Ecco visited him in his cave asking for help. I think it was the first Earth-conversation in his whole life and he offered his help if Ecco would help him at first. (Maybe he had the will to protect Earth from the beginning on. Look at the conversation in Deep Water. He hesitated and offered his help before he told what Ecco would have to do. Another fact is that he knew that Earth was in danger and maybe he had changed his views long time ago and wanted to protect this world) The rest of the story is well-known. Ecco traveled back and the same stuff I mentioned before happened to Asterite. His present avatar regained his full strength and helped Ecco. I think that they became friends after that and maybe they learned alot from each other in the short time when they were together. All I can say is that Asterite's behaviour changed. He no longer waited passively in the darkness. Maybe he started to communicate with other animals, mistrusting them was over, and he begann to become a leader or a guardian. It is often said that he didn't leave because he was uncomplete but even after being complete he decided to stay on Earth forever. He probably did that because of his tasks or maybe because he felt responsible for others as he never did before. The rest of the story is also well-known. After helping Ecco, he had been killed by the Vortex Queen (She found out why she had been beaten and how to kill him, which means that she probably had killed more of them in the universe. It is also a further proof for him being not the only one of his kind). It looked strange to me that he didn't defend himself but I guess the reason is that he is not a warrior or a fighter who is able to act in such an active way (he always needs others to act for him). In Dark Water we can see that he was able to fight in a close combat but not from the distance. Maybe the Queen even knew this and so she attacked from distant above to destroy the gravitation field that holds his body together. She also knew that taking away a pair or just one globe would prevent him from helping Ecco once more and so she decided to take one to the dark future. She also knew that he is immortal and easily to rebuild and so she invented a machine, the Globeholder, to make it harder to set him free. Because of this pretty high knowledge about Asterite's species, I suppose that she and her race had fought more of his kind which leads me back to the view that he is not the only one. Without his completeness, Earth cannot be saved too and that's the only reason why she did that.All in all his death was felt by other singers which may mean that they had a connection to him. This totally disproves my first theory that he hasn't communicated to singers before he met Ecco. My idea is that he started to communicate to all creatures of the sea, or maybe just to the familiar dolphins he liked so much, because of the friendship with Ecco that existed during the short time between the first and the second game. Who knows, but this could explain a lot. During this period the dolphinkind found out that he probably wants to guide them and I guess that the encounter with Ecco finally led him to accept this new role. Well, I just suppose that something like this might have happened and so there was a strong relationship between Asterite, who had been silent before and who finally felt responsible, and the other sea animals. The result of his death was that Ecco lost his powers and had to breathe air from this moment on. I think that Asterite had projected a part of himself, maybe something he gained from his unknown everlasting source of life energy, into Ecco in the first game and the loss of his life ended Ecco's abilities. The strangest part of all was the intervention of Asterite from the future who sent Trellia to Ecco's home bay to bring him there. I think that Asterite's knowledge about time travel made this possibe but I will explain my time travel theories later. Trellia traveled to the present and brought Ecco into her timeline. The ability to take Ecco with her was certainly given by Asterite who probably had evolved in a way that made even something like this possible. When Ecco met the a little bit strangely-looking Asterite in the far away bright future, he had been warned by his old friend. So Asterite had knowledge about the split of the time flow and showing the memories of his own death was a way for him to explain Ecco what he had to do. I think only the split of time caused this chance and because the bright and true version of the world coexisted with the dark Vortex furture, the Asterite, who lived on in the correct timeline, was able to act instead of just being dead in the present (a strange way but it must have been like that). However, after the conversation in Asterite's Cave, Ecco used a metasphere to return to the present. Asterite had made these thingies - maybe another ability he learned because of his own evolution - to change a creature into another form and to travel back in time like Trellia did before. Ecco arrived in the present where he rebuilt Asterite, it happened in the way I described above and the more globes he had the better he felt. Still uncomplete Ecco finally had to travel to the dark future that still existed because it hasn't been avoided yet. He succeeded and the rest of the story is not a secret. The completely rebuilt Asterite gave him the same powers back and the Vortex were defeated (or not?). The last thing the Asterite tried to do was convincing Ecco to destroy the time machine. For some reasons (maybe the escape of the Queen-larva) Ecco ignored this and the story was over. I did not want to repeat the whole story, I wanted to explain Asterite's deep change of mind and the developement of his character. I think that Asterite totally accepted his new guardian-role and protected the ocean creatures from the very moment on when Ecco helped him first. The events in the second game, where Ecco helped him once more, even improved the connection between him and the other sea animals. I suppose that he finally became their protector and leader and this hasn't changed after Ecco's disappearance. Sadly all we know from his further history is the bright future where he acts like the everlasting calm and gentle father. The moment when he communicated with Ecco in the future was very touching and you can also see that he changed his way to talk. In the first game he gave instructions and talked in a pretty objective and direct way. In the second game his behaviour changed and I think his friendship to Ecco was the reason. As I told above, he began to guide the sea animals, sang a song to gather them and looking at his words you can see a certain difference. In the bright future he calls Ecco 'his little singer', in the present he showed a deep responsibilty and did not give up after all his bad experiences. Regarding the whole developement I think that he needed million years to build up such a connection to this world and he finally cared for Earth and the sea creatures. I also believe that he is able to move from one place to another and it could have been his own decision to leave the dark abyss where he had been rebuilt by Ecco to stay closer to the others (his new cave is near the surface in the future) but I think it is not neccessary because he has other ways to act and to communicate. Sadly I don't know if he is able to move or to look for another home cave but I'm feeling quite sure about this. It is not so important at all, the main fact is that he began to protect the world and I suppose, looking at the conversation with Big Blue, that he didn't want to do this before. He still protects the world in the bright future where he seems to live forever and he still communicates with dolphins and maybe with others. Probably he even tought them how to communicate via telepathy and how to fly through the air. I don't know but I think that the slow change of his behaviour and his personality are interesting. Going this way must have been his destiny from the beginning on but he had to learn alot and finding himself wasn't easy. I hope that his story will continue one day in the third game but looking at his long history and at his life in the bright future I think that he will not change back to someone who doesn't care for this world.____________________________________________That's all! With this part of my theory I tried to explain the developement of his behaviour and the discovery of the role I suppose he fulfills now. It was damn long and not more than a retelling of the game but I had no other way to show my views about this. He wasn't always the same and I hope my little story brings us closer to the truth!

3. Meaning/Tasks(my last post tries to conclude about his tasks on Earth with reference to the above)I think that this is a point discussed very often but I will try to post my views about this once more. I still believe that finding out his tasks on Earth is easy when you look at the design the game creators chose for him. For me he still is supposed to look like a DNA strand. That doesn't mean that he is one because a DNA cannot act, think or talk by itsself but the design seems to be a symbol. Maybe the four globe colours should symbolize the four different proteines but I'm absolutley not sure about this. Some would disagree about that point of view but for me it has to symbolize something. A DNA has two main tasks The first time was in Dark Water when Ecco had beaten him, the second time was after the conversation in the bright future by creating a metasphere that had been used by Trellia too. Because of this it seems to me that he controls time somehow but I'm not so sure. The first time could just have been some sort of an accident because Ecco had come from the present and changed something in natural history as he also did in the Level Globeholder where Asterite's globes worked like a time machine once more. Only Ecco's intervention had made the present/future possible and this action could possibly have caused the time warp. About the second time I have talked above yet. I don't think that he is able to travel in time. If he would know how to do that, he would probably have changed a lot. I am very sure that he knows how time works (maybe from the Atlanteans) which could mean that he protects the flow of time. He knows how to control the time machine ('Use this song to travel back...')/create a suitable metasphere and he knows when an accident in time happens and what to do about it. All in all this might also be one of his tasks but I don't know. The main developement and his final decision to fight for Earth caused an important meaning for all sea creatures. I suppose that he is not only their guardian or leader, I also think that he helps them with his knowledge and watchs the world to protect it and to be present forever. His other tasks, bringing life to Earth, causing evolution or guarding the flow of time are pure speculation and I don't want to think about them for longer. I'd rather keep it that way and hope that some questions are answered now. ____________________________________________That's all to say about his possible tasks on Earth and I guess, even if many people disagree, that the game creators had not chosen his certain design because it just looks cool. Regarding this, we can find out who he is, and that has to mean something. It's hard to think about it all but I hope that I did not confuse you even more with the stuff I wrote and I also hope that you enjoyed the results of my difficult work.

Yeah, that is basically a realtor, I guess...Good luck with that.

Wow, my eyes hurt from reading all that.I've got my own therioes too:The Asterite (which you said could be a creature of pure energy) could have been created by MU (Ark told us that they were beings of pure energy). Or that he was created by the Vortex (that would explain why the Vortex can "kill" him, and that he comes from "a far away world"). Maybe the Atlanteans were afraid of him (he was quite powerful) and they locked him in the cave. But, he could have become so powerful he could open and close the "cave" at any time he wants. Also, about him attacking Ecco, he could have been evil for a while (the Atlanteans would be afraid of that and locked him away). The Asterite could have been part of a alien race (like the Vortex). They wanted to come here and destroy Earth. Since the Asterite can't "move" he has others do his bidding (similar to the Vortex Queen). And since the Vortex don't want any competition, they wanted to kill him. And Ecco's friendship with the Asterite could be the same (have someone else do his bidding to kill the Vortex). Then, once they trust him, he can strike and kill them all, and rule Earth.But who knows?It's just my theories...

well Mu was actuyaly not apart of the real ecco storyline, but whats funny is i thuoght of that for my story saying perhalps the asterite was created by them, or go even as far to say the vortex themselves where created by the people of mu.but i had other ideas of the asterite being born from space in a galaxy where other asterites are created. i strongly belive the asterite was sent to earth in its early years to gather as much knowlege of earht until it dies off and the asterite has to travel to another planet for new info. i also belive there is one asterite older then the others that is the main main asterite.

I never believed that Asterite is evil and wants to rule Earth. He stays here for a very long time and protects the planet. His whole behaviour showed that he is a good guy. There is no reason for him to lie at other beings or to rule a world. He just wants to live at a calm place to control the situation. I support Arkon's theory of his creation by a main Asterite too. It sounds very senseful to me.I also think that the Atlanteans visited Earth when Asterite was already here. If there would have been a contact between them, the Atlanteans would have mention him in their library. There was no connection I think.

General Description I tried to push one out of the water in the level Ridge Water and it pulsated without returning from the surface.that cant support your thoery there, mainly cause in a program such as ecco 2, they could have left out such detail for many reasons. one: because of the time and urgancy of how soon the game was to be released. ed annunziatta had left alot of things out of ecco 1 that he wanted to put in for exmaple the ancient dolphin ancestors that speak to ecco at origin beach. but you well supported the fact that the asterite doesnt breath because it came from space. support for this thoery is the name itself "aster-rite"Another weird thing I once tried was leading a trilobite into his cave when I played the level Dark Water. Of course, he did not attack or eat this nasty creature, lol.this is another thing that cant prove the asterite eats, two reasons one they could have left out a detail because of how fast they had to make the games completion deadline and two they had no reason to show such a detail in the first place. for example the other creatures dont eat ethier even the dolphins arent shown eating relly but if all the other creatures were eating then this thoery would be valid. but you did prove this thoery right by saying how would the globes have survived in the globe holder? that proved it more.Any kind of creature except Asterite swims in pods and I think there is only one further exception - this strange worm thingy in the same level! creature looks the way it does, the same reason the moray have globes making them up, basicaly in a 16 biut game there isnt a way to make them look like snakelike creatures or in this worms case worm like creatures so they use cheap tricks like using balls to simulate the worm botty movement cause the processors arent powerful enough to actualy make a realistic worm body. so i seriously doubt this worm larva has any relation to the asterite.but besides that i cant prove anything wrong everything there is well thought out the only thing that wouldnt work is the worm thoery, that the worm was a child of the asterite, also using the games dynamics to prove points doesnt work, mainly cause if you loom carefuly enough you'll notice certain program flaws do not tie in the story at all. program flaws like the asterite eating (that was left out because the story showed no reason tro show it and the other creatures besides dolphins didnt eat anyways.) and...the globes breathing out of water (theres no reason to show that detail ethier, usualy detials like that are put when you have a game filled with detail and reaslism which ecco lacks or if you have some sort of objective. same goes with the asterites feeding, it ethier has to do something with the story, like the vortex queen feeding, or its put in to make the game detailed (which this game doesnt have that kind of detail to begin with.) just read me out im not trying to prove you wrong cause i like this thoery sounds like something id come up with, but with my knowlege of programming and how programs work i can tell you there are details you will want to ignore that dont tie into the character of the asterite and are more programming flaws.as for the globes changing from 20 pairs to 24 pairs cant explain that you seem to used program design logic there that they might of added it as an objective or...by mistake.you should check out the game gear ecco also, the globe amount might be different there too. also i can say the game gear ecco the dolphin and sega cd version seem like the most complete ecco games made, ecco for genesis is incomplete missing stuff. but the game gear ecco the dolphin is pretty much perfect storywise . ecco 2 for game gear was heavily rushed and not relly completed.anyhow im reading through this please understand besides you im the only other person who has relly examined this game, and almost every detail. your thoery is actualy near perfect, the only reason why it isnt perfect is only one man knows more about the asterite then all of us...sad to say he wont replie damn History/Characterization(a try to characterize him by looking at his possible history)I thought id continue my analyzation of this. i promise i'll write my own thoery when i get a chance, it will include ideas from yours and some of my ideas we can debate the ideas to create the final completed thoery which i will add to my site. basicaly you have the right stuff i just need to talk to you more about things.anyhow i read the whole history through. i can say we have no proof the atlanteans knew about the asterite but we know the asterite knew about the atlanteans, i belive the asterite might possibly have a psycic link with every living thing on the planet including the vortex who invaded it. big blue knew about this, "we feel great energy of thought from the asterite but it will not sing to us." i think he was telling ecco basicaly the asterite doesnt sing to communicate.as for the asterite of the future there are some things i know you kind amissed in your thoery and you will find this a little overwhelming. but the asterite of the future actualy lives in a cave on a floating island high in the sky. proof of this, ecco had to travel from the ocean on earth to floating island to floating island until he reached the great sea of the sky. the asterite probably lives on a giant floating island very high up. now as for the asterite moving, i belvie the asterite could move if it wanted too but i dont belive the asterite has left his spot since he first arrived on earth. i belvie he has been in the same spot since he first touched earth. i think it was the process of time that changed his enviorment.the only time the asterite was moved from one place to another was when ecco rescued it from the moray. i think after that the asterite has remained in that abysss for millions of years. great eruptions occured creating the floating islands. this probably occured around the asterite, a great castrohp event.the glyphs that guard his cave in the future i wouldnt take as a serious sign of the asterite trying to block acess to its cave although we can kinda understand why, perhalps he doesnt want feeding invaders and predators. but then again those glyphs were probably put there without thinking for game objective reasons, havent decided if that should remain in the thoery, but i cant think of a reason to take it out, cause we dont know if that was done to make the game challenging or the people who decided to place it there (the programmers) wanted to enclose the asterite in a safe little home and wanted to make an objective too.you had one interesting point i'll get into it in a second...basicaly when ecco first met the asterite it's first responce was "I remember you..." i felt a little agression from the asterite when he said that too, and then surprise "of course it was you! and it was i who sent you..."i dont think the asterite relly chose to become a protector, i think it was the asterites job to begin with to be a protector to begin with, but since it was missing its globe it was weak. now what would the asterite do if it was complete ecco was able to keep his powers as when he traveled back to save his pod, meaning the asterite was able to project powers to ecco from the future into the past so ecco could travel back to fight the vortex. cause the moment eccos family was taken by the storm the asterite in that time was missing a globe still while another ecco only began his quest.so if the asterite could channel power to ecco in the past, this might possibly mean the asterite exists in two spots, on earth, and in a sort of time warp, if it channels power to ecco so ecco can use in the past then just maybe it channels all its power including the power it generates to live in a sort of time warp. meaning its physical body exists here and its power exists in all times! and when it was destroyed its power was destroyed in all times. what does this mean? it means the asterite sphysical body exists here and its energy exists in a time warp whats a time warp? well now for the dark secret, the asterite hannels its energy from....the tesseract....or quite simply the tides of time. sounds insane but i cant find another way for it to allow ecco to keep its power in the past while it's complet ein the future. it emans its power exists in all times as long as its complete.i like that thoery about how the asterite may have influenced the evolution of dolphin kind, that probably would explain why they are telepathic and why the asterite seems more involved with them and how they have powers of there own. somehow they must of learned to create there own powers like what ecco had and the asterite might possibly helped them with this.oh yeah one fianl thing, the asterite of the future gives ecco a metasphere to send him back. now how is that possible? well i belvie the metasphere creates maniature black holes combine with ecco's thuoghs of where he wants to travel he was able to travel back. in the game chrono trigger there is such a thing called a time egg which can do this, combine with the dreamstone it could send you into a different part of time, or you could use it to manipulate time, like destroy a timeline at your own will, but the metasphere combine with ecco isnt enough power to change the timeline but perhalps the asterite could have such a power if it were to manipulate time, but im sure it knows of these consiquences. im also sure the asterite knows alot about time and even about the tesseract itself who knows perhalps its origins or the origin of life exists in this very place. and that the asterite is the oldest life form in the universe.anyhow i got more to analyze later i cant do it tonight since i need a break and am very tired.

After our last conversation and after reading your points I think we fixed much more stuff. I will sumarize it once more to make it easier to find and my own theory has grown again. The way we work together is very good and finally we will have it. Here are the new conclusions and points I think we proved that the Atlanteans were the first Earth creatures who know about the Asterite. Maybe they even gave him the name. Asterite was born in space and I agree about the main asterite too. He traveled to Earth and the Atlanteans either sensed him or their profets found out everything about him regarding Earth history. Thus they created all the glyphs and those that are from the past or in the far future have been sent through time by the Atlanteans. I like your way to describe it by using the quote You disproved my theory and I agree with you know. The Asterite never moved from one point to another on Earth and it happened accidentally. But we have to admit that he can move because he came from space. Maybe his existance is somewhat static that he doesn't want to move. In future he lives on an island in the sky, that was true and I disregarded that. The other moments when he moved were accidents too. First, from Dark Water to Deep Water, the change of his caves came to be because he fell down unconciously after Ecco attacked him. The second change, from Deep Water to Morray Abyss, came to be because he was rebuild there. So it's ok to say that he didn't move in the game but I still believe that he could do it.3. Asterite's sensing abilities We agreed that he has emotions because of the way he talks. He doesn't sound like a machine when he says 'hello my little singer', 'you amaze me again little one' and another thing are some small points like this one here I am not sure about this. It was the result of a developement I guess and he is connected to other beings which wasn't like that in the past when he was agressive. I think we could use this part of my theory because it livens his character up and doesn't disproves other parts. It also makes sense and is interesting to see. I believe that he continued helping with his knowledge and other sea creatures often asked for his advice I guess. There is no proof against but I also agree with you that protecting Earth was not his basic destination. We have to find that out when you analysed my last part.6. The Tesseract It's for sure that Asterite might have tought the future beings. Why not. Creating a metasphere could also be an ability which he can do by using the power of the Tesseract. It's a certain fact that he knows about time and creating metaspheres is a possibility he archieved later in life. We could think about it for longer but I guess it would work in a way like that. Thanks for your Tesseract anyways - it has filled the spaces in my head!8. rebuilding/soul: We disagreed about the way to rebuild him. I still think that rebuilding him works like I described above. Put two globes together, let them rotate and attach the others. I think we should use this point and disregard the possibility of building up more of these beginnings because it's easier for the creature as a whole. We could let it like that but about the soul I think you could be more right than I. The soul is in his globes, only connected globes can act and the others just survive being unconscious. My core-theory also is not bad but we will find a way to conclude about that too. It's much more important that we agreed about the rebuilding. There is only this one choice because it makes more sense. The Asterite needs to be complete to have power and to rebuild his connection to the full power of the Tesseract. Remember, he cannot give Ecco new powers being incomplete and the globes do only change their colour from dead to living after they are reconnected with the main creature. This main creature is not the brain, the brain is the sum of all connected globes, but I'd like to call it 'the beginning of his new life'.That was all about our last points and only his true tasks still have to be regarded. If we let the character developement like it is, it will work easily and the last part is not more than a conclusion about the facts we gathered above.As I told before, the creation of our theory works pretty well like that. Later the stuff can be merged and partially copied I think. It's very interesting though and I simply love it.Anyway, I hope you don't mind that I repeated some stuff in my posts but I wanted to summarize which is easier than reading chatlogs that are longer than books now. i'm just writing a short replie for now, since im relly tired from staying up last night, i still got to anazlye part 3 of your thoery and even add some things. but i thuoght id explain the tesseract since my thoery about it has evolved.basicaly for my story "the tesseract" was named after how the atlanteans percevied it as, they used a four demensional hypercube to represent it, now you might ask why not a hypersphere? space is probably more like a sphere, well a cube shape is simple easy to measure and easyier to track as a forth demensional object, thats probably why they named a hypercube a tesseract and havent named a hyper sphere since a hypercube is widly used.anyways the tesseract is that place in ecco we know as the tides of time. its basicaly neutral time and space, a place that exists in all times in all places, to end up there is to end up everywhere....to manipulate this place is to manipulate existence itself, and from this place the effects of traveling through time are greatly felt. when the dark future was prevented it was purged somewhere in this place, it basicaly is a brocken puzzle piece that can always be put back.manipulation over time: imagine a god is controlling time, it has a giant puzzle in front of it the pieces that are connected represent the past, the pieces that have yet to be added are the future. now lets say we removed a piece from the stack of unadded pieces, the god who lays out the pieces would have to improvise creating its own piece which it belvies was suppose to go there.so in essense time is like a giant puzzle, whenever you destroy a future a new future is born created by improvisation. a way to explain this is imagine if you were doing a puzzle the the next piece that was handed to you was lost. what would you to do complete the puzzle? youd probably create your own piece and design it to somehow match the rest of the puzzle. those lost pieces still exist but are lost...this is how time works, and the tesseract provided with the right manipulation you can do many wonderful things, like make anything possible from a story. you can remove pieces add new pieces or even combine two pieces together to get a new piece. story wise i can create any character i want and not have to relly explain them, since they could of came form parralel futures that were suppose to exist. anyhow sorry to get off topic i thuoght id help you understand this tesseract better,

Well, I was trying to be vague, to save the details for the story so people will read it ;)The Caste storyline is ~3 years after Ecco's quest for the traits. Pilot has become the Prime Mover of his pod. The dolphins, with their new found abilites, have formed a loose alliance to survive and have started to explore their dying world. The soon discover that their mining station was one of several, and begin to look for survivors in the other stations, some better, some worse than the one they started in.In the beginning of the story, Pilot is exploring a station with Icarus, another mover, who is equipped with a labor harness. From there, I'm entirely sure what they're doing.

Now that was fascinating.I always had my own theories about the Asterite, and basically everything I thought fits right in with what you guys said here. I always thought it came from space because it was too unlike any other creature on Earth, not to mention the powers and lifespan. And I kinda automatically figured it had some kind of link with all the creatures on Earth. And I realized there must have been a resign it was designed as a double helix, like a DNA strand. I thought it could have been like the core of life on Earth, like the nucleus.If the Asterite inadvertantly started life on Earth by bringing bacteria, then it's important that it lives in the ocean. Life started in the ocean. And the reason is because the surface was pretty much ininhabitable. For one thing, there was no oxygen in the atmosphere. Any oxygen that was on the planet reacted with the stone. The first lifeforms exhaled oxygen, and that's how it eventually got into the atmosphere. Besides that, the conditions were extremely harsh. The winds were a lot higher than anyone has ever experienced here. And, I think there were a lot of meteroites and volcanoes, if I remember correctly. Basically, the surface was very chaotic. It may not have been impossible for life to evolve on the surface, but it would have been very difficult. And life would be very different now. The Asterite would have had to live underwater, because even if it doesn't need to breathe air, the conditions on the surface would have made a difficult life. Besides that, the planet is mostly water, so it only seems logical anyway for something that was able to choose to choose to live in the water.Arkon....have you ever read A Wrinkle in Time? The tesseract is important in that story. But they said it was the fifth dimension. The fourth dimension is supoosedly time.

Thanks for the ideas, Thetys. We still have to go through this whole DNA and tasks on Earth stuff but your post helped me a lot. You are right, maybe the Asterite even chose to live underwater or it happened by random. As I told, Arkon and I still need to conclude about whether the Asterite brought life here accidentally or because he had to do it but I think we will find out everything soon. Then we will have the ultimate theory for all of you. We're working on it.

There has been something thats puzzled me about ecco: the tides of time for a long time. After ecco rebuilds the asterite using all the globes he can find in the present the asterite tells him that the final two globes have been taken to the dark future and that he has no idea how ecco can get there since ecco can't go forward in time using the atlantian time machine. So ecco swims off to Lunar Bay and at the end of the level two vortex drones grab him and take him to the dark future... Um but why? If those vortex drones hadn't taken him ecco never would have been able to get there, so hence never been able to get the last globes and never beat the vortex queen. That entire bit makes no sense to me, why would the vortex take ecco to the dark future? Can anybody explain it to me?

Maybe a mistake?From what I hear, ToT was rushed.Maybe they added it but forgot to take it away. (Maybe Ecco was supposed to be a prisoner there.)

if your using internet explorer two things might help.first you could delete all your cookies and history letting you work from a clean start. to do that goto tools and internet options and delete cookies and history.also you could go to privacy and set it to medium or all the way to the bottom to low, and that hsould get them working properly.make sure you goto apply and okay after that, if you cant do that then you'll never get it to work.

Wow! It'll take me ALOT of time to read all this discussion (to find out what Soleila added to her theory). And now i have a small contribution to yr "Description" item. This idea came to me yesterday, and i decided to carry it out - these are the Asterite's physical characteristics. As we don't know what substance he consists of, and also what Ecco's length is (i took it as a mesure unity), these results may be incorrect. In brackets i give the formulars for this case; if you disagree with the meanings i took, you can put there yr own and count by yrself. So, let's take that Ecco's length (L) is 2 meters. Then the distance between the two globes - or diameter of the circle each globe strikes - is about 3 meters (1.5*L). The mass of each globe is 0.56*p*L, where p stands for the density of substance the Asterite consists of. "p" is surely less than 1 kilo per cubed meter. When i was working upon this i thought it was about 1/2, but i think it's even less. Ok, let's take it 1/2. Then the mass of a single globe is about 4.71 kilos. Each globe makes 19 turns in a minute, or nearly 0.32 turns in a second. The power, which holds each globe on its orbite, is about 28.6 newtons (or 1.7*(L^3)*p). The power of attraction between the globes in a pair is about 98.6*10^(-11) newtons, and power of repulsive is -98.6*10^(-11) newtons (ideal case). Each globe moves has speed nearly 3.02 meters per second (or 1.51*L). While moving, each globe posesses kinetic energy which is nearly 2.56 (or 0.64*(L^3)p) joules. The power of attraction between the two nearest globes in a chain is nearly 370*10^(-11) newtons (or 2.8*Lp*10^(-11)). Let's take that the distance between the nearest globes in a chain is l and is nearly L/3, or 2/3. Then the length of a single Asterite's chain is about 39 meters, the length of the whole Asterite is 28 meters. That is. I hope that'll be somehow helpful. :)

OMG!That's very cool, Delphi! I also calculated the Asterite's length but I supposed Ecco to have a length of 3 meters. He is a male bottlenose dolphin and that's an average size. Thus I came to a height of 42 meters and a globe size of 1 meter. That's funny. Lol. But wow, all the others things you added are just extra-cool. I like that and I did not know that you are good at physics, the strangest subject at all. Lol. Thanks again!About the name, we translated the suffix and the prefix, so aster-ite, and it looks familiar to us that this name should mean that he came from the stars. He is a living, thinking and feeling animal, the game creators chose a DNA-symbol for his design which is a main part of the upcoming theory we are working on, and we don't think that the name should lead to the association 'asteriod' or 'meteroid' to let him be a mineral from space.

Since I'm online I learned a lot but I make hundreds of mistakes because I just don't know the language. I think posting in message boards helps people like me a lot and so I keep it like that and hope that others always understand me.Anyway, I can't go worse, I can only become better.

In truth there is enough evidence to theorize on who this came to be but not enough for anything BUT theory. For all we know they could have intended for the globe holder to assimilate Ecco with the globes, 2 flies with one swat sort of thing. Maybe they used the holder and the near lack of defence leading to it to trick Ecco into thinking he had won, found his proze and could escape so he would let his guard down and get caught or killed, not counting on him avtually defeating the holder. All we really can do is guess as the evidence leads up to a certain point and no farther, leaving us to guess at the rest. Most of the abovementioned theories are sound in their own way, who knows, maybe they are all right? :?

I don't care if someone makes an honest mistake, just that it's important to correct your mistakes if your going to publish something--you want it to look professional. You know, when people shorten "you" to "u" or "for" to "4" cuz they're too lazy to write any words that have more than two letters.
