I've told this story enough times, copy and paste from my DA page...I shall tell you the story of how "boh" originated.One day I was having an audio conversation with my good friend via the interweb. Suddenly, his pc froze on something I was saying, and his pc kept repeating "boh" every 5 seconds. He thought I was mucking around and kept telling me to stop. Eventually he rang me up to tell me to stop...I could hear myself saying "boh" in the background.Since then I've stuck "boh" in various places, especially in my drawings.

I often wondered what we know about these things, how they work and where they came from. The metaspheres are a part of ToT and a glyph explained that the Asterite created them to change Ecco into other creatures but there are some things that confuse me about them.The first time in the game we see a metasphere is in the bright future where it changed Ecco into another lifeform. The primary purpose of them is to bring Ecco at other places. An example They only appear in the present when Asterite is nearly (???) complete and so I guessed that a complete Asterite is able to make them but they also appear in the dark future where we can just find two of Asterite's disconnected globes (is that right? are there metaspheres in the dark future?). I asked myself how this is possible, how to they work and why do they even allow time travel later? What do you think, does the Asterite have to be complete to make them? Is their time travel ability only possible after millions of years when Asterite has evolved? Are the Vortex who use them in their machine also able to make them or do I have to play the game again because I mixed everything?I think I should take a closer look at them. ........?You know, I never really thought about that. I never thought of that myself. I guess I just figured they were placed for conveniance, not necessarily tied to the story. But then, it seems there was a great deal of thought put into every element of the game, even small ones. So it makes sense to think there's a reason behind it.The only place I can think of where there are metaspheres in the dark future is when Ecco gets swallowed by the queen, or captured, and ends up in that place where he turns into a Vortex.....whatever those are. There's a metasphere right at the top that changes him.But it's been a long time since I played it.

I checked it more carefully and figured out that there are metaspheres in the bright future and in the present. The Vortex ship where Ecco finally fights the Queen is located in the present and NOT in the dark future. In the dark future are NO metaspheres and that shows a connection between Asterite and these things. If we can only find them in the present, where an unconcious Asterite still lives somehow, and in the bright future, where the evolved Asterite even uses them for time travel, we can assume that they can't be created in worlds where Asterite isn't present like in the dark future. That's all I think but I also like Mutaclone's idea that one was sent back in time and spread in the present where it found a way to connnect to the unconcious globes of Asterite. I am still putting random stuff together to create my character's story complete, but I plan to have it continue off a story I am currently working on. Bascially she is just a normal Spinner Dolphin, who is a mamber of the Eclipse Pod, given the name by passer-bys for their interest in the stars and the world beyond. Upon her dorsal fin is a blurred mark resembling a shooting star, (Which I created based from a story I read long ago.), but thinks nothing of it. However, this simple marking shows what her destiny truly is, and her secret lies in her song. A talent she keeps as a secret, not wanting others to find out for an unknown reason, is that her song can gain the trust of fish. Normally timid and frightened easily, fish will come bravely up and swim around playfully when she sings out to them. A gift she uses for fun, she soon finds out she is forced to re-awaken Ecco from some sort of abyss dungeon, and her song is the tool needed to save the many timelines branching off from the main timestream. A mess in the balance of energy has occurred, and if this is not corrected, the timestream itself will collapse and disappear into the abyss of nothingness. Time itself will come to an end. That is basically just a preview that I will need to work on, but I can't start on it until I complete my first story. I coudn't think of a name, so I just put some letters together and came up with Neria. (Near-ia) It stuck, so that's it. There's my story, and to Raeckon, now that you do have an avatar, will you be creating a story for it? Just curious. :)

My avatar was an idea of FargalEx who designed it. The primary reason is my screenname on COH which is Asti's Worshipper but Soleila is also the main character of my book Stella Mea. She is a human woman and has a connection to the Asterite without noticing it. During the whole book, they fall in love with each other but before I write down the whole contents, I'll copy my old COH post He says what he wants, calls 7 creatures who were true during the failed gathering and reveils his secrets. He even tells them about a second gathering in which he plans to tell everyone who he is, to end all misunderstandings and to regain the connection between the ocean animals and their leader but before, he wants Soleila, the person who is responsible for his deep change, at his side and creates a way for her to live underwater. To make it shorter, Asterites group succeeds in bringing her to him, teaches the ignorant girl and shows her parts of her own fate which she doesnt accept from the beginning on. Meeting her, he finds out what love is and both are more than fascinated from each other. Soleila never knew love but the way their relationship developes is like higher justice. Sadly it doesnt help, her old personality wins, she lies at him, is too proud to love and so she hurts him badly. Later she even causes an event that endangers him and the whole world (his death would end the ocean's balance and finally kill it), betrays him and suffers from her own conflicts and from the huge conflict in the ocean where she is hated with few exceptions only. There even is an important conflict between Soleila and Asterite because she is his opposite. While he is emotional, gentle, loving, shy, peaceful and somewhat pure and perfect, she isnt able to live with his perfection and all the love he gives her which desires too much from a person like her. Soleila doesnt deserve someone like him and these deep conflicts have to be solved until we might see a happy ending. There is a lot everyone has to explore and to find and so the main intention of my book (you have to beat yourself and risk everything before you find your true way home) is shown in many cases. Both characters have to give up themselves completely for several times and their love is avoided by a battle in the foreground and by their inner problems in the background. I'll better end here before you know the whole book, lol.

John Lilly is probably the most famous Dolphin Researcher of all time; He being the fella that attempted to establish interspecies communication between Man and Dolphin, and it was also his work that discovered that the Dolphin's Brain was significantly more evolved than the Human Brain. He is also of the most significant philosophers to come out of the 1960s wave of Optimism. and oddly enough one of his major contributions to the world of Ideas was something he named Earth Coincidence Control Office. I quote from the man himself."In ones life there can be peculiarly appropriate chains of related events that lead to consequences that are strongly desired. After such experiences, one wonders how such a series of events developed; sometimes there is a strong feeling that some intelligence (greater than ours) directed the course along certain lines which It/He/She was/is programming. Several years ago, I enunsiated a format for such concatenations of events, somewhat "There exists a Cosmic Control Center (C.C.C.) with a Galactic substation called Galactic Coincidence Control (G.C.C.). Within which is the Solar System Control Unit (S.S.C.U.), within which is the Earth Coincidence Control Office (E.C.C.O.). The assignments of responsiblities from the top to the bottom of this system of control is by a set of regulations, which translated by E.C.C.O. for humans is somewhat as follows1) You must know/assume/simulate our existence in ECCO 2) You must be willing to accept our responsibility for control of your coincidences. 3) You must exert your best capabilities for your susrvival programs and your own development as an advancing/advanced member of ECCO's earthside corps of controlled coincidence workers. You are expected to use your best intelligence in this service 4) You are expected to expect the unexpected every minute, every hour of every day and of every night. 5) You must be able to maintain conscious/thinking/ reasoning no matter what events we arrange to happen to you. Some of these events will seem catachlysmic/catastrophic/overwhelming there is no escape from it. We (not you ) control the long-term coincidences; you (not we) control the shorter-term coincidences by your own efforts. 7) Your major mission on earth is to discover/create that which we do to control the long-term coincidence patterns "Cosmic Love is absolutelely Ruthless and Highly Indifferent ECCO The Dolphin. Is the name on Purpose? or a "Coincidence"?Bobcheck outwww.johnclilly.comand/orwww.deoxy.org

goddammit, i didnt even have to read the replies to figure out how you guys are in the wrong direction. the machine is located on the planet vortex itself not in space in a ship, the tube was originaly intended to be a giant water tube (which was created from the vortex) that lead to a tube on the planet withen the hive on vortex. the hive is on vortex, just belive me when i say this stuff i know what im talking about and i'll prove it to you.heres a qoute that explains more then enough:"When you traveled to the vortex world the queen followed you back to earth."that coems from the asterite where he pin points proof that the machine is located "in the vortex world"also the movie in the mega cd version shows the machine is in the "vortex world" ed annunziatta the stories creator had creative control over the movie.if your gonna come up with a thoery you need to research from what the game gives you, otherwise they are too random.but i like the fact you are trying this, but i belvie it needs some buffing up, before its ready to become a thoery people can relate any too.also just to make clear the vortex didnt evolve on earth, they were created by the queen and enchanced. woute from the booklet "the vortex queen is creating a new race of vortex"

the tesseract is my word for "the tides of time". it is a place where time and space are neutral; meaning to be in this place is to be everywhere at everytime. i figure this place exists ethier in the fourth or fifth demension.my main belief is life and existence cannot exist without time, to go back or travel forward in time is to control life. so if someone where to be able to do such a thing they in essence become a sort of god over existence themselves. each choice you make brings fourth a different future, but at the same time exists a future that exists with the choices you didnt make. so the tesseract holds all possibilities, anything can be created from it and destroyed. so how does one control it? through the mind, it is controlled by dreams, why dreams? because our 3 demensional minds cant comprehend higher demensions like this so they come up with there own intepretation of it, through this anyone who ends up in the tesseract if well traiend enough in the mind can control it through thought.so the tesseract is in enssence the darkness of time and the beyond of the demensional distortions, its time itself.hope that explains it for you.

the magic arm is actualy a vortex creature. basicaly if you get all the bubbles it spews out or as many as you can and return back to the glyph that says "find the magic arm" it will then say "you now know the hunters song" which you use in the 3d levels to kill enemies with.

Before posting my vortex theory i want to say something which seems to be off-topic. This is mainly for Solly, Arkon and those, who read the stuff i posted in my "Life origin" thread at COH. You know, accidentally - this is the only word which can describe what happened - i became an owner of the book i was talking about - D. Melchizedek "The ancient secret of the Flower of Life". The first thing is that the information given by me originally is not exactly correct, but is a simple, very short and not fortunate at all retelling of some chapters. Secondly, i was surprised to read much familiar stuff there - the same which was posted about Atlantis by Arkon after my first post. I guess, Arkon, that you followed the road of D. Melchizedek and achieved familiar results. Or have you read this book? (But as far as i understood you didn't). And, finally, after reading several chapters it seemed to me that Ed read this book before creating "Ecco". But it couldn't be, because it appeared much later. It is based on the seminar, which took place in october 1993, but the book itself was published in several years. The phrase which caught my attention was "When the Earth passes through certain periods of history, other space civilizations try to take control upon the planet". Drunvalo doesn't give them any name, but calls them "the Grey ones". They were on the Earth when Atlantis sunk, and the last time when they were here is 1989. But there always was a person who was impowered to defend the planet from them - the only one who could do it. And he - or she - always managed his/her task. Sounds familiar, yes? This is just for yr information. If you have a chance to read this book, please do - it is great beyond words. I'll stop here, but there's some more stuff i'd like to tell you. Ok, later. Now back to topic._________________________________________________________________________________ What was left behind the game. Ok, we concluded that the vortex are parasites. Agree? Now i am going to prove that this is not exact, and originally the vortex were not harmful at all and didn't terrorize the universe, though they act like parasites now.The first thing which made me think like this is their society organization - as it was noticed, it looks like a hive. According to the ecological laws (i guess they're quite the same everywhere), the purpose of parasites' existance is endless multiplying. The fact that they have a single female organism is a fact which doesn't allow to provide this purpose. Then, the organisation looking like a hive (where each organism does his own job) is a high level of organization, which is not available to parasites. The vortex have a high level of technology either, and no parasite can create such. So, out of this we can conclude that from the very beginning they were not parasites - and were not going to become ones. Then, to create space technologies the vortex needed time. So, they should have developed in their own world and feed upon it. Out of this comes the fact that they couldn't destroy all the life on their planet (if they were not helped to do it, of course) - there would be a factor which prevent this from happening. (The law of "the back connection" - i don't know if i translate it right, sorry - it means that if one species comes close to destruction of another one, the one it feeds, there will be "the back connection", which will destroy a great amount of the first species' organisms). So, it turns out that they didn't need to travel to other planets. Something else should have happened. So, out of this complicated stuff i figure out the following story. (Of course, i don't want to say that THIS IS how it exactly happened, it's just a theory. Only a single person knows what happened in truth - it's Ed.) So, the vortex were the dominating lifeform on their planet. They passed through their unique evolution and achieved great results. I suppose they were not like the creatures we know now. They had a higher level of consciosness that times, and higher technologies also (later i'll explain why i think so). If to consider their "adoration" to abyssal depths, maybe their world had a high pressure and a low temperature. They could be space travellers that times - they had a good knowledge of space, at least, and could communicate with other species. If Asterite's home world is constellation Delphineus, it explains why he had good knowledge about them - as well as they knew him. They could have communicate long time ago. But suddenly something happened. It can be generally described as an energetic crisis.Different reasons could cause it - Asterite should know why it happened. After that regress followed - they lost some of their technologies. Remember, they had to wait for 500 years to travel to Earth "when there is a clear path", but not when they need it. (Idea copyright by D. Melchizedek - the story of Nibiru). Trying to find out what to do the vortex decided to take the needed energy from the other worlds. (I think that there are some more planets they feed upon - 500 years is a long period, the amount of energy they take on the Earth is obviously not enough for them). They chose the ones which had either a low technology level, or had none at all, and also a lower level of consciousness - maybe not to get powerful resistance. The Earth was included.Well, this is enough! I will tell you more, and i also have some comments to Raeckon's theory, but this is not for now. A day is obviously not enough to write this! And if to consider this is not my theme to speak on... Ok, i hope i'll manage to finish my theory by tomorrow - at least i'll do my best. Thanx.

No, Solly, there are MANY of us! :) But a fan club is a good idea!

raekon we still cant speculate that when vortex and earth are in contact vortex is light years from earth, firstly, ecco didnt have to swim lightyears to vortex and back yet he was in "the vortex world" two possiblities come from this//www.crystalinks.com/nibirureturn.jpghttp://www.crystalinks.com/nibiru.htmlalso id like to clear up the crap about the vortex and the asterite "knowing each other" thats completly untrue, originaly the vortex and the asterite had no connection at all.the reason why the vortex learned of the asterite is because long ago the vortex were at war with atlantis and possibly learned of the atlanteans and there descoveries. it was the atlanteans that learned of the asterite first, and the vortex probably gained there knowlege of the asterite from the atlanteans along with the time machine and many other things, there is no proof from the game showing the asterite had previous contact with the vortex kind, we know the asterite and atlanteans know of each other but the vortex and asterite originaly had no connection. so its better to conclude the vortex learned of the asterite through the atlanteans.

because in ecco one there was no magic arms, which means they were introduced when the vortex came to earth, sorry but your thoery about them being atlantean creations has no backing, otherwise the magic arms would of existed in ecco 1, and they dont. its better to conclude they are vortex creations, especialy since they exist in the dark future.

Well, I have a problem with finding out which worms truly are magic arms. There are many kinds of worm-like enemies in Ecco 2 and in Ecco 1 we can't find any. Look at the worms in Lunar Bay or at the one in Asterite's future. I guess that there are only two true magic arms in the game and that's when the glyphs mention them and say that you have to find them.Anyway, I would agree about the fact that they are Vortex creatures or creations and there is no proof for them being Atlantean. If the game creators wanted to tell us that they were Atlantean, they would have given us some hints for that. But I still believe that the other worms that you call magic arms, are not more than a way to have a bigger diversity of enemies/characters in the game.

also id like to clear up the crap about the vortex and the asterite "knowing each other" thats completly untrue, originaly the vortex and the asterite had no connection at all.the reason why the vortex learned of the asterite is because long ago the vortex were at war with atlantis and possibly learned of the atlanteans and there descoveries. it was the atlanteans that learned of the asterite first, and the vortex probably gained there knowlege of the asterite from the atlanteans along with the time machine and many other things, there is no proof from the game showing the asterite had previous contact with the vortex kind, we know the asterite and atlanteans know of each other but the vortex and asterite originaly had no connection. so its better to conclude the vortex learned of the asterite through the atlanteans.My first idea about them knowing each other has been proved wrong and there was no connection between Asterite and the Vortex. I corrected my theory about that but it's still unfinished. The true reason why people believe that is that most don't know the game gear version of the game. This version seems to be the ONLY game that proves a certain connection between Asterite and the Atlanteans because a glyph (created by the Atlanteans only) refers to Asterite and this doesn't happen in other games. We believe that Asterite studied Atlantis and that Atlantis studied Asterite but since Asterite was such a passive and hostile guy in the past who didn't care, we guess that they NEVER communicated. But they learned from each other and that's why the Vortex, who know the Atlanteans - their enemies -very well, also know about Asterite later. They also did not pay attention to each other because they had no reason for it. Asterite spent his calm life as a student on Earth and the Vortex never payed attention to him because they had no trouble with him. It's also important to mention that the Atlanteans knew about past, present and future. That's how they placed their glyphs and how they knew about Asterite, Ecco and so on...About the tube and the blackhole, I'm not sure. I also thought they'd have a spaceship to travel and the word 'Vortex World' I never took too seriously.

Finally I read your post, Delphina, and it's very interesting. I agree about the issue that the Vortex are no parasites. I guess they are a very old and highly-developed race that exploited their planet in a destructable way until it became I world full of technology but lacking of natural ressources and a living environment. That's just my personal imagination of them and not a theory. They got knowledge about Earth when they followed the Atlanteans who probably fought them and whose planet was dead too. The Atlanteans hid here and built up a base to defend against them and that's why the Vortex started to feed on Earth. They need this 'clear path' stuff to come here and that's why they only visit every 500 years. The game also says that their harvests increase and the reason for that may be that each race grows in their technology, their teritory and also in their needs. I also think they visit other worlds too. In the game, they show one of these feeding attacks but it doesn't affect Earth in a serious way I guess. The ocean is not empty after that, they just take a few creatures with them and the only point Earth has to worry about is that their hunger grows. Later in Ecco 2 the problem is another one, it's revenge and Earth has a true reason to worry about that.My opinion is that the possibility to make an acceptable theory about the topic, exists, but there still needs something to be done. Your ideas are cool, Delphina, and Raeckon's ideas are good too but we should try to merge the stuff together and look at all the delivered facts from the game as carefully as possible. It doesn't make sense to spectaculate wildly as I sometimes did in my old Asterite-theory. My personal view about that is that I'm not really interested in the Vortex and that's why I know nothing about them. For me they just symbolize a typical alien invader race we can find in lots of games and I feel no relation to them. But if people discuss that in a way we can see here, it's very nice to read it even if I don't know how to contribute.Another question: The book you mentioned, is that a true scientific theory or rather a finctionous story? Where were the glyphs that mentioned magic arms? I only remember encountering one. And I never knew what it was talking about, except it seemed to refer to that wormlike Vortex creature, but I never figured out (until now) what I was supposed to do with it. And it didn't seem to be crucial to completing the game.Why is it called a "magic arm" anyway? I've never seen anything that looked less like an arm.And I would imagine that if something looks different, it probably is different. Unless there's more similarity than just a wormlike body. Then it could be another variety or something.I guess I just figured that anything that didn't look like something from this planet and wasn't in Atlantis was some variety of Vortex. I just figured that some Vortex looked like worms. I mean I can't imagine a planet that only has one species that all look the same.

Well with the way dialouge was done, it would be hard to distinguish who was speaking if Ecco did talk. Game characters never spoke much, even if other characters in the game did the main one usually didn't. Except in RPG's. Of course when the Dreamast came out speech became more common for characters. But at the time it wasn't something you saw much.So it was hard to get a good idea of any character's personality, especially in Ecco's case since you don't have any expressions to go by, either.

I've always seen Ecco, for some reason, as having a gentle type of personality. He seems to be pretty popular with the other pod members, but I think that's at least partly because his unusual markings make him stand out. But I think he's also friendly, and he likes to help others whenever he can. I think in the manual somewhere it says he's a young dolphin, so I figured he's not quite an adult yet, or maybe a young adult. I always figured he was kind and caring, and generally quiet. He also has a lot of inner strength, and a strong connection to his family and friends. And he has strong determination, never gives up.I think that he was probably a reluctant hero type. He wasn't looking to be a hero, he just kinda got dragged into it without any choice. His family was taken away and he had to find them. Along the way other events occured, and some of the things he did caused more things to happen that he had to take care of. He was the only one who could do all of this. And he ended up being the only one with the power to stop the Vortex. I think he was perfectly happy to remain home where he was in normal daily life, but was sucked into all this and had no choice but to go through it all. Well...he had a choice but the only other option would be to do nothing and let the world come to an end. But he wouldn't allow that to happen.So I think he's also brave, and has a good heart.That was longer than I planned.

But it is interesting to see other peoples' theories.I theought the Tube connected from the Earth's ocean to the Machine on Vortex.When Ecco went back to the time that the storm came and took his pod away, he was also taken along with the storm this time. I kinda just figured that Ecco was borne away on this storm, and was taken to the Tube that way. But...was there something between there? I can't really remember. I guess that idea doesn't work very well anyway. But then, I never put much thought into it.

I see him as a young energetic creature who has great curiousity, but as time goes on he gains experience and wisdom. Someone who looks for fun, but is serious and strong when needed. When he knows something must be done, he goes with it until the end.

For me there are two ways how I can see him. He's introduced in a relyable way both in the Ecco Comics and in the game videos. We all know that the Comics don't really count because they are fan-made and not official but I like to look at them because they give the characters of the game more personality. So I cannot completely avoid to see Ecco like he is there. In the comics he is like a wild, stubborn teenager, he doesn't trust others (like Asterite), wants to attack any lifeform that looks like an enemy, is determined to save his family and always seems to be a bit uncontrolled, heatened and uncareful. Of course, he has a good core and is the typical fighter for the rights of weaker creatures but I think that has to learn much in his life. He seems young, angry and judgeful, I guess that he could become a great and wise leader but I also think that he has to learn about devotion, mercy and humility.The second way to look at him is shown in the original game videos of the Sega CD version. We know that these videos count as official because Ed probably worked out or controlled the contents and so we could say that they show a character of Ecco, that can be used for an official interpretation. Of course, the dolphin doesn't talk there, it would sound ridiculous if he would talk but he has some cute facial expressions that touched me very much (even Asterite shows a strange kind of his own original 'facial expressions' by using light and movement) and I think that was a nice way to give him a personality. We can see him smiling, he seems to be friendly, curious and caring but he also sometimes looks angry, aggressive and determined. That supports other views of him and I'd like to agree with that. In the videos he symbolizes a very nice guy which contradicts the comics but both views are interesteing to regard.

Not all were Vortex creatures and not all were magic arms. I'm confused about what it truly is.

Let's see if I can get my comedic engine kicked into motion.First must pick some kickass music...(ocremixes........mm mm good)Now must pick some kickass...meh the music was enough.Well a few days ago my illustrious aunt comes to me and starts talking about the behedings and crap in places like Iraq. She asks if I know how to use the web. (i spend all day sitting in front of my computer, what, you think I'm trying to learn dos through trial and error?) so I reply in the sweetest possible voice, yeeeeees.then I get the ever so famous, OH.you know this oh?I bet you do.it's the OH you get when you say something sarcastic and the authority figure you're talking to is trying to unhinge your sarcasm (in vain).Well can you show me this site to see these pics?this is where the error begins.1. I said yes.2. I said yes to go onto a computer, and log into the information superhighway with a 70 some year old woman who forgot the procedure for shutting down computers (ten times) telling me what to do.3. I said yes ma'am.there should've been lights.there should've been sirens.but nooooooo, not a single subconscious warning about the pile of shit I just logged myself into.So after seven misreadings of the exact web address and three unintentional porn popups I grab the paper and type in the address myself. It was the addy to some stupid california AM radio thing like knx 1070 or something really catchy like that, the kind of name they put in the annoying jingles that get stuck in your head driving down the coast highway in rush hour traffic while your dad's griping at life trying to see if there was a damned accident.So then she directs me to several links which she thinks are it. two were more porn popups and one of the annoying ones about how to stop popups...then we found the official speedvision homepage, you know that cool channel on the mose expensive cable packages that has only racing all day so you don't have to have commercials about golf during the indy500? yeah that one.So I get back to the site and find the link myself and boom there it is. exactly what it was looking for.I don't think it had occured to me exactly what she was looking for until that very moment. She wanted to be like the lanky kid from secondhand lions and the sixth sense, she wanted to see dead people.Several things crossed my mind like, my how little blood you have in your neck sir, my what a very sharp knife, and spekkio (but I think about spekkio just about every half minute anyway so there was no real change on that last one, the psychologist in my head is beginning to think that spekkio is the mental manifestation of my lack of a girl, but you know how right psychologists are). Then I thought the more important thought of that day, oh how wonderful bill gates is in the planning of his windows gui to copy mac and use that lovely x in the corner instead of making people use the file menu or press alt+f4.There went that window. So then she's like, why's it gone, i didn't get a good look.ANd now for that day's fun quote: "If you wanna get a good look at a man without a head watch sleepy hollow, but I'm not going back to that site in my life so you'd better wait for mom to get home."Back to the story, the day drove on and i quickly browsed my (censored) library to get my mind off my churning stomach. Fortunately some human instincts have great tendencies to block out all other thought processes for a while, (natural drugs, great, now if only druggies knew) then I played Chrono Trigger on my emulator and made it so that Crono had over the dinky 3 digits in health and lavos had 999,999 hp, mmmm rom hacks...*drools*ANyway, that's my first satire on life, please post('th) comments('th) and tell me if I should Post('th) more!

And then you must bathe in cooked and frozen lard, but not the very same lard you carried around unintentionally lighting.And when you emerge from the world of unhappiness and discrepancies you can form a religion on it, and call it the religion of Anubis, because everyone knows Anubis has nothing to do with any of the precepts of the religion, but we just like copying the uneducated biters who like taking names of ancient gods and forming paganistic cults after them which are really just individualized versions of the same thing, speaking of which, I wonder when AOL is going to come out with their next increment of free hours for the underclass of seniors, children under 12 and middle class yuppies to cheat them out of millions of dollars with?*kicks random generator up a notch*Purple stick flapjaw in the peanut sauce, I need scissors, 61.aww now it's just giving me stupid mgs2 colonel quotes.Raiden, you're playing too close to the tv....this blowsRaiden, turn the game console off now.As you wish, master.

My hobbit-nameNienna Calmcacil

Well here I'll put my ickle thing in, try not to mutilate me too badly for my theory as it may be disproven by Arkon in five nanoseconds.I believe that the game designers had in mind that the Asterite IS DNA, meaning he is the origin of every one of the four proteins that make up life. I get a large part of this theory from a movie I saw in BIO last year. In the movie it described how theories suggest that the amino acid chain existed in earths infantessimal oceans, created by the heat produced from undwerwater volcanic vents, and these amino acids began to rise, and disperse, until they reached the tide pools. There are many bubbles in the tide pools, and as strange as it sounds, they think that these bubbles may have been the origins of todays cell membranes. If this is the case then it can be said that the asterite CAN reproduce, in fact it HAS reproduced, that is where life came from. I don't however believe that it 'controls' evolution, evolution isn't mutation, it's not organisms changing. It's changes through generations. A common misconception is to view evolution as a bunch of changes that determine whether one species lives or dies. That's far too general, evolution is natural selection, evolution is survival of the fittest, a species doesn't change. What I mean is people think that evolution involves life NEEDING legs, so over generations life forms legs, and boom, that evolutionary tract stops. In fact its more complex than that, an andrewsarchus (the origin of most oceanic mammals) didn't just grow fins and plop into the water. First it started swimming, then a few got picked off by our prehistoric ocean predators, then only the andrewsarchuses...(don't know plural of it) with flatter paws would outrun predators. thus the babies with thin paws died. This process continued, and similar processes caused it to lose its fur, elongate its nose, etc. until we have a whale. That's why I don't think the asterite could control evolution, because evolution isn't something that's controllable, it's not a process, it's a complex system with several controlling factors, none of which are mysteries, and all of those factors are known and explained.Thus I think the asterite is simply, DNA, he may have come from another planet, he may have come from volcanic vents, either way the basis of my theory is sound...I think. If this doesnt make sense tell me so I can go more in depth, I tend to be choppy with my theories.

Noone here said that Asterite controls evolution. I just believed that but I've been proved wrong and came to the conclusion that he came here to study life with no interference. We all know how the process of evolution works and I don't believe that Asterite owns it. I just thought that he probably helped lifeforms to evolve but this happens years later in the far away bright future when he cares for Earth. In the past he remained silently and did not manipulate life.I don't think that Asterite IS DNA. He is much more complex or did your DNA-strands ever talk to you, manipulate time, change you into other lifeforms or save the planet by giving you powers to defeat an alien race? Asterite is a living animal, makes decisions, feels, developes himself and decides to protect after experiences changed his mind. He came from outer space, was born on a planet or somewhere deep in universe and it was his task to study life and to gather information. He hid himself for years and when he had no other chance he started to care. It sounds pretty strange that a DNA-strand acts in such a way and I would rather like to say that his shape is a symbol the game creators used to show something. Regarding DNA and looking at the way it comes to be, the resemblance between Asterite and it becomes more and more unlikely. It's easier for any kind of interpretation to assume that the design is just a symbol, an easy way to show something that even children could recognise while playing the game. And one further disproof: If he can reproduce himself as you said, why didn't he succeed in reproducing one missing globe? He needed the original globe back and wasn't able to create a new one in years. His complex and intelligent lifeform shows that he cannot BE DNA. If DNA is the basic of life, Asterite must have own DNA to develope himself. He learns in his life and evolves. Later he is able to create metaspheres and to receive a stronger and maybe more resistable body (his future design) so how could a DNA achieve anything like that?

I'm not sure, probably a year or so, maybe a little less.

Well no my DNA never talked, but I've never seen a DNA strand the size of the asterite. Maybe the logic was similar to what most people believe about the human brain, how if we used more of it we would be able to do paranormal things like telepathy. As for your reproduction, have you ever seen a man who lost an arm grow a new one back by having sex with someone elses arm? Reproduction isn't the same as regeneration, if creating a new globe counted as reproduction then you would be saying what you said you DIDNT believe earlier about how he was made up of many creatures.Also you say he manipulates evolution in the future, I just got done proving that evolution cannot be manipulated, what he did was mutate the code, which is different than evolution, a human being could incite a gene mutation, nothing controls evolution. You say he is a symbol, but what is he a symbol of? If it's life, then calling him DNA wouldn't be too off.

As for your reproduction, have you ever seen a man who lost an arm grow a new one back by having sex with someone elses arm? Reproduction isn't the same as regeneration, if creating a new globe counted as reproduction then you would be saying what you said you DIDNT believe earlier about how he was made up of many creatures.*snicker* That's a good one. And I agree with that point. However, I don't beleive that the Asterite is actually a giant DNA strand. For one thing, he/it would be incomplete if that were the case. It doesn't have the "rungs" that DNA strands have, the fibers or whatever they are that connect the proteins (I can't remember the technical term, it's more than five years since I had a biology class). And a single protein cannot be as big as the Asterite's globes are. Something of that size would have to be made up of many cells. I just can't imagine an actual DNA strand being that big. If I could just remember more, it would be easier for me to prove my point. I can't remember if a protein is a molecule, or if the actual strand is considered a molecule (which I don't think it is cuz it's too complex), but in any case you just don't see molecules of that size. It just doesn't work that way. If only I had my biology book to back me up so I could look this up to make sure. Anyway, I just don't think such a thing is possible. Besides that, the Asterite apparantly changed over time, since he is different in the bright future. DNA doesn't do that. Sometimes it's mutated, but that's something that happens when it's formed. It doesn't change over time.Oh, the other thing I wanted to say is your brain analogy doesn't work. It's true humans supposedly only use 10% of our brains, and who knows what we'd be capable of if we used more. But DNA isn't like that. A DNA strand does not just use 10% of itself. The whole strand is used. Everything on it is put into use. So it's not the same.of the beleif that it is either both sexes or neither one.

Reads, disappears and reappears with a big ol' "The end is nigh!" sign. >.>;

I've always seen Ecco, for some reason, as having a gentle type of personality. He seems to be pretty popular with the other pod members, but I think that's at least partly because his unusual markings make him stand out. But I think he's also friendly, and he likes to help others whenever he can. I think in the manual somewhere it says he's a young dolphin, so I figured he's not quite an adult yet, or maybe a young adult. I always figured he was kind and caring, and generally quiet. He also has a lot of inner strength, and a strong connection to his family and friends. And he has strong determination, never gives up.I think that he was probably a reluctant hero type. He wasn't looking to be a hero, he just kinda got dragged into it without any choice. His family was taken away and he had to find them. Along the way other events occured, and some of the things he did caused more things to happen that he had to take care of. He was the only one who could do all of this. And he ended up being the only one with the power to stop the Vortex. I think he was perfectly happy to remain home where he was in normal daily life, but was sucked into all this and had no choice but to go through it all. Well...he had a choice but the only other option would be to do nothing and let the world come to an end. But he wouldn't allow that to happen.So I think he's also brave, and has a good heart.That was longer than I planned.Yup, Id have to agree with Tethy on this one, Ecco is your classic "hero' undiluted, un-adjusted, like a hero realy should be, modest, noble, self sacrificing, hes what many humans could really learn from.

Awesome! Thanks guys. I guess ive just been more ecco influenced as of late...i found a sega genesis, tides of time, and ecco 1 with box and instructions all for a cool 30 bucks...plus ecco cd for 10 bucks...so ive been having a hayday.Ive also been doing a lot of reading lately. Namely, Journey to the west...Reading that, playing ecco. reading that, playing ecco. The two activities for me basically became one activity...and for some odd reason, doing both of these things just fit...Journey to the west has a strange layout....every single chapter has the characters fighting a common enemy, doing a common thing. At the end of the chapter, the problem is usually resolved, almost like its episodes of a show, or levels in a gameThis reminded me of the project I wanted to undertake to "novelize" ecco, which was something that never got finished, because of the massive scope of the process.I have been writing lots since then, and have come up with something I want to do. I DO want to novelize ecco still, or at least, interpretations of it, and I am. This time though, instead of being all at once like the original plan, Ive opted something much simpler; novelize each level of both ecco games seperately, and post them weekly...Like episodes of a tv show. Of course, the chapters will be elaborated beyond the original scope of the game. there were indeed levels in ecco which could be completed in a mere minute, like atlantis levels...and there was very little character developement (how much does a dolphin need to develop, I guess?) so these things will be elaborated quite a bit. I unfortunately just came up with this idea, so i dont have anything at the moment...But by the end of the weekend hopefully, I will have it written down...then I will transfer it onto computer, and submit it.As I said, its just going to be my interpretation. It will remain as true to the series as possible, and I DO promise that no major plot points will be disturbed (Ecco having to destroy vortex machinery on earth, ala the ecco the dolphin comic.) Some characters like Kitnee, big blue, blackfin, etc. will be bigger players at some points as well, not just talking heads, but the flow of the overall story will not be disturbed.If anyone has a level special to them that they want to do the same with, send me a pm, and maybe we can work something out...guest writers, and things like that. It would involve everyone in the community, which is something that would do the ecco scene good, and it would take the load of 60 or so chapters that id otherwise be doing alone (I expect each chapter is going to run around 4000-5000 words)Questions? Comments? Want to try your hand at the Ecco Novelizing Project?Also, I put in my fanfare an explenation...it contains details of the layout...how the things gonna work.http://arkonviox.com/modules.php?op=modload&name=Chronus&file=clm&func=view&id=61

I did some modifications to the storyline; so here it is summed up.After Ecco vanishes in time all seems safe at first, although the Vortex threat still exists, reinforcments will soon come from the home world; the planet Vortex.A daughter to the Vortex Queen will establish a hive high in our orbit known as "The Web", and with this new evil she will bring a powerful drone the oldest and strongest of the Vortex known by dolphins as the Vortex King..But thats not all, a clan of of orcas who call themselves the Seven Dark Whales of Apacalypes; seek to aid the Vortex, in reviving what had once been known as the Dark Vortex Future. There task; to destroy Dolphin kind and find the ancient race of Atlantean Dolphins called "The Thirians" who hold a powerful armor strong enough to defeat armies of Vortex, the armor known as "The Wings of Burden", which is belived to be worn by the thirian god and savior of the future Arkonviox.This triggers time to split into two once again, allowing Ecco the abilitie to return to sew the threads of time together again. His return means great danger, his friend the asterite has fallen under a great infection, the cause, a creature who manefested from the tides of time, and created itself from the Asterite, a creature who's purpose is to destroy Ecco, a creature created from Ecco's worse fears, a creature known as Vernineus.Ecco will seek the help of Crestoe, the last of the thirians, to find the ancient Dolphin Armor, but instead they find the burdened wearer Arkonviox, who will betray them and fall into the trap of the dark whales.Ecco will fight the vortex defeat the queen and king, and face the dark whales in a final fight for the future, he will face the apacalypes itself and the black portal time machine created by the ancient civilization of mu to draw power from time. Arkonviox will come to redeem himself and help Ecco but become a victim to the black portal along with a dark whale from the future who will rule the world.Then all will seem safe, except; The Asterite has been abducted by Vernineus, and taken into the tides of time, Ecco seeks the time machine to follow them but in following them he relizes the final danger of time travel, and the retribution he will have to pay, the destruction of time itself!The world, the universe are destroyed, but an unsuspecting Arkonviox who finds himself trapped in the dead dark future along with Apacalypes; the great dark whale, don't relize it at first, until they start to see the effects of there glitchy world.It is the dark future alright, but the demension is unstable, and to liberate it from intire destruction Arkonviox must save the future and time itself by destroying apacalypes who was never ment to exist. And with apacalypes destruction all seems like it should have gone back to normal.But then a new world is created, the world that was hidden and ment to be found, a future that was hidden between the two, where Ecco will meet his destiny.Ecco finds himself a victim of a clan of dolphins who have destroyed most of the world, known as the Earth Clan, lead by an enimie unknown to Ecco known as Sitna. But sitna doesnt ring a bell, who is this strange dolphin warrior? the answer lies in atlantis, and even with the dolphin god himself apollo, and Ecco finds in order to stop sitna he must work alongside apollo to find the one who created atlantean technology, the one who put ecco in this world to stop the vortex in the future and save time itself, a Dolphin atlantean named Atla. But Atla is not easy to find, the only map to him is upon Ecco's head, the constallation delphineus, dephnineus represents Apollo's rise to the heavens, so Apollo is who should lead Ecco to atla, but Apollo teaches Ecco the dark secret, in order for Atla to return Ecco and Apollo must combine together, to which Atla will be reborn. They combine and Ecco reawakens stronger wiser, and now knowing his purpose, he was once atla, who's job is to destroy sitna, who will trie to destroy time itself, and return the world and universe to nothingness.Atla and Sitna have a final battle but the battle causes the destruction of time anyways, and creates a giant ripple causing time to repeat itself.the only clue at the end of the game thats left is the clue in the names of good and evil. Atla - Sitna, sitna spelled backwards Antis. Atla - Antis; Atlantis, the people who created time travel, and when attacked by the Vortex traveled into a further past to found the ancient civilization of MU, to which MU was destroyed by the black portal time machine, all the people were sucked into the tides of time, and even time itself started to become unstable. the battle between Atla and Sitna creates an Echo in time allowing the events of MU to take place again, but this time those involved in MU's destruction will have a chance to stop it and save the universe.

Thanks guys. I think it was me who did that whole science thing. Unfortunately, I dont even have a computer anymore...Im on my stepdads...so I could never get anything like that done. all I remember is putting a nonsensical amount of effort into explaining the obscure tube ecco has to travel through (mind you, the explanation came out rather dumb.) Anyways, I have halfway completed the first chapter/episode/phase, whatever you want to call it, which describes the hero ecco, his home, his friends, and consequently, how they are all sucked away into a vortex coming down from space. Pretty sad. Anyways, ecco is mischevious. Maybe he isnt meant to be, but in this interpretation, hes a very intelligent dolphin, who knows just how smart he is. Hes tricky.Infact, much of the first chapter explains how smart he is through his encounter with Blackfin, who happens to be his rival of sorts. Ecco as you know, is special. different...this story explains it many different ways. Unlike most dolphins, ecco has actually sight. He can see with his eyes, and song. This can be justified in many parts of the actual game...the fact that in the sea of darkness, he requires song to see. (wouldnt he be able to see if his eyes were only activated through song, no matter how dark it was? why was it like that? he must have had a default vision.) He can leap higher, and move faster then most. (How high in the sky can you fly?) Some say that dolphins cant see with there eyes, so this is what i used as a tool in my story, to seperate ecco from the rest of his kind.As you can see already, this is a much more lighthearted novelization then most of the ecco series. A lot of it is done in a light manner. Ecco is by no means a smart aleck, but he is sly in his ways, especially in dealing with his many foes. How could a dolphin so easily defeat, and surpass the huge obstacles that he does if he wasnt so tricky? serious parts will stay serious (most of the second ecco game) but parts that can be bent will probably be, to make room for more explanation.Anyways, thats what the first episode will entail. The second will be eccos encounter with Kitnee, (who happens to be a friend of his) and the first of the many glyphs, and whatever the hell they are. As you can see, its a level to level basis, the chapter after that covering the encounter in the undercaves with the eight arms.As you can see, im pretty pumped about this story. Super pumped. I think its going to be pretty awesome. Anyone who wants to contribute, let me know.

The deadly Vorphins roamed around in the past, and if they were not destroyed in time, that peaceful future could change forever. 'Upon discovering a portal, Zephyr, a young spinner dolphin, is thrown into an epic adventure in the past to wipe out the Vorphins, and save time itself.'Pretty epic, huh? I always make blurbs sound weird...anyway, send in yours A.S.A.P!- Demon

Good writing you have.Few lines translated from German and taken from my huge book project Stella Mea, the lovestory between Soleila and Asterite (beware, the language still sucks).'Lost in an ocean of impressions he swam in his cave and felt increasingly dismayed searching for a reality that he knew - silence. If Soleila just could be with him, he thought sadly, and remembered the gentle words she told him to promise her support during the near gathering. The power of this imagination became so strong that he nearly was able to see her standing in front of him. Her shadow floated in the entrance of his chamber, she watched him with feelings he could only suspect, tried to be quiet and smiled ashamedly after he showed her that he had noticed her presence. When he remembered this moment, an overwhelming silence surrounded him, Soleila even appeared more clearly but still was hard to see. Despairedly he tried to touch her, forced her to come closer but... "Asterite! Where are you with your thoughts!?" He shivered, Soleila disappeared from the entrance of his cave and her shape was replaced by two dolphin bodies.'

That's all pretty interesting, and there seems to be alot of truth to it. Of course, I have no idea how Cayce could have really known all that would actually happen. I must say though, I'm not sure what to think of his predictions of Jesus returning. Being as I'm not a Christian or even religious, I don't believe in things of that nature....but also, so many of the other predictions turned out to be true. And his 'spiritual battle'? Though it would be nice to think that we could have 1000 years of peace on Earth.Of course, so many prophecies and the like are so vague that it's hard to say if things are true. Though from the actual predictions that were on the site in his own words, seemed he wasn't being vague at all about things. I guess I'm not really sure what to think on the subject.This interested me though--"..where there has been a frigid or semi-tropical climate, there will be a more tropical one, and moss and fern will grow."And as for MaBus, I do believe that if Bush gets re-elected he'll do something stupid that will end up plunging us into war. Thanks for coming up with Edgar Cyce. I never read his predictions and theories and studied Nostradamus much more. In fact Nostradamus did not truly predict Hitler, Stalin, Sadam Hussein etc. He wrote a lot of books that were lost during the middle ages and because the Inquisiton fought him, he hadn't have alot of time when he was young. When he was older, he was protected by the Spanish Queen and some friends in higher ranks. They hid him somewhere and it was very late in his life when he finally got the chance to concentrate on his predictions. That's why huge parts of his work got lost but what I truly wanted to say is that his original works show vague imaginations only. People in the 20th century started to interprete his work and then, after the World Wars already have happened, it was kinda easy to say that he was able to predict everything. So I doubt that he had clear visions. For me he was just pretty good at imagining how the world developes. I don't want to say that Nostradamus had no gifts, he truly had them but most of it all was pure interpretation and speculation. Regarding Edgar Cyce's work I'm much more impressed. It makes alot of sense to me even though I never studied Atlantis deeply. I should take a more careful look at all of it and it sounds like a key to me. Thanks for posting this. Maybe I will find out more when I finally gain more interest in Atlantis which seems to have more influence on the world than I ever expected.

I'm wondering about this topic for a very long time and I often asked myself if normal people are able to predict their own future. There are so many possibilities and I tried a lot of them. The reason is not that I absolutely want to find out about my own future but I want to find out if this stuff is all a big lie or if there is something behind it. First of all I will explain my own experiences and tries:I tried reading tarot cards and went to a professional foreteller but all they said was that you can ask some common questions about your life and the answers they give are so vague that you are always able to interprete them in a suitable way. The people I talked to only predicted some stuff that usually happens to anyone in the world, they look at your face, calculate about your family life or expectations and your personality, read in you and give you some suitable replies. That's why I don't believe in tarot, hand-reading or foretellers but I believe that there are a very few persons that have dreams and visions. Sometimes I have dreams about the future too but I don't think that they are visions. They are just imaginations about the way life could go on and it's not difficult to have such imaginations when you regard things and when you just open your mind and your eyes to notice some facts most people would be too blind for to see. There is truly nothing special about this kind of reading and so I gave up visiting foretellers because their only gift is looking at you and knowing more about you than you would confess. Same goes for other systems like card games, runes, gems, dices etc... It's all only vague and nothing that really shows a way but maybe one of you has made different experiences.Anyway, I went on with my studies and tried to use a pendulum. These things do not work for many people, you need to use a suitable one and you need to be open for it. Mine worked immediately but it completely went wrong. There are two answers a pendulum can give - yes and no. You just take it and hold it over something (a photo or a symbol that represents your question) and it starts to react when you have the right connection. Mine reacted very well but after a while I found out that it only gave me answers that I expected. If you ask a question, you have own deep expectations about an answer and the pendulum only represents your own will and your personal feelings. That was all and it truly didn't satisfy me. You can try it, it's easy and all people freak out when they do it for the first time and when it works. On first sight the pendulum seems to live and to have a free will but believe me, it's only your own will that controls it. Maybe it's even a very mild kind of telepathy. You'll see, it's fun.After all of this did not work I decided to use a further pretty interesting chance that was really cool. My mother has a book for numerological calculations (arithmantic I think). This is not a way to foretell the future but it gives the user a chance to anaylize the personality/sense of even completely foreign people or events/dates. She started to work with it and made such calculations for friends, relatives and later for foreign people too. Now she is pretty advanced and knows her stuff very well which impresses me. Foreign people ask her to make these calculations and she is so good now, that they call her on the phone after she sent the results to her 'customers' who often are extremely surprised and tell my mother that she is completly right and that it's a wonder. At the moment she has no time to work them out but in winter she will go on I think. Her essays are kinda long and run deeper than the common crap a tarot would tell you. They explain the personality and it's impossible to interprete them in a way to make them suitable for anyone. This fact surprised me and the system is truly scientific and interesting. It's based on the fact that your parents give you a name when you are born or that friends give you a nickname when you meet people later in life (or that you choose a nickname on your own). These names are your personal fate and you can calculate them using the numerological system. Unfortunately people found out that they can make money with that topic and so a lot of fake books are around. The book my mother uses is older, was one of the first translations for that system and newer books don't work so well. Maybe it also exists in English and I will check it. I searched for an English website about the system but all of them were lame compared to the stuff my mother found out using her book. Maybe this is a true chance to see through things but I'm not sure. I'm going to learn this too and my final question refers to the experiences people here made. Did you ever try anything like this, are you interested in it and what do you think is believable or not?

I made up this thread on the other board and because it became very popular there, I regreted that I did not post it here too. Anyway, if someone of you likes to tell his/her own story about the way he/she found this site and the Ecco games, feel free to reply. Tell your personal story about how everything started for you and why you are still here.That's my own one:My way to Ecco and the Ecco CommunityIn 1993 when I was 13 years old, the Sega Mega Drive or Genesis ruled my whole world. To be honest, I had nothing else to do and wasted all the time, that other girls would waste with riding or staring at posters of some dumb ass popstars, with playing Sonic games. Sonic was my hero, it was great how many parts the series had and I never felt bored. One day I decided to go to a shop with my mother (wow, I went outside), it was raining and we found a shelf with many old cheap Sega games. I searched through all of them and did not find anything that was able to catch my interest because there simply was no further Sonic game I had not tried yet. But suddenly my mother discovered an interesting-looking game and showed it to me. At first sight the game looked very boring, it was absolutely not Sonic-ish and I did not want to spend money for it (15 DM haha). So we went out of the shop but near the entrance I realized the fact that I could not go away without a game and begged my mother to wait. I ran back in and bought it without expecting anything good from it but when I tried it at home, I freaked out and loved it from the beginning on. The reason was the cool design and the way to control the dolphin which was kinda difficult. I played and played and was very impressed by Bigblue and his words about the Asterite. When I first heard the name, I tried to imagine what something like an Asterite could be and so I played on curiously. When I finally reached Deep Water and met him for the first time, I thought that he was a graphic bug or a strange underwater plant. I swam around him and expected attacks and even as he talked to me, I did not get that THIS thing was the Asterite. I hurried away without understanding a word of the English language and after a while, when there still wasn't anything that could be an Asterite, I had to accept that the thing I found in Deep Water must have been what I was looking for (man, I was so stupid). Then I wasn't able to stop thinking about that creature. I started a new game, played from the beginning on and translated the text passages with the help of my older sister. An obsession was born and the Asterite was what fascinated me about the game. I played it through (I was so shocked by the level Dark Water) for one time and after that I only played the level Deep Water using a password. Many hours were spent with looking at Asterite, I drawed him and started to interprete his text passages. Fastly I became more and more obsessed and few weeks or months later I read about Tides of Time in the Sega Magazine. That was extremely great, I bought it but it depressed me and the storyline was not very nice for me. It seriously broke my heart to see him dying and I did not understand the end of the game where he still lived. Because it made me so sad and secondly because I started to have something like a life and went out with real friends, I started to forget about the Asterite and the games after I played ToT through. I left Ecco for a very long while but the obsession with Asterite somehow remained. Ten years later after I received my internet connection and started to talk in chatrooms, I met a new friend in the Mystcommunity- forums and one day (it was the 4th July 2003) we started to talk about Ecco. Immediately I remembered the games and especially the Asterite and so he sent me an emulator and made me play the game again. I used cheats to reach Deep Water and everything came back to me. One day later I registered at COH and met many new people there. It was a strange feeling that this community and Arkonviox.com existed for so long and that I never took part. That made me sad and because all my old obsessions were back, I decided to stay there and to write a theory about the Asterite. I just wanted to make him more famous and familiar to the people and I also wanted to be accepted as his biggest fan in the world. Few weeks later I begann to write a book about Asterite and a second part is planned. I published my theories and later I also registered here at Arkonviox.com where it was also really cool and interesting. Talking to a true Ecco expert I was able to finalize my theory with Arkon's help and now I would say that I'm really attached to both sites. I simply love to be around, I'm still sad that I wasn't here from the beginning on but it's time to say 'thank you' and to give all of you a big hug. It's great that we still exist and you brought me something back that makes me truly happy...

Anyway, I went on with my studies and tried to use a pendulum. These things do not work for many people, you need to use a suitable one and you need to be open for it. Mine worked immediately but it completely went wrong. There are two answers a pendulum can give - yes and no. http://www.antiqnet.com/detail%2C1960s-kreskins-esp%2C165541.htmlme and friends use one to talk to dumbass spirit dudes untill some of us got a very shady form of teliphaty with them.you can make one your self, just put the alphabet on a semi circule and the penndululum will go to the letters. it is slow and somtimes you might not get words.

Hm. Well, I was probably about 8 when I first played Ecco. I rented Tides of Time because it had a dolphin on the cover and I had a fondness for dolphins. I remember I could never get past the level Two Tides (such is your fate when you're a little kid). We had to return the game and that's all the farther I had gotten in it. But a year or so later when I was with my dad at a mall, we were looking around at the games and I saw Tides of Time and so I bought it. I didn't realize until some time later that ToT wasn't the first Ecco game--alot of it didn't make sense (things like "When you saved your pod the Vortex queen followed you to earth" because he'd never saved his pod in that game....) For awhile my dad was the only one who had the internet and since I don't live with him I hardly ever got the chance to get online. But once when I was probably 12 or 13 I was at his house and typed 'ecco' into a search engine hoping to find pics or something, can't remember exactly. But the link to the Undercaves site was one of the first things to pop up and I found that site facisnating. I used to go to the chat whenever I was at my dad's. I finally got my own computer and the internet when I was 14 and was saddened to find that Undercaves was no longer up and running the way it used to. But I also remember another site I had looked at, which happened to be this one. So I came back here and signed up. And I've been here ever since.

Hm. I've never really tried these things, but I do find the subject interesting. You didn't mention much about astrology and horoscopes. Not that I believe these kinds of things, quite the contrary--I find it rediculous that someone might think that these are always true. The same problem with most ways of fortune-telling and the like. It's always so vague. And there are so many people in the world--to think that all of them have the same horoscope and the same things happen to them, or whatever. I was going to experiment with rune-casting, I got a book on it and was going to make my own runes but never got around to it. That, too, is up to your own interpretation of the way the runes fall. As for dreams and visions, I have had a few dreams that the next day something like that happens--nothing monumental, maybe it's just something a friend does or something that happens. So who's to say that dreams can't really predict the future? That's what Deja Vu is, or so I believe.

hmm, i wouldnt call myself as part of any ecco community, i have barely played any of the games...Im here for the music, and that is all...so yeah to those who havent, check out the thread that is uhmmm down a liitle bit for some music lol:Doh and uhmmmHI!

Hmm...well, I can't remember if I saw the ad first or just saw the game at the rental place. But, either way, I thought it was just the coolest thing in the world that there was a game where you could play as a dolphin. I mean, I've always loved dolphins. So I had to rent it, and, even though I couldn't get past the second level, I found it to be the most fun game I have ever played, besides Sonic. I loved just jumping around and doing tricks. So I rented it a few more times before I actually got the game. And then I was really excited when I saw the ad for the second one.I can't remember how old I was. I'm gonna guess about 10. Can someone tell me how long ago the first game came out?As for the Ecco community, well I never in my wildest dreams imagined that there would actually be an Ecco web site out there. I didn't know anyone who had even heard of Ecco, except for a couple of my friends but only cuz I showed them the game. Even though it's not as popular as other games, I still didn't think it could be even as popular as it is now. It never occurred to me to look for an Ecco site. Otherwise I may have found this place sooner, that or Caverns of Hope, or the Undercaves or maybe another older site. Anyway, it's really Arkon's fault that I'm here. I got an e-mail from him asking if I wanted to participate in an art contest. Of course I was interested, but I didn't wanna say I'd do it right away, cuz I wasn't sure if it was some sort of scam or something. So I asked for more information, and got a link back to this site in response. And of course I was very excited to find that it was in fact an Ecco website. I went and checked the forums, it looked interesting, and so I decided to join.This is the first forum I ever joined, and, in fact, currently it's the only one I'm a member of besides Gaia.

When you're a certain age you think everything you do is good. And this person just doesn't seem to have that....

I dunno why this didn't occur to me before. But if these places were real, how come they didn't leave any history behind? If they were such an advanced society, they must have had some form of writing. So how come nothing like that has ever been found? Why is it that the memory of these places wasn't passed down? How come nobody can trace their origins back to these civilizations? Why is the evidence so slim?It just seems like, if such places existed, there should be something left for us to find...things that actually prve their existence. We should be able to find out about them the same way we find out about other ancient civilizations.And, how is it possible to have had advanced civilizations at a time when humans had just barely evolved.Why are there no remains of these people?I mean, I WANT to beleive it, but things just don't add up. It all sounds so surrealistic. I'm not saying it's not possible, it just doesn't fit in with all we already know about the human race and how we evolved...how the earth evolved. Well, okay, what we "know" is mostly theory, but it's backed up quite well. And there is a "rule" in science that says the simplest answer is probably the correct one, as that has been the case with any discovery. But this Atlantis and MU stuff seems overly complicated.Besides....if this all turns out to be real....it might not be as interesting anymore.Hmm....but on the other hand....it would be pretty cool to be a reincarnation of someone from Atlantis.

Not that I really beleive it....I mean I think he was a great man and all, but more than likely attributed to things he did not actually do, and turned into something greater because people loved him so much.
