I only read the first couple paragraphs but I just wanna say this, because otherwise I might forget while reading the rest. I think fortune tellers work like magicians and those people who claim to talk to ghosts. They make judgements by closely watching your reactions, and from things that are common amongst most people. And they're really vague, like you said, so what they say can be easily interpreted in any way. So something would happen, and you'd be like "OMG that fortune teller said such and such, they must have meant this!"As for predicting the future, if it's even possible there are only two ways I can think of that you could do it. One would be to have a prophetic dream. And the other would be to go into a kind of trance, as if almost possessed or something, and speak a prophecy, like Sybil Trelawny did in that one scene in Harry Potter. Though the dream theory seems more likely. But with dreams it's really kind of the same way as with fortune telling. You only remember peices of the dream, so it's pretty vague usually. So it's easy to experience something and then relate it with something you once saw in a dream. Now it might be more likely if you had an extremely vivid dream, and wrote it all down right after waking up. But that would be very rare.I beleive some people do have special gifts, that they are able to tap into more parts of the brain then most people are able to. But it's extremely rare, and I imagine people that are really the real deal probably wouldn't go around parading it. I mean if I had a gift like that, I wouldn't wanna tell anyone because they'd probably think I was crazy. As for foreseeing the future, if anyone can do it, it would really just be seeing a possible future. There's an infinite number of paths the future can take, and the path that is taken is decided every second by the things people do and the decisions they make. Not just people, but also animals, and nature. Everything contributes. So I don't think anyone can really predict the future. If anything, they would only be able to see possibilites. Maybe it would be possible to see what the most likely events would be based on the current path. But that path can change at any time.

Anyway, I went on with my studies and tried to use a pendulum. These things do not work for many people, you need to use a suitable one and you need to be open for it. Mine worked immediately but it completely went wrong. There are two answers a pendulum can give - yes and no. You just take it and hold it over something (a photo or a symbol that represents your question) and it starts to react when you have the right connection. Mine reacted very well but after a while I found out that it only gave me answers that I expected. If you ask a question, you have own deep expectations about an answer and the pendulum only represents your own will and your personal feelings. That was all and it truly didn't satisfy me. You can try it, it's easy and all people freak out when they do it for the first time and when it works. On first sight the pendulum seems to live and to have a free will but believe me, it's only your own will that controls it. Maybe it's even a very mild kind of telepathy. You'll see, it's fun. Asking a pendulum is little more reliable than asking an 8 ball. It's just your own touch that makes them move. You can make little movements with your fingers without even realizing it. That's all that goes on with those things. You're right, though, it's your own will that makes it move in a sense. You are basically unconsciously moving it towards whatever you want, by those small movements.Oh and btw, moving something with your mind is telekinesis, or also called psychokinesis.The last thing you talked about is called arithmancy. I don't really know anything about it, though. But somehow it seems improbable that you can get stuff like that just from someone's name. Wouldn't that mean it would be the same for two people with the same name? And most times parents don't really put a lot of thought into what they name their kids. They'll just choose a name they happen to like because they like the way it sounds. That makes it almost random, and it doesn't seem like you should really be able to tell anything from that. After all your name is just a word.Hm. I've never really tried these things, but I do find the subject interesting. You didn't mention much about astrology and horoscopes. Not that I believe these kinds of things, quite the contrary--I find it rediculous that someone might think that these are always true. The same problem with most ways of fortune-telling and the like. It's always so vague. And there are so many people in the world--to think that all of them have the same horoscope and the same things happen to them, or whatever. I agree with you. Besides that, the Zodiac is based on the constellations the sun passes through, and there are really 13 now. So even if that did make any difference over peoples' lives, what they say now is messed up because the dates are no longer accurate, and haven't been for centuries. As for the predictions, what you read in the paper is really vague. And it's different depending on where you read it. Some magazines don't even put predictions, they just say "you are a person who ------", just something about your personality. There may have been a time when people made more accurate predictions based on the stars...if such a thing is really possible, that is. But now they just have someone who makes things up off the top of their heads. I remember once reading in my horoscope that I was supposed to throw a party. But that contradicts the personality profile for Virgo. Showing they didn't even bother to match things up. Now I find myown personality fits in pretty well with how a Virgo is supposed to be. But my mom is an Aries and she's just the opposite. So it's mostly coincidence.Then there's the Ouja board, which is fun, but it's the same prinicipal as the pendulum. You make it move, whether you realize it or not, by what you want or expect. And certainly if that kind of thing actually did work, it would have to be a real one, rather than something made by a game company.I do find these t3hings interesting. But most methods I don't think really work.

Well you have a point. There are a lot of things in science that people generally take to be fact, but they're really just theories because we haven't found a way to prove them yet. As certain as these things seem, they could one day turn out to be wrong. After all, people used to be really certain that the earth was the center of the universe, and that flies spontaneously generated from rancid meat. There's still the idea that this all seems overly complicated. But...then that could be just how it seems now because we don't have enough information. The answer could turn out to be very simple.Thing about gods, though, I thought people just told stories about them to explain things they couldn't explain. And they needed powerful beings to be able to do these things. But that's still an interesting idea. I've been reading this book on Celtic mythology and it talks about the gods as if they were an entire race. In fact the gods eventually became the fair folk or fairies. The stories talked about a few different groups, including gods and giants, that inhabited Ireland before the Irishmen--the mortals--actually arrived. From reading this book it sounded like these gods were people that the Celts ran into when they first arrived at Ireland, and for some reason or another thought they were gods. But no one could figure out the exct identity of these people, though there are some theories. But if what you say is really true, than perhaps it was this advanced civilization that they came across. It would make sense, if such a civilization actually existed. Also, it'sd been a while since I read this part, but I seem to remember a breif mention of some land that was like an Eden, a land similar to Atlantis and the like. Such places are quite common in European mythology, actually.I have beleived that mythology of any kind is based more or less on things that are real. Like some of the battles the Greek gods fought reflected actual battles. So it makes perfect sense that Atlantis and Mu are based on some place or culture that actually existed. But things tend to get twisted around in stories and evolve into something much greater than they actually were. Someone who did some good deed is transformed in legend into a mighty hero who did a great deal more than the actual person ever did or could even be capable of. Well I'm just kinda going off on a tangent here so I'll stop there.

As a bit of side information, looking at the shape of the glyphs, they seem to be a form of quartz crystal. This fit in brilliantly with what happens in the game since quarts has the ability to change shape when you induce an electrical field to it, and also discharge elecrical field if foced to change its shape. Sound familliar? Seen it in the game perhaps? And for that matter we use quarts to tell time with in modern day watches. Those guys in Apaloosa really did their homework.

As a bit of side information, looking at the shape of the glyphs, they seem to be a form of quartz crystal. This fit in brilliantly with what happens in the game since quarts has the ability to change shape when you induce an electrical field to it, and also discharge elecrical field if foced to change its shape. Sound familliar? Seen it in the game perhaps? And for that matter we use quarts to tell time with in modern day watches. Those guys in Apaloosa really did their homework.Wow, really? you know the egyptians belvied there gods once actualy lived and where pharohs.theres one such interesting story about a king named king scorpion, who was the very first pharoh to rule both the south and the north, after that began the pharohs we come to know. anyways king scropion or as some of us might know him as the scorpion king was said to be the kind to start writing; before the mesopotanians; so writing came into existence because it was ordered to be, they used it to basicaly mark recepits for goods they traded then it became a writing system.they found proof of king scorpion recently so he exists.but before him it was belived the gods were kings; perhalps they were real but there stories were exaggerated.the story of Osiris and seth, how osiris was betrayed by his evil brother, who killed him and chopped him into pieces scattering those pieces all over egypt. and how anubis and osiris wife gathered those pieces and restored him together, bringing him back to life so he could travel to the afterlife, allowing him to be free. you know after the egyptians were starting to convert to one god they had a new god which was a combination of RA and a god named Amen who was introduced to egypt.anyhow Amen-Ra is the reaosn why at the end of prayers we say amen because the egyptians did this to ebgin and end there prayers, so in a way we are paying tribute to Amen-Ra the egyptian sun god.

Yeah I knew about Amen-Ra (or Amon-Re). But I didn't know about the amen thing.But actually the singular god was called Aten. The king Atnaten (not sure if I spelled it right) was the first of the pharoahs to beleive in one god...but he wasn't well liked because the people still refused to beleive there could only be one god. His name was originally Atnamen, but he changed it to the name of his god. His son Tutenkaten changed Egypt's religion back over to polytheism and changed his name to Tutenkamen...the one we know as King Tut.I don't know very much about Egyptian mythology though. I'd like to learn more about it.

You have good points, Arkon, but I still can't say I have much faith in the human race.Not that I'm all for war or anything, but don't you think things might be kinda boring if everything was all peaceful and stuff? And besides that, I don't think that it should be that way...I mean I don't think the world is meant to be that way. How can you know what happiness is if you've never been sad? How can you understand peace if there's no war? When there's war and strife and struggle, we learn to appreciate the things we have. Without that, it's all just taken for granted. And without all those problems, without any suffering, no one can really truly be happy. It's just like you said, the world must be balanced, you can't have good without evil. Well that means you can't have peace without war, you can't have happiness without suffering. The world would just be really gray and dull without all that stuff. Sure everyone hates war, but that's just a part of how things are, and I don't think we can really exist without it. Not the way were meant to.I would reccommend reading The Giver. It's a young adult novel, but it's still very good no matter what age you are. And it illustrates my point perfectly. It takes place in the future, where the world is perfect. War, crime, poverty, and hate have all been eliminated. But it can only be done with certain sacrifices. And the biggest sacrifice is true happiness. Sure people are content, but they can't understand true happiness because they've never experienced greif. All memory of anything that might be painful is all but wiped out, with just a single person to carry on the burden. But it's not just sad memories they're missing, but happy ones as well...memories of all the things they no longer have. The really sad thing is the people don't have the ability to love. They don't know the true meaning of the word. If you can't feel love, you can't be truly happy. And that's what would happen if we got rid of all the things we see as problems in our world. You couldn't get rid f those things without also sacrificing some things, some of the things that are truly wonderful in this world.So as much as I hate war, I can't forsee a world without it, and I'm not so sure that such a future would really be so great anyway.

Quartz and Rochelle salts show the phenomenon of piezo-electricity, or development of electric charge as a result of pressure. A suitable piece will show a difference of potential on two of its faces as high as several hundred volts, when vigorously twisted. If properly cut, will develop a few volts difference of potential between its opposite faces, when squeezed. These crystals develop a charge when their shape is changed, and as the phenomenon is a reversible one, they change their shape when charged.This peculiar action makes it possible to control the frequency of oscillation of a triode by the mechanical vibration of a piece of quartz. Now quartz is, mechanically, a very perfect material; it is extremely elastic, having almost no loss due to viscosity. A piece of quartz, started into mechanical oscillation by a blow, will bivrate for a very long time, as compared to steel and other elastic materials. Quartz then requires but very little energy supply to maintain it in mechanical oscillation. Weather conditions and temperature have practically no effect on the elastic properties of quartz, so that the natural period of vibration of a piece of quartz is practically a constant; certainly it is constant to a very small fraction of 1 per cent.A normal quartz crystal is somewhat hexagonal in form, more or less pointed at one end. The longitudinal axis of the crystal is called its optical axis; polarized light sent through the crystal along its axis will have its plane of polarization rotated, either clockwise or counter-clockwise, as the crystal is a right or left-handed one. Sometimes a crystal, during its period of formation starts to grow right handed and the stops and grows the other way. Such crystals are said to be "twinned." This twinned structure is not evident to the eye but must be investigated by the action of polarized light or similar test. It is possible to find a crystal which has grown in several layers, alternate layers having opposite rotations.What? You got me started :P

Okay, violence and hate still exist today but maybe we will achieve more in thousand further years because we learn and move away from what makes us so blind today. Well my ecco experience will live on with me until the day i die. Heres how it all got started.I was 6 yrs old, my mom had just went birthday shopping for my older brother. When he opend the present containing ecco the dolphin, i have to say the cover looked awesome. Dolphins have been my favorite animal ever since I was 3. I told him to try it out. First thing I remember was the huge storm that happend out of nowhere. I always blamed myself for it.(I blamed myself because I told my brother to see how high he could jump....LOL) From then on I wanted to constantly play that game. My brother thought it was stupid and boring so he gave it to me. The tides of time. I was so happy to see that game. I had no idea that it even existed. It was so awesome. I put it in and immediatly started playing it. For the next 4 years I played it and loved it. Some time later on(about 4 years ago) I was reading this magazine, it had a picture of ecco the dolphin and I said kool, thats when I read that it was a new ecco game coming out for the sega dreamcast. I was so happy to read this. That christmas I got a dreamcast with Ecco: DoTF. I was very dissapointed with the game, I absoloutly hated it. I found out that there was no connection with the tides of time or anything. I almost cried because I loved the story of the originals so much. After a few weeks of playing I finally just stoped caring and played it. If the game would of continued the story of the originals it would of been the best ecco game ever.

Well, i am sorry to say but I just dont like what you have done with your story of Ecco the dolphin. His entire personality is completly diffrent than what I have thought for so many years. You put:"No such force in this world could ever take something that far. Surely, my friends are in the next pool. I will find them there, eating all the yellow fish they can find, and mocking me for being so silly, and laughing that I was so blind to stay here, like a fool! Those malicious singers are just playing a game with me, thats all!" This makes Ecco seem like he wasnt scared or nervous. His life was full of woners and joys but then his entire world that he knew and loved was taken from him in the blink of an eye. I always thought ecco was so scared that he swam very far away from his home and ended up on level 2. lolHis attitude should of been complelty diffrent, fix that and you will have a great story...

No, there really is no connection except for Ecco himself. They call it a sequel because it has the same name. You can think of it as kind of like Final Fantasy, and a lot of other RPG series, where the stories of each game has nothing to do with any of the others, but they release them under the same title because it's familiar and more people will buy it. DotF is no more a sequel to ToT than PSO is a sequel to Phantasay Star IV. There are no glyphs, or at least the term glyph is never used. There is no Asterite. The Foe bear no resemblance to the Vortex. None of the characters that appeared in the previous games, besides Ecco himself, make any appearance in DotF. The story does not follow or even intertwine with the stories of the previous games in any way that I could see. They didn't even explain how Ecco got out of the tides of time, which he was said to have been trapped in at the end of ToT. In fact, when I read the instruction manual, it talks about Ecco as if he had never been in the tides of time, had never traveled to the past and future, had never had any of the adventures he had in the other games. It gives the impression this Ecco was born in the present of the time that the game takes place. It's as if the Ecco in DotF is a different dolphin who just happens to have the same name and markings.

hmmm, well, you do have a point. i hope arkonviox can finish his game so we can finally have a great ecco game that continues from the old one.

Well, i am sorry to say but I just dont like what you have done with your story of Ecco the dolphin. His entire personality is completly diffrent than what I have thought for so many years. You put:"No such force in this world could ever take something that far. Surely, my friends are in the next pool. I will find them there, eating all the yellow fish they can find, and mocking me for being so silly, and laughing that I was so blind to stay here, like a fool! Those malicious singers are just playing a game with me, thats all!" This makes Ecco seem like he wasnt scared or nervous. His life was full of woners and joys but then his entire world that he knew and loved was taken from him in the blink of an eye. I always thought ecco was so scared that he swam very far away from his home and ended up on level 2. lolHis attitude should of been complelty diffrent, fix that and you will have a great story...Actually it sounds like he's more in denial about what's happening, which makes perfect sense. He doesn't want to think that they've been taken, that anything out of the ordinary has happened.In any case, how do you even know what's correct in regards to Ecco's personality? We never get much of a glimpse of what he's like.

I think there is no connection because there could not be any. The reason is that the team that made DotF had no idea about what happened in the previous games. I don't know why this has happened and the only way to connect them is talking about parallel universes which I doubt to be the reason behind the games' resemblence.

They don't follow each other at all. It may be the same Ecco, but until there is an official connection that everyone can follow the games will be split. There will be just a gap there. This is all you get for your preview.There is something strange happening, the Earth is being polluted by the humans and the future is becoming dim for our hero Ecco, who is still within the tides of time. The asterite has not be completly honest with Ecco, and so he is determined to find out just whats going on. When a strange glyph is found deep within the tides of time, Ecco hears that there is another who split the stream of time in two. When Ecco tells the asterite what he heard all it would say is that deep within the tides of time, is himself. Ecco returns to the tides of time only to find that he cant figure out whats going on. In a dream he sees the big dipper, flashing over and over. When he wakes, he finds that what he saw in his dream, leads him to himself. Well there it is, the story is still under heavy construction, so this will probbly be changed as time goes by. If it stays around long enough, maybe even I too will be able to create an actual game over this. I will update this thread frequently to keep you up to date with me and my Ecco story Yes I know he has one under construction. I have talked alot with him over Ecco and his site on msn messenger.

You look like a what?

noob here! anyway i first played the first ecco the dolphin in kindergarden when i had the chicken pox. i was hooked and i was always begging my mom to go rent the game week after week. it probably took me a couple of days to figure out how to get out of home bay though! my dad who also liked the game would stay up until 1 with me and we would take turns playing levels. we got up to one of the jurassic levels, but could never get any further. i was set on not use any cheats except for the codes that they give you, so it took my the longest bloody time to beat the game. i didn't actually finish ecco until i was in like 5th grade. my brother, who i am convinced can beat any game, of course was doing laps around me finishing it in less than half a day. i finally completed it in 6th grade. i still to this day get total thrills out of reaching Big Blue or the Astrite. they just have always fascinated me.anywa ToT had already been out for a while. i just never bought it. i think N 64 was around and genesis games were pretty much long gone.well 4 years later when i heard that the ecco franchise was coming back with dotf i had a heart attack! i had to have it the day it came out!! but it was only out on dream cast, and i didnt have one.... when it did come out on PS2 i couldn't find it any where and ended up buying it from blockbuster because they said no one rented it anyway (how sad :(! ) so i've been playing it for 2 years, and still haven't finished it. to make a long story short my brother erased all of my progress off my memory card (little *&^(&). i was just starting the hatchery on top of it. and TODAY when i felt like finally starting to play again my brother has to go and slam his fist into our PS2 because he was pissed that i wouldn't use the level select cheat to just blast my way through the game to where i was originally (he also wanted to see me do heart of the foe becuase he is obsessed with beating bosses). not only did he scratch my cd in this process, some how it also was burned, i guess by the little laser thing? no, it didn't burst into flames, but there were brun marks embeded into me pride n' joy!but moving on. i recently got the ToT ROM and i have been just fooling around with it. i don't really feel like playing through the whole game. i might just use codes to beat the vortex queen, but then i won't be able to play the level after city of forever. so right now its fun to mess around on. call me crazy but i don't really like the graphics. they just look un-natural for lack of a better word.

yeah its kinda sad to think this is the last time we'll all be together, but id rather quite while im ahead then quite when i have nothing, id hate to close this site down and no one would of been there for the end. i never expected to end like this but my reasons make sense, if im ever gonna make this "dream game" i need to work on it alone, but right now i have a life calling to me and alot of broken dreams left here, until i decide when and if i want to pick up the broken fragments of the past, i need to start exploring the building blocks for a bright future. there was so much i wanted for this community and my life, but i need to leave this place, not cause i hate it but because it hurts me to be here, everytime i visit i think to myself this place could be better this place could have so much more, and i think of all that work required to make that possible. i know i can do it, but what is there left in the ecco community? we all know what we need for this community to continue, we need a new game, and i need to ethier live up to my promise or quit, so we'll see how things turn out, i worked hard on my game idea, and spent many many years learning how to do it, will i do it? i dont know yet, i'm too sad, i blame myself for not accomplishing anything i dreamed for this community, and its time i stopped and looked at this place and myself and decide whats more important?whats more important is i do what makes me happy, and follow the path that calls for me, i have a job to do and thats why im retiring, but we'll all see each other again somewhere, someplace, sometime, i'm sure of it, and it will be then we reconize those feelings and each other, and remember a feeling that was great, and a link to each other that was strong, and then again we'll have to let go.
